loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica, de 31 años, es una mujer soltera con muchas ganas de sobresalir. Vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su hija y sus dos hermanos.Para Jessica el negocio de la venta de frutas es una actividad que le ha ayudado a obtener los ingresos necesarios para poder solventar las necesidades de su familia. Este negocio lo viene realizando con su hermana desde hace más de 10 años. Su hermana aun es menor y depende de ella ya que su madre falleció y su padre se despreocupo de ella desde muy niña.Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para poder realizar algunas otras actividades, lo  que no le gusta es a veces tener que salir temprano al mercado para poder realizar las compras de sus productos, ella espera poder mas adelante retomar el trabajo de ventas de frutas para que así pueda continuar con la educación de su hermana e intentar mejorar su calidad de vida.Este es el séptimo ciclo este Jessica y la institución MFP, se lleva bien con todos los del grupo y es muy querida ya que siempre se mostró como una socia muy responsable y puntual.Con el préstamo solicitado, ella comprará frutas para poder seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Jessica, 31 years old, is a single woman with a great desire to excel. She lives in her parents' house with her daughter and her two siblings.

For Jessica, the fruit-selling business is something that has helped her earn the necessary income to meet the family's needs. She has been working in this business with her sister for more than ten years. Her sister is younger than Jessica and depends on her since their mother passed away and their father has neglected her since she was a young child.

What Jessica likes best about her work is that she has time for some other activities. What she doesn't like is that sometimes she has to leave early for the market to buy her products. She hopes to take up the fruit sales work again so she can continue paying for her sister's education and try to improve their quality of life.

This is Jessica's seventh loan cycle with MFP. She gets along well with all the group members and is well-liked because she has always shown herself to be a very responsible and punctual member. She will buy fruits with the loan she has requested so that she can continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits so she can continue with her business.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a 37-year-old married man with four children. He is living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family is vested in him, and his desire is to set up a sustainable income-generating activity for the family. For nine years, he has been dealing in agricultural produce, specifically selling maize and beans, and this has facilitated him in meeting his family's needs. His major challenge is the seasonal nature of the business, and his dream is to set up a food store. Alex needs the loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to purchase beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, age 53, runs a retail shop that sells gasoline per liter. She has had this business for five years. She and her husband have five children.

She has requested a loan for PhP 5,000 in order to buy gallons of gasoline to offer for sale.
 
Erlinda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy gallons of gasoline to offer for sale

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Thelma has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Thelma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Thelma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung, 41, is a married mother of two children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works for a local factory. 

Dung runs a small food stall and store in front of her house. Her stall and store are very convenient for many customers and she provides food for breakfast such as breads and steamed rice. She also sells a range of metal racks and appliances. She has been in this business for twenty years. 

Dung is seeking a loan to purchase foodstuffs to increase the variety of products that she sells to her customers. This will allow her to increase the turnover of her business and increase her income. She hopes that this will enabL. her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy foodstuff

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children, and 2 of them go to school. Margaret takes care of additional family members (two of her sister's children). She operates a salon from a shop on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 20 years. Margaret works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more hair treatments and braids. Her aspiration is to buy a stand-alone dryer so as to serve more customers. Her major business challenges are off-and-on electricity and seasonality. She lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.

loans.use: To buy more braids and hair treatments.

loans.name: Concodia

texts.en: Concodia is from the village of Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old and married with seven adult children. To make a living, Concodia owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities. Concodia is requesting a loan of 5,300 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In 2010, Concodia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is 26 years old, married and has one child who is four years old.  She sells milk to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for four years. She also does farming to earn additional income.  

Veronicah is requesting a loan for 5,800 KES, which she will use to buy an energy-saving cooker (jiko).  This jiko uses charcoal and has a thick inner lining that saves energy. 

Through Faulu Kenya, she has gained skills on business management. Veronicah hopes to expand her business for more income generation in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an energy-saving cooker.

loans.name: Kuntea

texts.en:
Kuntea (in the photo) is 24 years old and her husband Thet is 26 years old. They live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2005 and have two daughters-one is in school and another who is not.  

Kuntea and her husband are farmers. They grow cauliflower on their farmland in the village where they live. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her cauliflower farm.

loans.name: Mae Ann

texts.en:
Mae Ann is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. For the past five years she has had a shop where she sells shorts, towels, shirts and blouses.

Mae Ann has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy more stock for her shop.

Mae Ann hopes to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy shorts, towels, shirts and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Sempeyan

texts.en:
Sempeyan, aged 33, is married to Kiparu. They are blessed with three children. She runs a retail shop that has been in operation for the last two years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 2,000.

This is her first loan with KADET ltd. She will use the funds to buy stocks of sugar, cooking oil, and flour for resale. She hopes to start a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, and flour.

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru:
Галина живет и работает в селе Великая Знаменка. У нее есть муж и двое взрослых дочерей. Галина занимается торговлей автозапчастями для сельхозтехники. Ее муж активно помогает ей в этом бизнесе, так как сам отлично разбирается в технике. В этой сфере они работают уже 11 лет. 

Галина планирует вложить средства, полученные от КИВА в покупку земельного участка под магазин. Галина уже договорилась с сельсоветом о покупке земли и планирует завершить сделку до нового года, пока не изменились законы. Участок, который Галина хотела бы выкупить, находится в центре Знаменки, прямо напротив рынка – вокруг сосредоточены практически все магазины в селе. Там Галина с мужем планируют продолжать торговать автозапчастями для фермерской техники, однако также хотели бы построить рядом еще и небольшой ларек для торговли продуктами питания. Галина очень надеется, что сделка состоится, и земля все-таки будет принадлежать им, тогда не придется платить большую аренду, и никто не сможет забрать у них этот участок или вытеснить их. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Galina lives and works in the Velikaya Znamenka village. She has a husband and two adult daughters.  Galina is involved in selling spare parts for agricultural machinery.  Her husband actively helps her with this business because he knows machinery very well.  They have been working in this field for 11 years.  Galina plans to invest money, received from Kiva, into a purchase of a land plot for a store.  She has already reached an agreement with the village council to purchase the land and plans to complete this transaction prior to the New Year's, while the laws remain unchanged.  The land, that Galina wants to purchase, is located in the center of Znamenka, right across from the market, with practically all village stores surrounding it.  There, Galina and her husband plan to continue selling auto parts for farm machinery, but also want to build a small kiosk nearby to sell food products.  Galina hopes that this deal will happen, and that the land will belong to them because then they would not longer have to pay for a large lease, and no one would be able to take away their land or force them out.

loans.use: to purchase land for a store

loans.name: Geoconda Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Gioconda, es casada tiene dos hijos que dependen económicamente de ella, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, ella labora para una zona franca como supervisora, por medio de su salario ella cubre gastos del  hogar y sus créditos obtenidos. Con este préstamo número 17 lo solita para reparar el techo y poner el piso de su casa, por lo que necesita comprar materiales como cemento, cerámica, masía, laminas de zinc perlines y pagara la mano de obra así brindar mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos poco a poco ya que no se puede de una sola vez por el bajo sueldo mensual.

loans.use: Para comprar cemento, masía, laminas de zinc cerámica, perlines y pagara la mano de obra.

loans.name: Jamilu

texts.en:
Jamilu is a married 30 year old farmer, from Katuri, Kaduna State. He uses the yield he produces from his farm to take care of his family of 10.  Jamilu has been farming from a very young age and although he has years of experience, his inability to access the right inputs such as high-quality seeds and fertilizers has seen years of below average yields from his maize farm.  A Babban Gona loan of $485 would help Jamilu see improvements in his crops by providing him with seeds and fertilizers while allowing him the means to store his crops and the ability to sell them at a premium market price.  By receiving a Babban Gona loan, Jamilu has the opportunity to reap yields and earn profits three times as high as the average Nigerian farmer.

With the technical training he has received from Babban Gona, Jamilu can envision a future where he is better able to provide for his large family.  He has the chance to see his children obtain a good education and maintain a healthier lifestyle, as his farm continues to grow and eventually moves from subsistence farming to commercial scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Calleb

texts.en:
Calleb is a married man with children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

He is a farmer and a cattle trader, buying and selling cattle in various markets in the rural areas and urban areas. He began the business to get school fees for educating his children. 

He has hopes of growing his business, but is faced with little capital to improve the quality of his cattle in his farm and buy more to sell.  Calleb is requesting a loan to purchase more cattle for fattening to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for fattening to sell.

loans.name: Sodoayé

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Sodoayé, a mother and father orphan from child hood, early got married as she was 15 and the marriage failed. The child yielded by that marriage was however abandoned to her. Her second marriage was broken as her husband died and her third marriage was also a failure. Today, she lives alone with her three live children. Note that some of her children died. She is now 25 and lives a miserable life in Légbassito where her core business is the marketing of various products with grinding services to catering providers as secondary activity. Despite her difficulties, the young woman twice demonstrated good management and a smooth reimbursement of her credits. This very serious and honest woman is pitiful and deserves to be supported financially in order to increase the volume of her activities and therefore significantly improve her revenue to take a better care of her children. Mrs. A. Sodoayé requires a credit of $750 to buy a small pepper mill to reduce the difficult nature of her work and buy a supply of basic commodities.

Madame A. Sodoayé, orpheline de père et de mère dès son jeune âge, s’était très tôt abandonnée à un premier mariage à 15 ans sans succès. L’enfant sorti de ce mariage est laissé à elle. Le second mariage s’est soldé par le décès du mari et le troisième mariage non plus n’a pas été un succès. Aujourd’hui, elle vit seule avec ses trois enfants vivants car elle a connu aussi des décès d’enfants. A 25 ans, elle vit pitoyablement à Légbassito où elle exerce comme activité principale la vente des produits divers et comme deuxième activité la mouture aux restaurateurs. Malgré ses difficultés, cette jeune femme analphabète, deux fois déjà, a fait preuve d’une bonne gestion et d’un bon remboursement des crédits obtenus. Cette femme, très sérieuse et honnête fait pitié et mérite d’être soutenue financièrement pour accroître ses activités et de facto améliorer sensiblement ses revenus pour mieux entretenir ses enfants. Madame A. Sodoayé sollicite un crédit de $750 pour s’acheter un petit moulin à piment pour réduire la pénibilité de son travail et pour s’approvisionner en produits de première nécessité.

loans.use: to buy a small pepper mill and a supply of basic commodities

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina Moises Sitoe A., 37 years of age, married and a mother of 3, grew up with her parents. Her studies were interrupted at 8th grade due to the early pregnancy of her first child. Her husband is in the military and has always been away from the family. With the transfer of her husband to the northern most province of the country, Gina was obligated to start a business in order to sustain her 3 children. In conversation with her neighbors, she found out about Hluvuku-Adsema (Field Partner) and met and solicited a loan. Today, Gina’s business has expanded, having two counters and the fortune of employing one worker (a single mother). With the business’ revenue Gina supports the family’s expenses and her children’s education, as well as the family’s health in case of sickness. Currently, with both establishments, capital funds are fundamental to responding to the challenges of better serving the customer. It is in this context that Gina approached Hluvuku-Adsema to solicit a loan of 425 dollars. With this loan Gina intends to increase the volume of merchandise in order to respond to customer’s demands. Her business’ impact on the community is great; she supplies clothes at an extremely reasonable price and has created two jobs for herself and another woman.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Gina Moisés Sitoe A. de 37 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos pais viu os seus estudos interrompidos na 8ª classe devido a gravidez precoce do seu primeiro filho. O Marido é um militar e tem estado sempre fora da família. Com transferência do seu marido para província mais a Norte do Pais, viu-se obrigada a abrir um negocio de forma a sustentar os seus 3 filhos. Em conversa com vizinhos, soube da existência da Hhuvuku, aproximou-se e solicitou um empréstimo. Hoje em dia, o seu negocio conhece uma outra dinâmica, já conta com duas bancas e providencia emprego a 1 trabalhador ( uma mãe solteira). Com os rendimentos do negocio suporta as despesas familiares, escolares dos seus filhos, assim como de saúde da família em caso de doença. Actualmente com os dois estabelecimentos, o capital de trabalho é fundamental para responder os desafios de servir melhor o cliente é neste contexto que aproximou a Hluvuku e seus parceiros para solicitar um empréstimo de 10.400,00mt. Com este empréstimo pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria de forma a responder positivamente com as exigências dos clientes. A sua actividade tem um maior impacto na comunidade, pois fornece roupas a um preço bastante acessível e criou dois postos de trabalho para ela própria mais uma senhora viúva.

loans.use: To increase the stock of clothes in her shop

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
Fernanda works with her husband, Mario Vargas, selling popular regional cuisine and ice cream. They have four vendors working in the business districts of La Paz and El Alto. They have two children and live in their own home, located in the Satellite City (because it's more than 12,000 feet high) area of El Alto. The income helps them provide for their family.

The loan will be used to purchase an ice cream maker to improve the quality of her ice cream.

This is the fourth loan she has solicited. Her credit history makes her a good candidate to receive another one and further increase her family's income and create more job sources.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Fernanda trabaja con su esposo Mario Vargas, realizan trabajo de gastronomía popular, (Salteñas y Rollos de Queso) y Helados, tiene 4 vendedores los cuales trabajan en la comercialización en las Ciudades de La Paz y el Alto.Tiene 2 hijos y vive en casa propia ubicada en la Zona de Ciudad Satélite (denominada así por que se halla a mas de 4000 mts de altura) en la ciudad de El Alto. Los ingresos que generan Fernanda y Esposo le permite la manutención de su familia. El destino del crédito es para comprar una Heladera para la mejor la calidad de producción de los Helados. Este es el cuarto crédito que solicita; su buen antecedente crediticio le permite acceder a otro crédito para mejorar sus ingresos familiares y crear fuentes de trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase an ice cream maker.

loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es:
Maria Lidia is 42 years old and married with 1 child. Her husband works in the fields. She sells tostadas filled with meat, chicken, lettuce, tomato and onion. She is a member of the loan group Dulce 1. With the loan she will buy kitchen tools to better prepare her products. She will also improve the area in her house where she sells her products.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA LIDIA TIENE 42 AÑOS , CASADA 1 HIJO SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO , ELLA SE DEDICA A VENDER TOSTADAS RELLENAS DE CARNE, POLLO , LECHUGA , QUESO , TOMATE Y CEBOLLA. PERTENECE AL GRUPO DULCE 1. CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRARA IMPLEMENTOS DE COCINA PARA ELABORAR SUS PRODUCTOS Y ACONDICIONARA MEJOR EL LUGAR QUE TIENE EN SU CASA DONDE VENDE SUS PRODUCTOS.

loans.use: Buy kitchen tools with which to prepare her homemade food products

loans.name: Luísa Petrosse

texts.pt:
Luisa Petrosse T. is 40 years old. She is a widown and has one son. She lives in the city of Polana Caniço in Maputo. She sells different sorts of food from her home and she wishes to take out a loan in the amount of 10.000 MT that will be paid back in 6 months. This amount will be used to strenghten her business. She is new to the program.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Luísa Petrosse T. tem 40 anos de idade, é viúva e mãe de um filho. Vive no bairro Polana Caniço em Maputo. Vende diversos produtos de mercearia em sua casa e pretende tomar um empréstimo de 10.000MT para pagar em 6 meses para reforçlar op seu negócio.É nova no Programa

loans.use: Aumento do Stock

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna has a small fruit and vegetable stand at a busy outdoor market in Uzhgorod, Ukraine. She has a large spot at the market and tries to keep a good selection of fresh, attractive produce on hand. Before operating at her current location, Anna had sold produce at the large Central market in Uzhgorod. When she decided to move to a smaller market, many of her customers came with her.

Due to the nature of Anna’s business with a high inventory turnover rate, she benefits from short term loans that allow her to purchase more fruits and vegetables and then quickly repay the loan. She has requested $200 to use for this purpose. This loan will help her to continue earning a good income and provide for her family.

loans.use: To purchase fruit and vegetable inventory

loans.name: Malena

texts.es:
Malena is a courageous woman who works daily to give the best of herself in everything she does. Since she was young and now that she is a responsible mother, she has always found ways in which she could increase her household’s income. She is a mother of three children. She gives them her love and also she teaches them the value of honest and hard work. Malena started a small business selling and renting CD’S, because the demand for CD’S seemed to be growing. Since the demand for CD’s is not always constant, Malena needed to start another business. She has decided to raise chickens and guinea pigs. She was able to do this with the training that she received around the raising of small animals. She has never doubted her dedication to raising animals for profit because it allows her to work at home and she is able to take care of her children at the same time. She can see the fruits of her labor because when she receives her earning she is able to help pay for all of her household expenses. She is motivated everyday by her children she will continue working. She’s asking for a loan to invest in buying sheets of corrugated metal to improve the conditions of her farm. Lets support this mother who has such a strong worth ethic.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Malena, es una mujer de mucho coraje que día a día trabaja para dar lo mejor de sí en cada acción que realiza. Desde que era muy joven y ahora que es una madre de familia responsable ha visto diversas maneras de incrementar los ingresos económicos de su hogar, ella es madre tres hijos a los cuales viene dando todo su amor y también les enseña cada día el valor del trabajo honrado y esforzado.Malena circunstancialmente ha incursionado en el alquiler y venta de CD’s ya que esta labor tiene demanda eventualmente, así mismo y debido a que la demanda no es continua ha decidido instalar en casa un criadero de pollos y cuyes, con la capacitación que recibió en un comité de vaso de leche acerca de la crianza de animales menores. Ella no dudó en dedicarse a esto para también estar al cuidado de sus hijos y es así que hoy puede ver los frutos de su trabajo cuando obtiene las ganancias que le permiten ser un ente importante en el financiamiento de su hogar. Motivada cada día por sus hijos seguirá trabajando y solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de calaminas para mejorar las condiciones de su granja.Apoyemos a un gran valor de inmenso esfuerzo que sólo un corazón de madre puede albergar.

loans.use: Improve the conditions for raising guinea pigs in her home.

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Manik

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman Manik owns a general store. Ni Nyoman Manik has two children. Her elder child is already married while the younger is in grade 5 SD. Her husband is a farmer. Daily, Ni Nyoman Manik commences work at 4 am. Waking up Ni Nyoman Manik, ready herself to get to the State morning market. Ni Nyoman Manik purchases all essential supplies for the general store. Returning home by 7 am, Ni Nyoman Manik starts cooking fish, prepares rice, boils vegetables, makes a variety of cakes, and finally sugar syrup for ice drinks. Ni Nyoman Manik besides selling prepared food also sells the raw ingredients. Funds from the loan from Dinari Rp. 4.000.000,- (about USD425) will be used as working capital for funding the purchase of essential supplies for the general store. Prior to obtaining this loan from Dinari, daily profit earned was Rp. 25.000, - Rp. 30.000,- (between USD2.60 to 3.00). With this loan from Dinari, daily profit is expected to increase thus allowing Ni Nyoman Manik to fund her child’s education and the family’s essential expenses.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nyoman Manik memiliki usaha warung yang sudah lama ditekuninya. Ni Nyoman Manik memiliki 2 orang anak. Anaknya yang pertama sudah menikah dan anaknya yang kedua baru kelas 5 SD. Suami Ni Nyoman Manik bekerja sebagai petani. Setiap hari Ni Nyoman Manik memulai usahanya mulai jam 04.00 pagi. Bangun tidur NI Nyoman Manik sudah bersiap –siap untuk pergi ke pasar pagi di Negara. Ni Nyoman Manik membeli semua kebutuhan warungnya . Sampai dirumah jam 07.00 Ni Nyoman Manik mulai memasak ikan, membuat nasi, merebus sayur, membuat aneka kue, dan terakhir membuat gula untuk es. Ni Nyoman Manik selain membuat makanan siap saji, juga menjual makanan mentah. Modal yang di pinjam dari Dinari Rp.4.000.000,- akan dipergunakan untuk modal usaha yaitu membeli kebutuhan warungnya. Sebelum mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari, keuntungan yang di dapat perhari Rp. 25.000,- sd Rp. 30.000,-. Setelah mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari keuntungan perhari diharapkan bisa meningkat karena dengan keuntungan ini Ni Nyoman Manik bisa menyekolahkan anaknya dan untuk kebutuhan rumah tangganya.

loans.use: Add capital to fund the general store business (Menambah modal usaha untuk melengkapi fasilitas warungnya)

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es:
Mrs. Carmen C. is a lady with much experience in sales; twelve years ago she started with the opening of a general store in the city of Leon. She used her own capital which she had accumulated since her youth working as an assistant in a carpenter shop.

It should be noted, that her business started as a table in her home from which she would sell her products. Little by little her business grew and she attained larger sales levels.

Since 7 years ago, Mrs. Carmen has seen and increase in sales due to the loans that she acquired from Ceprodel, which enabled her to rebuild her business and improve her mix of products. Her current goal is to increase her income and be able to continue to feed and support her family as they deserve.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Carmen C. es una dama de mucha experiencia en el área de las ventas. Desde hace 12 años comenzó con la implementación de una pulpería en la ciudad de León. Inició con un capital propio que lo obtuvo producto de su arduo trabajo desde su juventud como ayudante de carpintería.

Es digno señalar que el negocio comenzó con una mesa en la cual vendía sus pocos productos desde su hogar y así fue creciendo poco a poco hasta llegar a alcanzar mayores niveles de venta en su negocio.

Desde hace 7 años la señora Carmen ha visto un avance debido a que ha realizado préstamos en Ceprodel de los cuales le han apoyado para reconstruir su negocio y poder surtir su cartera de productos. Su meta hoy en día es llegar a aumentar sus ganancias y seguir manteniendo su núcleo familiar con la alimentación y apoyo que su familia se merece.

loans.use: Purchase of products (Shanpoo, deodorants, crackers, oats, beverages, bread, cereals, etc.)

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi S.,40 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 1998. She is living in Y Yen, Nam Dinh with her husband and 2 children. During the recent years, she used her borrowed money mainly on breeding pigs and chickens. Besides, she also collected wasted material to be able to repay weekly. Her family economy experienced some changes. Currently, Mrs. S. is doing business on wasted material at home so that she does not have to move around and it is also convenient for taking care of the animals. Her average income from selling and buying wasted material is 3-4 USD/day. Besides, every farrow of pigs bring her several hundred USD. This time she wants to borrow 525 USD to use for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Sửu, 40 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Chị sống tại ý Yên, Nam Định cùng chồng và 2 con. Trong các năm qua, chị Sửu vay vốn sử dụng chủ yếu cho mục đích chăn nuôi lợn gà. Bên cạnh đó để có tiền trả tuần, chị đi thu mua phế liệu. Kinh tế gia đình cũng có nhiều chuyển biến. Hiện nay, chị Sửu chuyển sang thu mua phế liệu tại nhà, vừa đỡ đi lại vất vả, vừa tiện cho việc chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân một ngày từ việc buôn bán phế liệu khoảng 3-4USD. Ngoài ra mỗi lứa lợn bán mang về cho chị vài trăm USD. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 525USD để sử dụng cho việc buôn bán.

loans.use: Buy wasted materials

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en: Rabih is a 32-year-old man wno works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. He has 2 children. Rabih owns a bakery. This is the first time he's applying for a loan through Al Majmoua. He is planning to buy a car for the bakery.

loans.use: to buy a car for his business

loans.name: Sifat

texts.en:
Sifat, 38, is divorced and takes care of her three children (ages 13, 15, and 17) and also six others dependents. She sells juice and ice cream door-to-door in order to make a living. She works from 7am to 8pm daily and started this work 2 years ago. From this business, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $65.

Sifat is requesting a loan to purchase more juice and ice cream products to sell. She belongs to the loan group Msimamo, whose members are mutually responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy more juice and ice cream

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella A. is a business-oriented woman because she was able to put the money that she borrowed from LAPO Microfinance into good use. She sells foodstuffs and provisions at Shibiri in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in this business since 2004. She is 25 years old and married with two children.

Stella is determined to lift her family above poverty. She is requesting the loan of $425.00 to buy more foodstuffs and provisions for sales.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and provisions.

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.es:
Sivestre is a farmer, not only devoted to his work but also to being the father of a family. He works hard in his fields of crops and in the raising of animals, which he takes out to graze in the early mornings. Without a doubt it is not an easy task, but the love for his family gives his work reason and meaning. Currently, Silvestre wants to improve his situation by increasing the number of animals which in the long run will provide better financial income. For starters he would like to buy a sheep of good breeding. If you support him, he will be forever grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Silvestre es un padre agricultor, no tan sólo comprometido con su trabajo sino también con su rol de padre de familia. Trabaja duramente en sus terrenos de cultivos y en la crianza de animales, los cuales desde tempranas horas del día, lleva a pastear a los alrededores de sus terrenos. Sin duda, no es una tarea fácil, pero el amor por los suyos es lo que le da un fin y un sentido a todo. Pero ahora, Silvestre quiere mejorar, incrementando la cantidad de animales, los que con el transcurso del tiempo le darán mejores ingresos económicos. Para empezar, desea comprar una oveja de buena raza. Si usted lo apoya, estará agradecido de por vida.

loans.use: Acquire new animals for his livestock business

loans.name: Merry

texts.en: Merry has been selling milk in Arusha for six years.  She is 27 years old, married, and has three children, ages 5, 8, and 12 years old.  She works daily from 8:00am to 4:00pm and is able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $60.  Merry is hoping to take out a loan in order to give her more capital to expand her business.  With more materials, she expects to be able to increase her profit.

loans.use: To buy more materials to increase her sales of milk.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana is 49 years old and lives with her husband Pori, who is in the sales business. She has two daughters, 29 year-old Nery and 24 year-old Derly, who is in higher education. Ana has 20 years of experience in grocery sales, always working in her some store, which she can manage without much trouble since it is in her own home. She begins working at 6 am and finishes at 9pn, during those hours she serves her customers, which she has been attracting throughout the years. Se loves her jobs, since because of it she has been able to give her children a higher level of education, which they have eagerly and fully taken advantage of. The difficult part of her job is having to stay in the tiny store all day, without going out for a second to rest or visit her daughters who live in the city, since she works during the entire week. Ana wants to see her daughter form their own families and to have a better future. She will supply her store with products that people ask for with the loan money, and in that way continue to maintain customer loyalty and attract new customers, so that in the future she will be able to open another store.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Ana tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo Pori, que se dedica al comercio, tiene dos hijas; Nery de 29 y Derly de 24, la cual cursa superiores. Ana tiene 20 años de experiencia en la venta de comestibles, siempre se ha dedicado a su pequeña tienda, la cual puede administrar sin problema porque se encuentra en su propia casa, su trabajo empieza a las 6 de la mañana y termina a las 9 de la noche, tiempo en el cual se interesa mucho por atender a su clientela, la que se ha ido incrementando a lo largo de todos estos años.A ella le encanta su trabajo, ya que gracias a él, pudo brindarle a sus hijas educación superior, la cual, ellas han aprovechado con mucho ahínco.Lo difícil de su trabajo es tener que permanecer durante casi todo en día en su tiendita, sin salir ni un momento a pasear, distraerse o visitar a sus hijas, que se encuentran en la ciudad, ya que el trabajo es durante toda la semana. Ana quiere ver a sus hijas formando sus propias familias y con un futuro mejor. Con el dinero del préstamo implementará su tienda con los productos que la gente está demandando, así poder mantener la fidelidad de su clientela y atraer a nuevos clientes, para que en un futuro pueda poner una sucursal.

loans.use: To supply her store with a large amount of her products.

loans.name: Jimena Aneyda

texts.es: El domicilio de la señora, se encuentra ubicado en la populosa zona de Villa Victoria de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia, siendo una vecina muy conocida de la zona. La señora se dedica a la comercialización de juguetes al por mayor desde hace ya 6 años; este crédito será destinado al incremento de capital para la compra de mercadería. La señora es soltera dependen económicamente de ella sus papas que ya son ancianitos, es cliente de nuestra institución ya hace 1 año, la moneda en la que trabaja es en bolivianos, comenta que los créditos que sacó con nuestra institución le sirvieron de mucho ya que son de corta rotación y puede incrementar su capital de manera rápida, gracias a ello, logró mejorar su calidad de vida y la de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Jimena's home is located in the populous neighborhood of Villa Victoria in the city of La Paz, Bolivia, and she is a well-known neighborhood resident. She makes a living selling toys wholesale, which she has done for the past six years. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her capital to purchase merchandise. Jimena is single and her parents, now a bit elderly, depend on her economically. She has been a client of Kiva partner Emprender for one year. She says past loans she's received for the institution have helped her greatly since they have come in quick rotation and have allowed her to increase her capital rapidly. Thanks to the loans, she has been able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital to purchase larger quantities of merchandise

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María Elena G. L. es originaria de Cadereyta, Nuevo León. Ella tiene 49 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos. <

> Actualmente María Elena solicita un préstamo por USD$475 a un plazo de 6 meses, para comprar mercancía y así satisfacer la demanda de pedidos. <

> María Elena cuenta ya con amplía experiencia en las ventas por catálogo, anteriormente ella de dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos, sin embargo desde hace dos años y medio optó por la venta de calzado. La idea de dedicarse a las ventas se debe a las ganas de María Elena por ayudar a su esposo, quien es contratista, con los gastos del hogar y de la educación de sus hijos. <

> ¡Los invito a que apoyemos a María Elena para que pueda seguir incrementando sus ventas! <

>
texts.en:
María Elena G. L. is originally from Cadereyta, Nuevo León. She is 49 years old, married, and has 3 children.

María Elena is requesting a loan for $475 for a period of six months, so she can buy merchandise and satisfy the demands for the requested orders.

María Elena had plenty of experience in catalog sales, having sold cosmetics before. Nevertheless, two and a half years ago she opted for shoe sales. The idea to work in sales allows María Elena the income to help her husband, who is a contractor, with the costs of the home and the education of their children.

You are invited to support María Elena so that she can continue to increase her sales!


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shoe sales by catalog

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar tiene 20 años. es soltera vive en casa de sus padres. La Isla Tata kily del Lago Titicaca es el lugar donde Pilar tiene su pequeño puesto de venta de artesanías ella, elabora collares y algunos artículos elaborados en base a totora(planta andina) y compra los hechos en cerámica, para ofrecer a los turistas que visitan su isla de diferentes lugares del mundo. A Pilar le gusta hablar con los turistas los cuales le cuentan como son las cosas en sus países y también algunas palabras que le resultan fascinantes, es por eso que ella busca dejar en alto el nombre de su pueblo y de su país con las artesanías que vende esperando hacer la estadía de  sus visitantes mucho más placentera. Es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita comprara más artesanías en base a cerámica y algunos materiales para elaborar collares, etc y así aumentar su producción para ofrecer mejores productos a los turistas que gentilmente los visitan.
texts.en:
Pilar, 20, is single and lives at home with her parents. She operates a small crafts business on Lake Titcaca's Isla Tata Kily. She makes necklaces and other items from "totora" (a reed-like Andean plant) and buys ceramic items, all of which she sells to the tourists who come to the island from all over the world. Pilar enjoys talking to the tourists who tell her about life in their countries, something that fascinates her. In turn, she seeks to pass along a little bit of her village and her country with the crafts that she sells, hoping that they will remember their visit to the island with great pleasure. This is her first loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. With the loan, she will buy more ceramic products and materials for making necklaces, etc. so that she can increase her production and offer her customers better products when they kindly stop by to take a look.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resell.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Née le 04 janvier 1968 à Kovié, Madame N. Adjovi est couturière de métier et est surtout très active dans le commerce de pagnes. Ce commerce lui procure plus de bénéfice. Soutenue financièrement, Madame N. à régulièrement remboursé et soldé à temps ses crédits. Ce qui lui a permets aujourd’hui d'accroitre ses activités. Face aux demandes sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un nouveau financement. Ce financement accordé lui permettra d’accroître son chiffre d'affaires et ses profits.
texts.en:
Adjovi N. was born on 4 January 1968 in Kovié and is a seamstress who works principally in the pagnes trade. This business secures her greater profits. Financially secure, Mrs N. has regularly repaid and settled her debts on time, which has now given her the opportunity to increase her business activities. Due to the ever increasing demands of her clientele, she is seeking a new loan. This loan will allow her to augment her turnover and profits.

Translated from French by Holly Miller, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pagnes trade

loans.name: Jorge Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Jorge Pablo tiene 15 años dedicándose al comercio de ropa usada, el nuevo reto que se planteó es  la venta de ropa nueva, para esto tiene que realizar una buena inversión pues quiere ofrecer al publico productos de la mejor calidad.
 El negocio lo atienden el señor y su esposa ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia y quieren lo mejor para su hijo que apenas empieza a estudiar.
Solicita el apoyo de ustedes para cumplir con su objetivo.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge Pablo has been selling used clothes for 15 years and the new challenge he has planned is the sale of new clothes. This is a good investment because he wants to offer the public better quality products. The business that he and his wife run is the source of income for their family and they want the best for their son who has just begun to study. He asks for your support to accomplish his goal.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Aguru

texts.en:
Aguru A., 45, is the mother of five children, one boy and four girls. Three are in junior high and primary school and two are learning trades. She lives with them and her husband, a farmer, in Koforidua, a small business and farming town near Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Working hard to support her husband in providing for the family, Aguru has been both a fish monger and banana seller for 15 years. Procuring her fish from large-scale fish mongers in the coastal areas of the country and the bananas from the surrounding towns, she sells in both the local market square and nearby village markets. Aguru is now requesting a loan to buy fish and bananas in bulk to make greater profit so she can help her children in school.

loans.use: To procure bananas and smoked fish.

loans.name: Lien

texts.vi: Chị Dương ThịLiên 50 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương  từ năm 1998. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị Liên vay 500.000đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Hiện nay ngoài chăn nuôi theo mô hình trang trại gia đình chị còn có thêm nghề làm đậu phụ. Đây cũng là những công việc đem lại cho gia đình chị thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn về chăn nuôi và mua thêm đỗ về làm đậu phụ bán.
texts.en:
Ms. D. Thi Lien is 50 Yrs old, and joined TYM fund in 1998. Her first loan was 28 USD to invest in raising animals. Currently, in addition to raising animals she also has a business making tofu. These businesses bring in for her family average of 345 USD per month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 1150 USD to purchase additional pigs to raise, and to buy additional soy bean for making tofu

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr: Née en 1968 au GHANA, Mme Mariam O. est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Avec son petit commerce des produits de premières nécessités qui lui réussissent bien grâce à son dynamisme et sa bonne gestion, elle sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner en grande quantité en marchandises. Les bénéfices lui serviront à mieux s’occuper de sa famille et assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Born in 1968 in GHANA, Ms. Mariam O. is married and the mother of five. With her small-scale commerce in staple goods, which is successful, thanks to her energy and good management, she's requesting financing to acquire large quantities of merchandise. The profits will be used to take care of her family better and to ensure her children's education.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell essential goods

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Javier y la señora Narda son un matrimonio joven, pero bien establecido que les gusta progresar, sobretodo trabajadores y responsables.
El es mecánico para una empresa desde hace 2 años, ella supervisora de cajas en una tienda de venta de productos para la oficina, juntos tienen un bebe y desean brindarle un mejor hogar, con mejor comodidad y mayor seguridad para la familia, por lo tanto están tramitando este crédito para la construcción de una barda en el frente de su casa.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier and Narda are a young couple, but well established and wanting to progress. They are especially hard-working responsible. Francisco has been a mechanic for two years, and Narda is a business supervisor at an office-supplies store. They have a baby, and they want to raise him in a better home, with better comfort and conveniences, and greater family safety; they are applying for a loan so that they can build a fence out front of their house.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a fence in front of their house

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina O. is married and has 2 children. She has received an education through Junior High School. Paulina sells groceries and foodstuffs at Frami near Abura, which she has done for 10 years. While Paulina works as a petty trader, her husband is employed as a farmer.

Paulina uses her income to pay for household expenses and to help her husband when there is any other need. She will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to buy more foodstuffs for re-sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Paulina plans to reinvest for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: additional capital to enable her to buy more foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal K. has a bar and beauty salon business at Nabweru near highway road. She is a hardworking business lady, age 35, married with four children. She is requesting a loan to purchase salon items such as hair chemicals, hair braids, hair weaves, hair combs, hair treatments, etc. and also bar items such as beer, wines, sodas, etc. to meet her customer's expectations. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase hair salon items and also bar items such as beer, sodas, wines etc .

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
FRANCISCA D. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “CARMEN CABREJOS” con domicilio en el Jr. Adolfo morey N° 667 interior, del distrito de Callería, tiene 35 años, 04 hijos, y su esposo es profesor.

Tenía un negocio de venta frutas, pastelitos y la primera vez que obtuvo un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace 2 años, compró frutas para vender en la vereda de su casa.  Actualmente se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de ropas para luego venderlo por las comunidades del rio Ucayali. Además ella prepara juanes especiales (comida típica de la región) y los vende a sus vecinos.

En el poco tiempo que esta con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Francisca D. R. belongs to the Communal Bank “Carmen Cabrejos”; her home is located in the District of Calleria, she is 35 years old, has 4 children, and her husband is teacher. She had a business in the sale of fruits and small pastries; the first loan that she obtained 2 years ago was of 300 PEN, which she used to buy fruit to sell on the sidewalk in front of her house. Currently she dedicates herself to the business of selling clothing. With this loan of 1,000 PEN, she will invest in the purchase of clothing that she will later sell to the communities of Rio Ucayali. She also prepares special “Juanes” (traditional food of the region), which she sells to her neighbors. In the little time that she has been with the Manuela Ramos program she has felt happy for the help it gives women to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina es socia del Banco Comunal Yana Ñahui que significa Ojos Negros en quechua.
Rufina es soltera, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Rufina tiene un puesto alquilado en le mercado Carmen Alto en donde vende papa, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija.
Rufina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa.
Los sueños de Rufina son educar a sus hijos y surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Rufina is an associate of the Communal Bank Yana Ñahui which means Dark Eyes in quechua. Rufina is single, is 36 years old, and has 3 children. Rufina has a rented stand in the Carmen Alto market where she sells potatoes, an activity she does every day with the help of her daughter. Rufina needs a loan of 900 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of potatoes. Her dreams are to educate her children and to supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of potatoes

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Bunthoeun R., 35, and her husband, Mr. Sothea Keo, 47, live in a small village on National Road Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of their children work in a garment factory.

Bunthoeun cuts grass to sell for cows' feed. Her husband has been a mason for over 15 years. He does his work in his village and in a nearby province, but sometimes he has a job in Phnom Penh City too. He doesn’t have his own transportation, and he travels with his relatives to work very often. Therefore, Bunthoeun is requesting a loan of US$600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Huanupampa Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen del Carmen D. Huanupampa es parte del proyecto Wari, El Banco Comunal inicia su Primer ciclo con 10 socias. Las socias son D. la comunidad D. Huanupampa, distrito D. Totos, Provincia D. Cangallo, Departamento D. Ayacucho. Las actividades principales son la agricultura y ganadería.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, cereales, animales menores, frutas, comida.

Como es el caso D. Margarita es presidenta del Banco Comunal, casada, Margarita tiene su tienda D. abarrotes en su casa, además brinda servicio telefónico y realiza recepción D. llamadas, también compra cereales.

Mientras que Gregoria es casada, tiene 3 hijas, Gregoria se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores, como oveja, gallina, los cuales son comercializados en la feria D. su distrito. 

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 200 soles, 6300 soles, 500 soles, haciendo un total D. 3,200 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. queso, verduras, arroz, azúcar, papa, gaseosas.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener casa propia, sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Carmen D. Huanupampa Community Bank is aprt of the Wari project. The Community Bank started its first cycle with 10 member. The members are from the Huanupampa community, Totos district, Cangallo Province, Ayacucho Department. The activities are primarily agriculture. The members are in different businesses like the sale of general goods, grains, young animals, fruits and food. Like the case of Margarita is the President of the Community Bank and is married. Margarita has her store in her home and also gives out telephone calls and receives calls, and buys grains. Meanwhile, Gregoria is married with three children. Gregoria is dedicated to raising young animals, like sheep and hens, which are sold in the fair in her district. The members need different amounts of loans like 200 soles, 300 soles, 500 soles, making a total o 3200 soles in loans in the Community Bank. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of cheese, vegetables, rice, sugar, potatoes and soda The dreams of the members are to have their own house, that their children are professionals, and to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cheese, vegetables, potatoes, rice, sugar a soda

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 7mo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (terminar una habitación repellandola), trabaja como  conserje de CETA INATEC desde hace 8 años, tiene 2 hijos,  la mayor tiene 15 años de edad y esta estudiando su 2do año de educacion secundaria y la menor de 12 años de edad estudia 4to grado de educación primaria;  Elizabeth es madre soltera y ha salido adelante con el cuidado de sus hijas, se caracteriza por ser honesta y muy trabajadora, vive en un barrio de la zona urbana en la zona # 4 en un lugar centrico del municipio de Nueva Guinea, su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda y así gozar de mejores condiciones, que sus hijos estudien para que lleguen hacer alguien en la vida ya que ella no pudo estudiar una carrera por las condiciones economicas de sus padres y tener estabilidad laboral  para sacar a sus hijos adelante.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is asking for refinancing of her 7 month credit in order to invest in the improvement of her home (to finish plastering a room.) She has worked as a caretaker of CETA INATEC for the past 8 years. She has two children; the older one is 15 years of age and studying in his second year of secondary education. Her younger son is 12 years old and currently in the 4th grade of primary school. Elizabeth is a single mother and has gone forward with the care of her children alone, which demonstrates her honest and hardworking character. She lives in a neighborhood in the urban area of zone #4 in the central part of the municipality of New Guinea. Her dream is to finish constructing her home, and to provide the best conditions for her children to study so they are able to make something of their lives, since she was not able to get a degree given her parents’ economic conditions. She hopes to have the working stability to be able to push her children forward.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plaster a room

loans.name: Mcharuko Group

texts.en:
Stephania K., age 53, is single with two children ages 33 and 35.  She lives with her mother. She has a fish business which she started in 1998.  She works daily from 6am until 11pm.  She is able to earn a monthly profit of $31.
 
This will be Stephania’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Stephania will share this loan with her loan group  Mucharuko, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Stephania is 3rd from right front row..

loans.use: To increase fish sales

loans.name: Estrellas Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo “Estrellas” están representados por el señor Gabriel Marcelo y conformado por 12 socias entre las cuales solo existen 2 varones, las edades D. los miembros oscila entre los 23 a 55 años D. edad pero todos tiene sus fuentes D. ingreso a través D. pequeños negocios como  a la venta D. cosméticos por catalogo, venta D. pan, venta D. dulces caseros, ropa, tienda D. abarrotes, venta D. comida y la atención en lavaderos D. autos. La competencia dentro D. sus rubros es alta pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios con la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida y una mejor educación para su hijos. En cuanto a sus antecedentes crediticios se encuentran cursando su tercer ciclo con la Fundación Agrocapital demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas D. crecer para salir adelante.
texts.en:
The members of the “Estrellas (Stars)” group are represented by Mr. Gabriel Marcel and consists of 12 members, among which are only two men. The ages of the members varies between 23 and 55 years, but all of them have streams of income through their small businesses such as the sale of cosmetics by catalog, the sale of bread, the sale of homemaD. sweets, clothes, a grocery store, the sale of prepared meals, and car washing. The competition in their area is high, but in spite of that they know they know that they can get ahead in what they do.

The loan is destined for the growth of their business through the purchase of merchandise, consumables, and tools for increasing their income which will permit them to give their families a better standard of living and a better education for their children. In terms of their credit history, they are in their third cycle with la Fundacion Agrocapital and have demonstrated responsibility, honesty, and the desire to grow and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Capital

loans.name: Liberia Silvia

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, la señora Liberia B. se dedica arduamente a trabajar en su negocio de pulpería el cuál posee y a pesar que ofrece pocos productos y el espacio no cuenta con las condiciones necesarias, ella se esfuerza buscando la manera de cómo mejorar en el desarrollo del negocio.

Actualmente ella requiere de un crédito para la compra de los productos con la finalidad de ofertarlos en su establecimiento y así contribuir al mejoramiento de su pulpería que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Chinandega, Mrs. Liberia B. devotedly works in a convenience store, which she owns. Despite having few products to sell and a space that doesn’t have the necessary conditions, she tries hard to look for a way to develop the business. At the moment, she requires a loan to buy products in order to sell them in her establishment. In this way she will contribute to the improvement of her store which so much requires the investment.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products to sell in a convenience store

loans.name: Rosette's Group

texts.en: N. Rosette is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is a friendly and hard working lady with a grocery business that she has owned for six years. Her main business challenge is selling perishables like tomatoes and yellow bananas but apart from that, she is good. She has good customer care skills that enable her to sell all her stock. Her cleanliness also helps her plus selling quality products. She works hard to saves to ensure that she can own her stall and stop renting. She also wants to ensure that she continues with her children’s education up to the University level. Rosette is married with two children and she takes care of three dependants. She needs a loan to help buy more tomatoes, onions, cabbages, green pepper and so on for her grocery stall.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, onions, cabbages and so on for her business.

loans.name: Starch Factory B1 Ann Atoo Group

texts.en: Ann A. is the president of her group. She is widowed with seven children, four of whom are going to school; additionally, she has three other dependents. She has been in the bakery business for over twenty years now. She has been struggling to find enough capital to keep the business running. She is consequently requesting this loan, which will add capital to her business and allow her to, for example, purchase bagiya ingredients such as cassava flour, sugar, cooking oil, et cetera. The loan will seriously encourage her to work very hard, educate her children, and open up a boutique selling clothes in order to generate even more income.

loans.use: adding capital to her business

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en:
Education is the most important gift Mutabar and her husband can give their three dear children. They believe this because they are responsible parents who work very hard at farming so their children can finish school, an opportunity they never had because they were so poor. Mutabar has worked in agriculture since her wedding, and with the unconditional help of her husband, also buys and sells sheep to meet the family’s other needs. Despite this, she now finds herself with more expenses than expected, and would like a loan to increase the size of her flock. Mutabar and her family are hoping for a favorable response to their request. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to expand a small business by buying more sheep.

loans.name: Mansueta

texts.en:
Mansueta B. manages a general store. She is 51 years old and already a widow. She is blessed with three children – two of them are college graduates and have their own jobs. Mansueta works hard to provide her children access to higher education. She is thankful because, through the business she manages, she is able to support her children during their school days.

Mansueta would like to continue improving her store for financial security as she grows older. In this regard, she would like to ask for additional capital from Kiva lenders of 5,000 Philippine pesos for expansion and to buy additional groceries for her store. She will be glad if this amount is approved.

loans.use: Additional capital for her vending business

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El presente se encuentra en pleno desarrollo, en su cuarto ciclo y avanzando con caD. emprendimiento que caD. una realiza. Todas las madres luchas día a día para ayudar con los gastos de la casa y así logras una mejor condición de viD. para sus hijos.
Se puede hablar de la Sra. Carmen M. de 54 años , tiene 8 hijo que se queD. con la hermana mayor en la casa mientras ella se  va a vender sus  frutas por la calurosa zona del mercad de abasto. Por la tarde se dedica a la  venta de dulces y para ello  sale en compañía de su hijo menor .Ña Carmen es una señora muy sufriD. que tiene un día a día muy pesado  por que al llegar de su casa debe aguantar que el papa de sus hijos que vive de las bebidas venga a maltratarle a ella y a sus hijos.  
Tiene una casita  hecha de materiales precarias como pedazos de maderas y chapas. De esta manera ella sostiene a su familia, es una señora luchadora para sobre llevar con todos los gastos y también con su enfermedad.
texts.en:
The group is evolving with each undertaking and accomplishment, right now they are in their fourth advanced loan cycle. All of the mothers fight day by day to help with the costs of the home and this is how they achieve a better life for their children. Allow us to tell you about one member; Mrs. Carmen M., who is 54 years old and has eight children who stay with her older sister at home while she goes out to sell fruit in the hot area of the wholesale market. In the afternoon, she sells candy and is accompanied by her youngest son. Mrs. Carmen is a woman who has suffered and has a rough daily routine. When she returns home, she has to bear her husband, who is a drinker, and mistreats her and her children. She has a small house made of fragile materials like pieces of wood and scraps of metal or veneer. This is the way she supports her family and is a real fighter to be able to take on all the expenses even with her illness.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise, ingredients for meals to sell and tools to do their jobs.

loans.name: Eneria

texts.en:
Mrs. Eneria M. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Eneria is married and blessed with 4 school-aged children. She owns and operates a business venture, in the agriculture sector, planting and harvesting bananas to sell. She earned 2,000 PHP monthly net from her business. She has been engaged on this business for more than 15 years. In 2003, she joined PMPC to gain access the programs and services of this Co-op. She has successfully repaid her previous loan in the amount of 4,000 PHP. Eneria is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fertilizers and chemicals for her business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Eneria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English by Kiva.  Given that Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and maintenance costs.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona R. is from the village of Malipayon in Pangantucan, Bukidnon. Alona is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Alona owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Alona has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Alona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. Alona is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Alona's 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco C. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual se pudo colocar la losa de concreto en toda la casa.
Nuevamente está solicitando un préstamo para poder terminar los acabados y poder habitar la vivienda, ya que esta pagando renta, desea que su familia ya esté en su propia casa. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como administrador de un hotel. 
Espero contar nuevamente con su cooperación para este préstamo y así terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco C. is grateful for the assistance provided from his previous loan, which he used to install a concrete slab in his house. Francisco is now requesting a new loan in order to complete the finishing touches on his home and also install the posts that hold the power lines, which he currently rents. He desires these jobs to be completed for his family so that they can have their own home. He plans to repay this loan from his salary as a hotel manager. He looks forward to receiving your assistance again with this loan so that he can finish his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the interior/exterior of his house & install electrical posts

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
María S. de 21 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, cuenta con agua y luz como servicio básicos. Es soltera y sin cargas familiares.

El negocio de la tienda lo inicio el papa vendiendo frutas en el mercado de la perimetral. Cuando ella cumplió la mayoría de edad empezó con una tienda pequeña en la casa de sus padres.

Ahora ella trabaja todos los días desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00 vendiendo bebidas, arroz, azúcar, frutas etc. Una de las complicaciones del negocio es no tener un transporte para transportar la mercadería.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar colas, lácteos, arroz, para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener su propio Minimarket.
texts.en:
Twenty-one-year-old María S. lives in a peri-urban area in Perimetral de Guayaquil. She has running water and electricity in her home. She is single and has no family to support.

Her father started out by selling fruits at the perimetral market. When she came of legal age, she opened up her own small store inside her parents' home.

She now works from 7:00 am to 9:00 pm every day selling drinks, rice, sugar, fruit, etc. One of the difficulties of this business is not having the means to transport her goods.

With this loan, she will purchase soft drinks, dairy products, and rice to restock her business. In the future, she would like to start her own mini market.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, dairy products, and rice

loans.name: Williams

texts.en: Williams is a hard working and honest man. He wants to improve the quality of life for his family. He is 38 years old, married without children. He hopes to have children very soon. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. He sells medicines and also treats people in his community. He has been in this business for a long time. Williams is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more medicines sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of salt

loans.name: Sekinat

texts.en: Sekinat is a hardworking and honest woman. She sells medicine at retail prices to make a living. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger. She is happily married, 38 years old and has two children. Her husband also works to support their home. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Sdaung Chourng Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of nineteen people from Sampan village I. Kandal province. Mrs. Sdaung C. is the village bank president who was been selected by the other members, who will all use their portion of the loan for different purposes. She and her husband are farmers who own a small piece of land to grow crops to support their family. Now they face some problems because their field is on time to do farming, but they did not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Sdaung C. decided to ask for a loan to buy corn seed, fertilizer, and fuel. She is the mother of three children,  two of whom are enrolled I. local public school, while the other is still too yO. for school.

loans.use: To buy corn seed, fertilizer, and fuel.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

E.SpanishE. E.byE. E.LisaE. E.GrobarE., E.KivaE. E.VolunteerE.</E.strongE.></E.pE.>

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La Socia pertenece al banco comunal “COLQUECANCHA”; Nuestra Socia vive en la comunidad de Raqchi perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba del departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Antonia, Nuestra socia tiene 49 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 5 hijos, todos ellos dependientes de los socios; Nuestra socia se dedica  a la artesanía ella teje pulseras a mano con lanas de distintos colores y con infinitos motivos andinos, La socia lleva a vender sus pulseras a un valor no mayor que cuarto centavo de dólar cada uno y los vende en el mirador de Raqchi a los turistas que hacen su parada en este bello mirador para apreciar el paisaje; Nuestra socia también realiza diferentes tapices y muñecas de trapo para que tenga mayor variedad de artesanía, el esposo de la socia se dedica íntegramente a la agricultura y juntos mantienen su hogar y cada día mejoran su calidad de vida, ellos también destinan el ingreso de las artesanías y la venta de los cultivos de sus tierras a los estudios de sus hijos. Nuestra socia solicita el dinero para comprar material de trabajo y algunas variedades de artesanías para vender.

Nuestra socia agradece a todos los inversionistas que hacen  posible la realización de este sueño y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Colquecancha Communal Bank. Our member lives in the Raqchi community, which belongs to the Urubamba province, Cusco department. Our member is Antonia. She is 45, married, and has five children. The children are all dependent upon the colleagues. Our member devotes herself to handicrafts. She knits bracelets by hand. She uses different colors of wool with an infinite number of Andean motifs. The member takes her bracelets to sell for no more that a quarter of a dollar each. She sells at the Raqchi viewpoint. She sells to the tourists who stop at this beautiful viewpoint to appreciate the scenery. Our member also makes tapestry and rag dolls to have a greater variety of handicrafts. The husband of our member devotes himself entirely to agriculture. Together they support the household. Everyday they improve their quality of life. The income from the handicrafts and the sale of their crops from their fields is earmarked for their children’s education. Our member is requesting a loan to buy work materials and a variety of handicrafts to sell. Our member is grateful to all of the lenders who make the fulfillment of this dream possible. She promised to pay all of her debt according to the established time line.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: By work materials and a variety of handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Juana Pabla

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana tiene un comercio que se dedica a la compra y venta de artículos generales, ella hace un año que abrió su negocio, ya que anteriormente trabajaba como vendedora en una empresa que se dedica a la ventas de zapatos, ella es soltera con un hijo en edad escolar.
 Con un poco de su ahorro pudo montar su negocio y se   independizo.
 Ella  necesita de este crédito para la compra de mas mercadería para su tienda como, prendas de vestir para hombre y mujer, ya que cuenta con buena cantidad de clientes quienes diariamente acuden hasta su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana has a business buying and selling general items. She opened her store a year ago, since she previously worked as a sales clerk in a shoe store. She is single and has one school-age son. With a little of her savings, Juana opened her business and became independent. She needs this loan to purchase more merchandise, like men's and women's clothing, since she has a good number of customers who come to her store daily.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise for clothing store

loans.name: Mayi

texts.en:
Mayi is married with two children who both go to school.  She owns a beauty salon in Kawempe and works on all types of hair, like plaiting, weaving and relaxing. She wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of relaxers, weaves and braids. She has been in this business for nine years and doesn’t have any other source of income.  She works on all categories of people, women, children and men. She works six days a week. Her main business challenge is the transportation of boxes of relaxers, braids and weaves from Kikuubo in Kampala city to her salon, because she uses public transport to and from shopping, which she does once a week.  

She is hoping to see her business grow into a fully stocked salon and also wants to build a house.  Mayi joined MCDT to boost her business by getting additional capital.  For about $22, she rents and resides in a two-room house which also acts as her salon. The family has access to electricity but no piped water, and her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of relaxers, conditioners,weaves and braids

loans.name: Mahouton Bruno

texts.fr: K. Mahouton Bruno est né en 1972 à Djèrègbé, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Bruno vit depuis une vingtaine d’année à Djèrègbé et est marié à DOSSOU Solange, une coiffeuse.
