Le couple a quatre enfants, et deux autres enfants à leur charge. Seulement certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Bruno vit à Djèrègbé avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Bruno a très peu fréquenté l’école, et a appris la mécanique auto. Depui cinq ans, Bruno exerce cette activité. De façon secondaire, Bruno vend des pièces détachées (pièces de rechange) à Djèrègbé. Bruno s’approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Bruno sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un prêt, afin d’élargir son champ d’activité et d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire. Plus tard, Bruno ambitionne ouvrir une boutique pour y vendre ses articles.
texts.en:
Mahouton Bruno K. was born in 1971 in Djèrègbé, in the commune of Sèmè-Podji, Benin. For the past twenty years or so Bruno has lived in Djèrègbé, and he is married to Solange Dossou, who is a hairstylist. The couple have four children as well as two others who are in their care. Only some of the children have received schooling. Bruno lives in Djèrègbé with his wife and children. Together, the couple take care of the family's various expenses. Bruno did not spend much time in school, and he learned auto mechanics, a profession that he has been carrying out for the last five years. As a secondary occupation he sells spare parts in Djèrègbé. He gets his supplies in Nigeria, a neighboring state to Benin. This is the first time that Bruno has has asked for a loan from ALIDé in order to widen his field of activity and increase his turnover. Later, Bruno hopes to open a store where he can sell his items.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, D. 60 años, es una mujer que siempre a luchado por sobre salir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su querido nieto Henry D. 14 años y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. Con mucho esfuerzo Marcelina pudo poner un cafetín en el poblado D. Huayounioc, con la ayuda D. su fallecido esposo pudo equiparlo y poco a poco lo convirtió en un lugar muy conocido y concurrido. La comida que sirve es muy buena, es por eso que es muy visitada por sus vecinos. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es tener su negocio limpio. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener atender a tantas personas a la vez, ya que sola no se da abasto. Para más adelante, espera mejorar las instalaciones D. su negocio y así brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, si es que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias D. su banco comunal, en donD. ha sido muy bien recibida. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará los ingredientes que necesita para elaborar los platillos que venD. en su cafetín.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 60, is a woman who has always fought to get ahead in life. She lives in her own home with her dear grandson Henry who is 14, and what she wants the most is to live peacefully in her old age. With a lot of effort Marcelina was able to set up a small cafe in the village of Huayounioc. With the help of her deceased husband she was able to fit it out, and little by little she turned it into a very well known and popular spot. The food that she serves is very good, this is why her neighbors visit a lot. What she likes the most about her work is to keep a clean business. She has had her business for 10 years and what she considers the most difficult is to look after so many people at a time, as she cannot cope alone. In the future, she hopes to improve her business facilities and so proviD. a better service to her customers. This is the fifth loan with MFP, she knows that she has to pay all her installments on time, as she doesn't want to cause problems for the members of her communal bank, which has been very well received. With the thousand nuevos soles that she is requesting, she will buy the ingredients that she needs to make the dishes that she sells in her little cafe.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en: Mrs. Khorn L. is a villager in Trapeang Khchau village, Takeo province. She was born in 1951 and she is a farmer who owns a one point five-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Although she tries to work hard, she can earn very  little money to support her family. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Khorn L. is asking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business, and the rest of the loan she will use to buy two piglets, also for breeding, to start a second new business. She is a widow with a child who is studying in school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to start a new business

loans.name: Rebeca Sobeyda

texts.es: La Sra. Rebeca C. es originaria del municipio de Achuapa, su negocio consiste en la venta de fritanga en su casa de habitación donde tiene seis años de tener este negocio donde ofrece variedad de comida rápida. Tiene seis años de trabajar con ceprodel donde le han otorgado ocho créditos consecutivos para su negocio. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de pollo, carne de res, de cerdo, verdura, azúcar, arroz, salsa de tomate y aceite para la elaboración de comida con el fin de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rebeca C. is a native of the municipality of Achuapa. Her business consists of fritanga sales in the house where she lives. She has had this business there for six years where she offers a variety of fast food. She has been working with CEPRODEL for six years and they have provided her with eight consecutive loans for her business. The loan she is requesting is for the purchase of chicken, beef, pork, vegetables, sugar, rice, tomato sauce, and oil to make the food and with the purpose of meeting the demand of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken, beef, pork, vegetables, sugar, rice, tomato sauce, and oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is a 37 year-old married lady who is blessed with two children aged 3 and 4.  She runs a beauty shop and has one employee. She was previously employed before she went into the business.  She says that she has become more focused in her business since she joined Faulu Kenya.  She has requested 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy beauty products.  She hopes to sell beauty products in wholesale in the future.  She sees herself opening more outlets for her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Sadi

texts.en:
Sadi lives with his wife and four children. He runs a small business selling clothing for kids. He has been in this business for several years and has been quite successful. Sadi is a very polite and affable businessman. He offers a variety of good-quality inventory for reasonable prices and his willingness to make sure that his customer’s needs are met help him stay competitive and maintain repeat clientele. A nice, convenient location for his business also adds to the success of his trade. Sadi is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase additional inventory. He believes that financial assistance, in combination with his hard work and perseverance, will help him keep up with competition and contribute to the successful growth and increased profitability of his business.  

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing in order to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Mirtalia De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Mirtalia Muñoz O. es una persona emprendedora, quien tiene su negocio de venta de ropa en el Mercado Israel lewite, tiene mas de 20 años de estar en el Mercado y de tener esta actividad. Ella es madre soltera.
Ella trabaja de lunes a domingos de 6 de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tardes.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de ropa interior, pantalones, blusas y trajes para niños ya que en estos meses las ventas son buenas.
Ha trabajado 21 préstamos con la institución y estos han sido para compra de mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
Mirtalia  Muñoz O. is an enterprising person who owns a business selling clothes in the Israel Lewite market.  She has been working in this business in the market for more than 20 years.  She is a single mother.  She works from Monday to Sunday from 6 in the morning until 5 in the evening.  The loan which she is requesting will be used to buy underwear, pants, blouses and outfits for children since sales are good right now.

She has had 21 loans from the organization and they have all been used to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.use: To buy underwear, pants, blouses, t-shirts and outfits for children

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Iv Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Unidas IV se conformo en noviembre del 2007, y durante este periodo han pasado diversas circunstancias positivas y negativas, que han podido superar y mejorar como parte de un proceso de crecimiento del comité.
 Las señoras son de la ciudad Obligado, distante a 40 km., de la oficina de la fundación. Ellas destinan su dinero para diversas actividades en la zona en donde viven. 

Las señoras comentan que están conformes con el crédito recibido ya que les es de mucha ayuda para seguir adelante con sus actividades, si bien dicen que no es fácil la vida, se muestran luchadoras y fuertes ante los desafíos que se les presenta.
 
Renuevan por 11va vez, pasando al siguiente ciclo por el excelente pago en sus cuotas, donde la directora general.
 Ramona M. las motiva a que sean puntuales y cumplan con sus responsabilidades.
La señora Ramona se dedica a la venta de ropas desde que se integró al comité y comente que le va muy bien.
Ella recurre a varias técnicas de venta, ya que expone sus ropas en su salón y también recorre en casa de conocidos, negocios, o empresas para ofrecer sus prendas. 
Comenta que llega la temporada de mucha venta por lo que quiere contar con suficiente mercaderías para sus clientes por lo que solicita el préstamo para la compra de vestidos, shorts, blusas, remeras, y otros.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas IV” (United Women IV) committee was formed in November 2007 and since then its members have experienced positive and negative circumstances which they have been able to overcome and improve as part of the committe's growth process.

The ladies are from the town of Obligado which is 40km away from Fundación Paraguaya's office.  They use their money for a number of different business activities which they carry out in the district in which they live.

They comment that they are happy with the loan which they have received since it is very helpful for them in succeeding in their activities.  They say that life is not easy but they are showing themselves to be fighters and showing strength when faced with challenges.

They are renewing their loan for the 11th time.  They are moving on to their next loan cycle owing to the excellent way in which they have paid their previous loan installments.  Their managing director Ramona M. motivates them to be punctual and to fulfil their responsibilities.  Ramona has had a business selling clothes since she joined the committee and she says that it is going very well.

Ramona has a number of techniques which she employs to sell her clothes since she displays them in her living room and also travels to acquaintances' homes, businesses or companies to offer her garments.

She comments that the approaching season sees a lot of sales so she would like to make sure she has enough merchandise for her customers.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy dresses, shorts, blouses, t-shirts and other garments.

loans.use: To buy dresses, shorts, blouses, t-shirts and other garments

loans.name: La Unidad 2 Group

texts.en:
Karen is the coordinator of her group La Unidad 2 ("the unit"). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and a child. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have her own house.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying sharing good things with her child.

Karen is excited to be taking her 7th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for around 3 years, starting with her first Esperanza loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying accessories and silver jewelry. She will use the profits to re-invest in her business and she is dreaming of buying a vehicle to expand her territory and increase her sales.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because she liked the program and it is for business; her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Hato Mayor, an area famous for agricultural activities and its rural scenery. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and uncertain electricity.

loans.use: to buy accessories and silver jewelry

loans.name: Las Palomitas Group

texts.es: María Jesús es presidenta de la Alcancía Comunal “Las Palomitas” en ella participan siete personas muy emprendedoras, tal es el caso de María Jesús quien tiene 39 años de edad el nombre de la alcancía se debe que los integrantes viven en un lugar llamado El Palomar; empezó trabajando en una sala de estimulación temprana lo cual adquirió experiencia al trabajar al cuidado de niñitos, conocida también a esta labor como Madre Guía, su esfuerzo no ha sido en vano actualmente es directora de las guarderías de su zona. Los ingresos que le genera dicho empleo construyó un mini departamento en el terreno que le dio su madre así mismo adquirió un terreno propio. De igual manera apoya a su pareja en los gastos de  servicios básicos y parte de educación a sus hijos aún menores de edad. El préstamo lo invertirá en comprar materiales didácticos y decorativos para ambientar su guardería “Gotitas de Amor” para mejor calidez a los niños. Su sueño próximo es ir construyendo de a poquitos su vivienda.
texts.en:
María Jesús is president of the “Las Palomitas” Communal bank.  Seven very enterprising people participate in the bank.  That is the case with María Jesús, age 39.  The bank got its name because the members live in a place called El Palomar.

She started working in an early childhood development room.  She got work experience taking care of children.  This work is also known as “Madre Guía” (Guiding Mother).  Her effort has not been in vain.  She is currently the director of the daycare centers in the zone.  With the income this employment generated she built a small apartment on the land that her mother gave her.  She also got her own land.  This way she supports her life partner with the basic services' expenses and with part of their children’s education.  The children are still minors.

She will use the loan to buy educational and decorative materials for the atmosphere of her child care center, “Gotitas de Amor” (Little Drops of Love).  She will do this to provide the children with more warmth.

Her next dream is to be building, little by little, her house.

loans.use: To buy educational and decorative materials for the child care center

loans.name: Benigna Jovita

texts.es:
Benigna  es socia del Banco Comunal “12 de Agosto”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 63 años, de estado civil madre abandonada, tiene 02 hijos independientes, estudio hasta 2º de educación secundaria

Trabaja desde hace 06 años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, Su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, su préstamo lo invirtió en el negocio de venta de artículos artesanales, venta de prendas de vestir como chompas y gorros.

Ahora requerida de un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio, comprará lanas para su tejido y siete fardos de prendas de vestir.

Su sueño es poner un negocio más grande.

Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y las orientaciones
texts.en:
Benigna is a member of the “August 12th” Community Bank. The bank is located in the Puno District, in the Puno Province, in the department of Puno. She is 63 years old. Her marital status is single mother. She has two independent children. She has completed her second year of high school.
She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past six years. Her first loan was for 300.00 new soles. This loan she invested in her folkcraft business. She sells clothes such as sweaters and hats.
Now she would like a new loan for 500.00 new soles. This money she will invest in embroidery wool and seven packages of clothes.
Her dream is to have a larger business.
She likes the community bank as they provide her with the opportunity to have a loan and also she likes their meetings.

loans.use: She will buy wool and clothes to use to make her embroidery

loans.name: Amos Musita

texts.en:
Amos Musita A. is a 46-year-old man. He is single and the father of four children. Amos has been in the transport business for the last two years. 

This marks his second loan from KADET Ltd., and he plans to repair and service his motorcycle. The anticipated profits will be directed to his children’s education. His dream is to own another motorcycle.

loans.use: to repair and service his motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La señora Maria Isabel  tiene 32 años tiene  2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos. La señora ya tiene 5 años de haber empezado con su negocio,  inicio el negocio en su vivienda, fue así que la mayoría de sus clientes la conocen. El crédito será invertido en la compra de cerdos sus ganancias se incrementan ya que es ahora cuando los precios están bajos. Además ella desea vende al por mayor sus mercancías, pues así la mayoría de sus clientes saben el buen servicio que ofrece. El sueño siempre ha sido realizar mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is 32 years old, and she has two minor children under her care.  She buys and sells pigs.  She started this business five years ago at her house.  That is why most of her customers know her.

The loan is to buy pigs.  Her income will increase because the prices are low now.  Also, she wishes to sell her merchandise wholesale.  Most of her customers know the good service that she provides.  

Her dream has always been to make improvements on her house.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en: Mr. Sergio is married with two children, one of whom is school age. He sells fruit and has two retail locations. One is 3½ miles away and the other is in area four of Ciudad del Este. The business is increasingly on the rise and generates a good income. With the help of his wife he is moving forward with much sacrifice and effort. Today Mr. Sergio is a successful small businessman with a large and loyal clientele because of his kindness. He has proven to be responsible and honest in his commitments and we must provide all necessary support for his endeavors.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Peninah Jerotich

texts.en:
Peninah Jerotich K. is a married woman of twenty nine years. Her husband, Sylvester Komen, has a retail shop and helps to bring income to the family.  They are blessed with one child.  Peninah runs a boutique in Eldoret town, where she sells clothes as well as cosmetics. She has been in this business for five years and gets a monthly income of KES 30,000.


This will be Peninah's sixth loan with KADET LTD.  She has repaid all other loans successfully.   With the loan, she plans to add stock to her shop.   She plans to save new income and build rental houses in the Katalel area in Eldoret  .


In the future, Peninah wants to open a wholesale shop and also educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Mujeres Poderosa 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group "Mujeres Poderosas 1 & 2" ("Powerful Women 1 & 2"). She makes her home in a simple structure together with her family and her son. She says that her most difficult challenge is to establish her home by herself. In the meantime, she plans to continue to enjoy spending time with her only son.

Ana plans to use this loan to invest in her jewelry business, by buying rings, bracelets, chains and other accessories. She will also buy clothes. She will use the profits to invest in her business and she dreams of improving it and being able to build her house and buy some furniture. She has had five loans and she is excited to have this new loan and give one step forward to her business improvement.

Ana's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy clothes and jewelry

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.en:
Ilhom is married and the father of three children. His wife helps him in his business. Ilhom purchases goods from the neighboring region of Khujand and his wife sells them in the central market of Isfara. He is also interested in animal husbandry. Ilhom would like to borrow 10,000 Somoni to purchase a larger volume of food to expand his business, which in turn will help him improve his life. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase more food for resale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys forma parte del banco comunal “Lontué I”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Molina.
Ella se dedica a vender abarrotes, cecinas, lácteos y un surtido de productos en un local que arrienda desde hace 23 años. Su hermana y sobrina le ayudan en la atención de su negocio. 
Su mercadería la compra usualmente en distribuidoras y supermercados mayoristas.
Con éste préstamo comprará mercadería para su local. 
Debido a problemas de salud que Gladys ha presentado, su negocio no ha prosperado éste último tiempo, ya que las ganancias que ha obtenido, ha debido invertirlas en medicamentos y atenciones de salud. Sin embargo, en la actualidad su situación ha mejorado.
Gladys vive junto a su padre y dos hermanos. Su sueño es tener una vida más confortable, que le permita seguir trabajando. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo esperanza, debido a las facilidades de pago e inversiones que podrá realizar para su negocio. Las reuniones para ella son un momento de distracción, ya que éstas son muy gratas. 
Molina es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, ubicada en la región del Maule. Se caracteriza principalmente por ser uno de los grandes polos de la industria vitivinícola chilena. Además de las vides, está la industria frutícola, destacando la producción de manzanas, peras y kiwis.
texts.en:
Gladys is part of the Communal Bank “Lontué I” which is in the city of Molina. She has been selling groceries, cured meats, dairy products, and an assortment of other goods from a rented space for the past 23 years. Her sister and niece help her with managing this business. Her merchandise is usually acquired from distributors and wholesale supermarkets. With this loan, she will buy merchandise for her store.

Due to health problems Gladys has faced, her business has not prospered as of late. Her earnings have been spent on medicines and health care. Nonetheless, her current situation has improved.

Gladys lives with her father and two siblings. Her dream is to have a more comfortable life that will allow her to continue working. She is very pleased and grateful for the loan provided by Fondo Esperanza, as well as with the convenient payment options and investments that have been made in her business. The meetings provide a moment of distraction for her since she finds them to be quite pleasant.

Molina is a community in central Chile, located in the region of Maule. It is known for being one of the great centers of the Chilean wine industry. In addition to the vineyards, the fruit industry also produces apples, pears, and kiwis.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean S. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Jean is married and has 4 school-aged children.  Jean owns & operates a business planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Jean has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Jean joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used for additional capital for her business. Jean is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Jean from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert R. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. He is 33 years old. Robert is single. To make a living, Robert owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling green & yellow bananas in the local community. Robert has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Robert joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Robert has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Robert is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional green & yellow bananas. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Robert from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional green & yellow bananas.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en: Chanthou, age 44, is widowed and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Chanthou, and her late husband, sell fruit, earning an income of $10 each per day to help cover the family expenses. Chanthou's family's standard of living has been improved since Chanthou has had this business. Chanthou is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike that her children can use to commute to work. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to help her children commute to work

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a resident of Kitale town in Western Kenya and has been in active farming for 13 years. She is married with 8 children, all adults. Her farm produces milk, eggs, and vegetables, all sold to the local market.

Esther has made a fourth loan request amounting to 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more poultry birds. She says more birds will give more eggs for family consumption as well as additional income from the business.

Esther says the poultry business faces challenges of diseases, which are very rampant.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry birds.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to expand her sewing business. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. With the loan, she will buy thread, scissors, elastic and needles that will help her finish the orders on time and make better profits. 

She is 36 years old and, along with her business, she also performs her daily household tasks very well. She operates her business from her home which enables her to do both her business and household work side by side. 

Her husband has a business selling construction supplies. He provides the construction supplies to different construction companies and earns income for the family. Sughran has five children. Four of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education while the youngest one is only two years old. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. She is hopeful that an investment will put her business on a more profitable footing. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sughran.

loans.use: To buy thread, scissors, elastic and needles for sewing business.

loans.name: Fasokounawolo Iv Group

texts.fr:
Fasokounawolo IV est constitué de six femmes toutes mariées. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivent  dans des familles polygames à Koba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres, le mil, le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MAMOU, qui est debout à droite, compte acheter les intrants et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,8 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75.000FCFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
Fasokounawolo IV is composed of six married women. They average 30 years of age and three children each, and they live in polygamous families in Koba, a village located in the commune of Massigui, in the Dioïla Prefecture, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali).

They have partnered with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in an attempt to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. They grow millet, rice and groundnuts. This is their fifth loan cycle with the MFI. 

Mamou, seen standing at the right in the photo, will use her loan to purchase inputs and pay for the plowing and weeding of about 0.8 hectares of millet and groundnuts.

After the harvest, the crops are sold in the city of Massigui to a clientele composed of both men and women. Mamou expects to earn an average profit of approximately 75,000 FCFA by end of season.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides, and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, single and lives with five family members. Three of the family members work. 

Amjad opened a shop in 2009 to decorate wedding cars and to rent audio, video, and projection equipment. He has more than three years experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting an $1,800 loan to make a sliding door and to purchase additional equipment for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make a sliding door and to purchase additional equipment for his shop.

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru:
Роза родилась и выросла в Казахстане. Ей 52 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. 
Роза родилась в простой семье. Она была старшим ребенком, у нее 5 братьев и  сестер, большую часть времени посвящала домашним хлопотам: присматривала за младшими братьями и сестрами, занималась домашней работой и небольшим хозяйством. Роза в детстве мечтала стать милиционером - защищать беззащитных и нести справедливость. После окончания школы Роза поступила в военное училище, затем подала документы на высшее образование. После окончания учебы, в советское время судьба отправляет Розу на службу в соседний Кыргызстан, там она познакомилась с будущим супругом. Таким образом, в 1988 году наша героиня выходит замуж, а уже через год у молодожен родилась дочь. Так как оба супруга были военными, жизнь их кидает с места на место, на съемные  квартиры. Пока супруги служили отечеству,  шли годы и семья уже состояла из 5 человек. «Мы не успели оглянуться, а уже по выслуге лет и на пенсию оказывается пора» - говорит Роза. Супруги на протяжении 15 лет откладывали деньги на жилье, и вот в 2008 году они купили дом в центре города Карабалта, на оставшиеся 10 000 сом Роза решила закупить немного товара и попробовать перепродать, первая партия которого ушла хорошо. Роза поняла, что она сможет работать в сфере торговли и выходит продавать на рынок. За три года, Роза увеличила оборот до 60 000 сом, и смогла оплатить учебу в ВУЗе своей старшей дочери.
Для дальнейшего увеличения товарооборта и расширения ассортимента товаров, Роза обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от этой деятельности она планирует вложить в открытие дополнительной точки торговли. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Rose was born and raised in Kazakhstan. She is 52 years old and married with 3 children. 

Rosa was born into an ordinary family. She was the eldest child; she had five brothers and sisters.  Most of her time was devoted to household chores: looking after younger brothers and sisters, housework, and farm work.  As a child, Rosa dreamed of becoming a police officer to protect the innocent and bring justice. After high school, Rose went to military school, then filed documents to apply for a higher education. After graduation, in Soviet times, fate sent Rosa to serve in neighboring Kyrgyzstan, where she met her future husband. Thus, in 1988, our heroine got married, and a year later the newlywed had a daughter. Since both husband and wife were in the military, life threw them from place to place in rented apartments. 

While her husband served his country, the years passed and the family grew to five people. "We have not had time to look around, and it's time to retire,"  said Rosa. The couple had been saving for a house for fifteen years, and in 2008 they bought a house in the city center of Karabalta.  With the 10,000 som  they had left, Rosa decided to buy some products and try to resell them.  The first batch went well. Rosa realized that she was able to work in trade and selling in the market. For three years, Rosa has increased her turnover to 60,000 som and was able to pay for tuition at the university for her eldest daughter. To further increase sales and expand the variety of goods she sells, Rose turned to the company Bai - Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS). She wants to use proceeds from this money to open more shops. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to increase the variety of goods she offers

loans.name: Maria Luzmila

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un pequeño negocio de legumbres, que poco a poco ha trabajado para mantener su hogar. Trabaja desde muy temprano vendiendo tomates, cebollas, legumbres etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere seguir trabajando y darles una mejor vida a sus dos hijos que aun estudian. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, zinc, hierro para su negocio y mejorar asi la vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking woman who has a small business selling legumes. Gradually over time, she has worked to maintain her home. Maria begins her work very early selling tomatoes, onions, legumes, and other products. She has many aspirations for her business. For this reason, she wants to continue working and provide a better life for her two children who are in school.

Maria wants to use this loan to buy cement, zinc, and iron for her business and to improve the life of her children.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for improvements to her business.

loans.name: Yeksana

texts.en: Yeksana is a hardworking woman who is married and has two children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Four years ago, she got the idea to start raising cattle in order to contribute to the family finances. She took advantage of the space she had available on her family’s land to start this business, which she runs together with her husband. Slowly her number of cattle has increased and her clients have started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle

loans.name: Hurihan's Group

texts.en:
Hurihan, the 55-year-old wife of an ecology inspector, is the leader of this group. She and her husband have raised a daughter and a son, the later working for an NGO, providing free consultations to the population on human rights, while their daughter, formerly a school teacher, went to work in Russia this year.

In order to earn additional money to meet their daily needs, Hurihan breeds livestock and cultivates agricultural products, earning about 2500 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, and future profits will be used to improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy, a 40-year-old married mother of four children, lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City where, to earn a living, she has a business selling canned goods, softdrinks, sugar, milk, milo, cigarettes, vinegar, silver swan, etc. She earns about PHP 2,000 each month.

A member of PMPC for 2 years, Judy has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase additional stocks for her general store, and in the future would like to have a grocery store. Judy is an honest person who is proud to be a member of PMPC because of the financial help they provide.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Delia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Delia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Delia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is a 59-year-old married woman with six sons and one daughter. She lives with her children and husband in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She and her husband have run a food stall in front of their house for the past ten years. They sells soups and noodles to people in their community. 

Hong would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing more furniture, cooking appliances, and good-quality food from wholesalers. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To expand her food business by purchasing furniture, cooking appliances, and good-quality food.

loans.name: Silvia Jeannette

texts.es:
La señora Silvia, tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo.

Ella se dedica, a las actividades de fertilización y limpieza de su plantación de árboles frutales: jocote, naranjas, aguacates, zapotes y café. Ya tiene seis años de dedicarse a esto, ella lo aprendió gracias al esfuerzo de su mamá, quien inicio este cultivo y la venta de frutas.

Silvia debe caminar a pie un kilómetro, hacia un desvió y abordar un autobús, para ir a comprar los insumos, para el regreso a su casa, debe pagar $3.00 dólares a una mototaxi, para que la lleve a su casa con los productos.

El préstamo será invertido, en la compra de fertilizantes y fungicidas, con el objetivo de obtener una buena producción de frutas y también para pago de las labores de limpieza y fertilización. De esta forma, ella recibirá un mejor ingreso, lo cual le servirá para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. En un futuro Maria, planea diversificar la variedad de árboles frutales, pare tener una mayor producción y aumentar la fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Ms. Silvia is 26 years old and the single mother of a son.

She has a fruit plantation where she grows jocotes (plum), oranges, avocados, zapotes (sapote plum) and coffee.  She has been in business for six years and learned the trade from her mother grew and sold fruit.

Silvia must walk a kilometer to catch the bus to go buy supplies.  For the return trip she has to pay $3.00 to take a motortaxi and transport the products home.

The loan will be used to buy fertilizer and fungicides for better fruit production and also to pay for cleaning and fertilizing worker costs.  In this manner she will be able to increase her income and improve her family's quality of life.  In the future Silvia plans to diversify the variety of her fruit trees for better production and increased income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fungicides for fruit trees.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 40 years old and lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. He is married with two children. 
Ronald works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. He has been doing this for five years. He has requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase more fish to sell. 
Ronald is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Ronald hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
30-year-old Jessica is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has three children aged between 4 and 10 years old. Jessica's husband works as a fisherman and driver.

Jessica runs a sari-sari store business in her town. She sells various items like shampoo, soap, canned goods, and noodles. Jessica also helps sell her husband's catch at the market.

Jessica has requested a loan to buy fishing nets and more items to sell such as canned goods and rice. Jessica hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and more items to sell such as canned goods and rice.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 33 years old and is married with two children aged between 3 and 8 years old.  Gilbert has five years' experience selling drinks. He currently employs one person to help him and the hours of his business are from 5am to 7pm every day.

Gilbert has requested a loan to purchase large quantities of sorghum to make drinks to sell. With profits from the loan, Gilbert would like to satisfy his family's basic needs and start saving for his future.

loans.use: To purchase large quantities of sorghum to make drinks to sell.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam, 61, is a diligent farmer who has been working in the agricultural business for many long years. Because she can get enough water from the river, she is able to grow rice crops twice a year both in the rainy and the dry seasons. She works with her husband. They are blessed with four children, all of whom are single. The family lives together in Prey Chor district. 

To strive for better living conditions, Mrs. Sam has requested a loan from HKL to buy a used motorcycle to provide a good means of transport for the whole family. This will mean they can avoid taking any motor-taxi services. Mrs. Sam intends to enlarge her farmland in the coming years if she has adequate capital.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle to provide good means of transport for the whole family.

loans.name: Dancan

texts.en:
Dancan is a resident and a farmer of Kitale, Western Kenya where he lives with his wife.  He has has been practicing farming for the last three years and sells his products of maize and beans to the local market .He also runs a carpentry workshop for additional income.

Dancan has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo in order to help him buy and insure a dairy cow at 31,200 KES and to buy poultry at 10,000 KES.  He says the dairy cow will provide milk for family consumption as well as income to meet other basic needs besides food.  He plans to expand the dairy business to five dairy cows in five years.

He faces the challenge of food shortages.

loans.use: to buy poultry and to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bassima

texts.en:
Bassima is a 36-year-old married woman and the mother of five beautiful children. Bassima has sold laundry detergent for the past six years. Bassima is helping her husband in covering their needs.

Through a requested loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, Bassima will be capable of increasing her stock and increasing her profit. Bassima will also be capable of fixing her house ceiling especially in this cold weather for her children's safety. Bassima hopes to open a grocery store in the future.

loans.use: to increase her business capital through increasing her stock.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Mrs. Anh is a hard working woman, 47 years old. She is married and has two children. She would like to improve her living standard. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine and she is able to repay the loan from salary.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Félicienne Dédé

texts.en:
Madam Félicienne Dédé H. is 43 years old and a mother of four (04) children. Her husband was compressed in an enterprise and jobless for 5 years. All the expenses relay on her what give her much pains. But, thanks to her trade of smoked fish, flour, maze and beans, she manages to provide for the household basic needs. However her fund is not enough to growth her trade and increase her incomes. Very serious in her businesses, she enjoys from a good morality and deserves to be backed financially. Madam Félicienne Dédé H. requests a credit of $850 which will serve to make a storage of smocked fish, flour and beans. The implementation of this project will increase her incomes to improve the family living conditions.

Madame H. Dédé Félicienne est âgée de 43 ans et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Son mari fut compressé dans une entreprise et est sans emploi depuis 5 ans. Toutes charges de la famille lui reviennent en grande parte. Ce qui lui donne beaucoup de peine. Mais, grâce à son commerce de poisons fumés, de farine, de maïs et du haricot, elle se débrouille pour subvenir aux besoins essentiels de son foyer. Or, son capital est insuffisant pour accroître son commerce et augmenter ses revenus. Très sérieuse dans ses affaires, elle jouit d’une bonne moralité et mérite d’être soutenus financièrement Madame H. Dédé Félicienne sollicite un crédit de $ 850 qui servira à faire un stock de poisons fumés, de farine, de maïs et du haricot. La réalisation de projet augmentera ses revenus pour améliorer les conditions de vie sa famille.

loans.use: to make a storage of smocked fish, flour and beans

loans.name: Aiga

texts.en: Aiga A. is one of most talented woman in weaving fans by using the Samoan tree called lau fala (pandana). She is from the village of Malie.  She is forty years of age and has seven children.  She loves weaving fans.  She said "weaving fan is another good way to earn money," because many tourists that come to Samoa to explore the beauty of the island, they are interested in buying fans because of the hot weather. She has no doubt of running her business, she’s confident in doing everything.  She earns more than sixty dollars a day from her selling samoan fans.  She has a strong feeling that she will enlarge her business in the near future.  She will use her loan to buy some more plants, in order for her to weave more fans, and also to buy paints to make the fans colorful and attractive.  Her business is going pretty well each day and there are more customers coming to buy stuff from her. She sells her fans at the Flea market,village shops,and also in front of some of the shops at town.  She is very delightful of the handicrafts business that she’s doing it at the moment, and it really helps her to satisfy family needs.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials and equipment

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is a 55-year-old mother of three girls. Her husband died two years ago in a terrorist attack in Kirkuk. In 2005 she bought a sewing machine to work in the home and earn money for her family. At sunrise every day she starts her work full of energy, despite all the hard and difficult circumstances that she is facing. Shinvested her knowledge of the market, and she is determined in innovating new methods of work.

She now seeks a loan of $1200 from Al-Aman. She hopes to get larger loans and build a credit history in the future, which will enable her to develop her small business. The purpose of this loan is to buy a new and modern sewing machine.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan. Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Buy new sewing machine

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina is 61 years old and has 18 children if whom only 2 still live with her and her husband. They others have already moved out. They have their own house in a rural area 120 km from the city of Encarnación where her husband works the land and rears animals. Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays Saturnina goes to the market in the city with a group of neighbours to sell their products in the main market in the city. She mainly sells pork, turkey and duck meat as these are the main products that they produce. It is a very hard job as they have to spend 2 nights sleeping by their stalls where they sell, but despite her age she does it enthusiastically. The loan that she would like is to enlarge their pig sty as pork is the main product that they sell in the market and for this reason they would like to build a new pig sty of 2 x 2 metres to rear 4 more pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Saturnina de 61 años de edad, es madre 18 hijos, de los cuales actualmente solo dos viven con ella y su marido, los demás ya se independizaron de la unidad familiar. Poseen su casa propia en una comunidad rural distante a 120 Km. de la ciudad de Encarnación, donde su marido se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales. Los días jueves, viernes y sábados, la Sra. Saturnina llega hasta el mercado de la ciudad junto con un grupo de vecinos para vender sus productos en la feria municipal de la ciudad de Encarnación. Ella en particular comercializa carne de cerdos, gallinas caceras y patos. Los productos que comercializa son la mayoría de su producción, y cuando es necesario compra de sus vecinos. Cabe destacar que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, pues vienen en grupo y se quedan a dormir dos noches en sus puestos de trabajos, y ella a pesar de su edad lo hace siempre con mucho entusiasmo. El préstamo solicitado es para la ampliación de la infraestructura que posee para la cría de cerdos. Siendo este actualmente el producto que mayor demanda tienen en la feria y si compra de terceros su ganancia es menor que si los produce ella misma por lo que desea construir un galpón de 2 x 2 metros para criar 4 cerdos más.

loans.use: To build an extra pig sty/construcción de un galpón para cría de cerdos

loans.name: Siti

texts.id:
Siti age 45 started making and selling cakes since 5 years ago. Her daily journey starts as early as 3am where she needs to prepare the materials and be ready the delicacies before dawn. She would later distribute her cakes to stalls and her usual customers. Her daily revenue is 50.000 rupiah which is used to finance her daily expenses and remainder will be saved for rainy days. She lives with her husband Abdullah. Her monthly rental expenses is 120.000 rupiah. Siti hopes that with kiva's help she will be able to raise her 3 kids, to buy her own house and lastly expand her business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Diusianya yang ke 45 tahun Siti tetap dengan usahanya yang Ia jalani sejak 5 tahun yang lalu yaitu membuat kue basah dan menjualnya. bahan-bahan yang dibeli oleh Siti mulai diolah pada pukul 03.00 subuh sehingga ketika matahari mulai menampakkan sinarnya semua adonan kue telah siap dipasarkan. Kue-kue tersebut nantinya akan diantar Siti ke warung-warung dan para langganan lainnya yang biasanya bekerjasama dengan Siti. Siti mendapat keuntungan dari usahanya adalah 50.000 rupiah/hari, keuntungan tersebut digunakan untuk biaya hidup setiap hari dan sebagian disimpan untuk keperluan yang tidak terduga. Siti tinggal bersama suaminya yang bernama Abdullah dengan mengontrak kos-kosan dengan biaya 120.000 rupiah/bulannya dan ditempat inilah Siti mengolah kue yang dipasarkannya. dengan keahliannya ini Siti mampu membesarkan ketiga anaknya impian untuk mempunyai rumah sendiri dan usaha yang berkembang merupakan harapan Siti dimasa yang akan datang.

loans.use: Untuk membeli bahan-bahan kue - To purchase ingredients for making cakes

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Mr. Stephen O. is 36 years old, married with 2 children, and lives in Benin City. He sells provisions, which he learned how to do for 6 months, before he established his own business in 2004. He is asking for a loan in the amount of $250 to enable him buy more provisions for sale. He has been a LAPO client for 3 years.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Sallamatu

texts.en:
Sallamatu K. is 47 years old and married with 5 children. Her husband is a small retailer in the town market of Magburaka in Sierra Leone, while Sallamatu sells palm oil and a few other items out of their home. This is because currently the business is too small to obtain a space in the market and they don't have enough capital for Sallamatu to get into wholesale. Her business stock increased after her second loan, however, for which she will complete payments in December.

Sallamatu is currently requesting a loan of US$ 275 to purchase 80 gallons of palm oil. This, she said, will permit her to expand her business, increase her profit, and reduce time and expense for travel to purchase the goods. Her future plan is to earn enough to enable her 4 children to complete their education at the college level.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of palm oil at a time and lower her expenses by decreasing travel back and forth

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Mrs. Hoa R. is 49 years old and is a widow with three children. She works as a housewife cooking food for her family. Her children work together to raise their standard of living. One of them runs a groceR. stand selling provisions of  food to the people in her community. She makes on average around $5 each day in revenue. Another one is employed by a private company earning around $70/ each month and the rest of whom is married and stays separate. Mrs. Hoa R. hopes to use this loan to purchase extra groceR. products to expand her daughter stand in order to meet her client’s need and make more of a profit.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products for her daughter to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
To inves4t in a high volume of merchandise.

Invertir en mas mercaderia a mas alto volumen

loans.name: Belen Cerro De Oro (Group 1)

texts.en:
Across from school’s cement courtyard, where turkeys spread their tails, mocking the unfortunate fate of the fried chickens being sold for lunch, sit 28 women under the shade of an avocado tree. Shifting periodically to avoid the sun's glare as it tracks across the sky, the women of the Belen communal bank are perched on rocks, steps or sitting flat on the ground, waiting for their meeting to begin. They have come from all over their town of Cerro de Oro, by foot, tuc tuc, or bus, to this central spot where they have been meeting once a month for the past seven years. Surrounded by poverty, this avocado tree brings them hope with each meeting. It is under this tree that they receive their loans from Friendship Bridge and learn how to best invest to change their futures.

The majority of the 28 women are artisans, born and raised in a region known for its beautiful weavings. Of the 28 women, 11 are asking for a loan of 32,500 quetzales ($4,275), ranging from $300 to $400 per person. All of these women will invest their loans in weaving and embroidery businesses, purchasing thread and fabric for intricate huipiles (traditional woven blouses, like the ones in the picture), skirts, scarves, and blankets. The supplies they purchase come from the nearby town of Santiago de Atitlán. One woman also sells firewood, the main source of fuel in the area, to supplement her weaving business. She will use about 25% of her loan to invest in firewood.

Long before the monthly meetings under the avocado tree, the women of Belen worked long days in the factories of other weavers, earning meager incomes that could barely provide food or shelter for their families. Since joining Friendship Bridge, all 28 women have become their own bosses, opening their own businesses, employing as many as five other women in turn. They are also teaching their daughters the trade, which is an important aspect of the Atitlán culture. However, their dreams go further for their children. Their children all attend the local school, and their mothers dream that they will learn to read and write, acquiring knowledge of other things, so that someday they can break free from the struggles of their parents and enter a world full of opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase firewood and weaving thread

loans.name: Narcisio

texts.en:
Narcisio is 37 years old and is originally from Inhambane. He is married and has 4 children. He went to school in Inhambane until 5th grade (in two more years he would have finished primary school) and in 1995 moved to Swaziland to live and work with his father.

In Swaziland, his father had been working in a lodge since 1989 and his boss employed Narcisio as well. After gaining his boss’s trust, Narcisio was sent in 1997 to Ponta D’Ouro in Mozambique to look after 3 rental houses that the boss had there. Ponta D’Ouro is a beach village on the border with South Africa, very famous for its tourism, especially among South Africans.

Narcisio looks after the houses, helps manage all the employees who work there, and does any repair that is needed. He earns R1600 per month (around US$ 200) and is able to save a bit from time to time. His wife Angelica also works in one of the houses as a cleaning lady and earns R600 (about US$ 70) monthly. Narcisio and Angelica live in a room in the back of one of the houses, mainly because Narcisio is also in charge of security. Their children sleep in a house Narcisio is building, but spend most part of the day with them.

Narcisio first approached Hluvuku in 2000 asking for a loan to start a grocery stand. As the value requested was denied, Narcisio decided to postpone the idea. In 2005 he bought a piece of land and decided to start building a house, so he asked again for a loan to buy construction material, which was approved. This is Narcisio’s third loan and will still be used to buy construction material. The house is almost ready; this time he will buy some missing windows and doors. Before borrowing though Hluvuku, Narcisio used to ask his boss to lend him money, but the boss would make him pay at once, normally deducting from his salary, and that was too much for him. Hluvuku in his opinion is very good because he repays an amount he can afford every month and still has money to support his family.

In the future, Narcisio intends to ask for a new loan to keep improving the house and once it is ready, he hopes to start building 2 others, as he already has other land close to his house. He dreams about giving each of his children a house to live in.

The picture shows Narcisio with his 9-year-old daughter Aida.

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is fifty years old, and she and her husband have five sons and three daughters, all of whom live with Mom and Dad. To supplement her family’s income, Matilde sells a collection of products such as liquid soap, perfumes, hair treatment, hand and body lotions, toilet paper and the like. Bi-weekly, she goes outside her community to Santo Domingo, the capital, to get her products. She says that people of Don Gregorio, her community, need those goods and there’s not enough suppliers offering them to the community.

With her loan, Matilde will bulk-buy products and add new items in order to allow people to meet their needs. That way, Matilde will ensure the healthiness of her business and she’ll better support her family.

loans.use: Purchase of an assortment of products such as soap, perfumes and the like.

loans.name: Aleyda

texts.es:
Aleyda and her husband created a shoe factory in their own home 2 years ago. With the experience that her husband acquired while working at a large shoe factory, they started their dream business. Now, Aleyda has become an expert in putting the finishing touches on shoes. The high demand for their shoes makes them happy, and they would like to improve and increase production buy purchasing more supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Aleyda y su esposo constituyeron hace 2 años una fábrica de zapatos en su propia casa. Con la experiencia que adquirió su esposo durante muchos años en una gran fábrica iniciaron sus sueños y ahora Aleyda se ha vuelto toda una experta en los acabados de los calzados.La demanda de sus zapatos los tiene muy contentos y desean mejorar e incrementar su producción con la compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima.

loans.use: Purchase more supplies to make shoes

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa is a partner of Communal Bank "Creative Women", and lives in the San Martin region and the Moyobambo province and district in the El Dorado neighborhood. She dedicates herself to the preparation and sale of food, in an equipped location in the central market of the afore-mentioned city, in the food section where her customers come on a daily basis.

She is a widow and in her eagerness to keep going for her sons and provide them with a better education and stay near to them she decided to dedicate herself to what she liked best, the sale of typical food. She began this business by borrowing a small place in the market and thanks to her perseverance and efforts she was able to purchase it in order to continue working.

With this loan of S/. 400.00 ($150.00) to be repaid in 4 months, she would like to purchase bulk quantities of rice, bags of sugar and oil to reduce the very elevated costs.

Mrs Rosa is 70 years old, lives with one of her daughters who drives the business. She considers herself a fulfilled woman with plenty of experience.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “MUJERS CREATIVAS ”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Moyobamba y distrito de Moyobamba en el jr. El Dorado barrio de belén Nº 166, se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, en un ambiente acondicionado y ubicada en el mercado central de dicha ciudad, sección comidas donde diariamente acuden su comensales. Al quedar viuda y en el afán de sacar adelante a sus hijos y dar una mejor educación y estar cerca de ellos decide dedicarse a lo que tanto le gusta, la venta de comida tipo menú. Inició su negocio prestando un pequeño puesto dentro del mercado y que gracias a su perseverancia y esfuerzo pudo comprar para así seguir trabajando. Con el préstamo de S/. 400.00 a ser pagados en 4 meses, implementó su negocio comprando arroz, azúcar por sacos, aceite a granel ya que sus costos cada vez son más elevados. La señora Rosa tiene 70 años, vive con una de sus hijas quien le impulsa en el negocio, ella se considera una mujer realizada llena de experiencia.

loans.use: Purchase greater amounts of consumable goods

loans.name: Upendo's Heshima Group

texts.en:
Upendo is 40 years old, married, and has 2 children, ages 13 and 9. She became a charcoal seller in 2005. She works from 8am to 6pm at her business everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $74 from her sales.

Upendo hopes this loan can help her buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with chicken sales and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: El señor Antonio tiene 49 años, es discapacitado de su mano izquierda y esto no lo mira como un obstaculo para luchar en salir adelante  es una persona que jamas se rinde, el tiene una tiendita llamada "ABARROTES LA COMADRE" la cual la atiende su esposa, la señora Fanny para ayudarle a su esposo , aparte de esto el señor por las noches elabora como velador para una empresa.El esta solicitando este prestamo para comprar mercancia para su negocio y asi hacer que crezca y tener un mejor modo de vivir... tu tienes el poder en tus manos ayudemoslo!!!!

loans.use: SURTIR MERCANCIA PARA SU NEGOCIO

loans.name: Bertha Adelina

texts.es: Esta señora inició su negocio con un pequeño capital propio y el primer crédito lo obtuvo con ADIM cuando ADIM inició operaciones en esta localidad y desde entonces ha ido mejorando cada vez más, ella tenía una pequeña tienda de granos y ahora tiene un tramo de abarrotes con variedad de cosméticos bastante surtido con numerosa clientela y excelente ubicación en el mercado de Rivas. Vive con su esposo que le ayuda en el tramo, piensa  mantener el inventario y surtir cada vez más  de nuevos productos para incrementar sus ventas y mantener a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This lady started her business with a small capital of her own and she obtained her first loan with ADIM when ADIM started operating in this area and since then she has improved a lot. She started with a small store selling grains and now she has groceries, a large variety of cosmetics for her numerous clients, and excellent facilities at the market of Rivas. She lives with her husband who supports her with her business, she wishes to maintain the stock, improve it with new products in order to increase sales, and keep her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products in order to increase sales.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es:
La señora Emérita S. Rodríguez tiene 24 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal San Luis y es secretaria, también pertenece  al comedor popular de su zona, vive en el barrio las Flores N° 30 del caserío Motil del distrito de Agallpampa de la provincia de Otuzco del departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió educación primaria completa, pero no continuo por falta de medios económicos. 
Se casó con Agustín Alfaro y tienen dos hijos que aun son niños.
Su negocio empezó cuando ella con su esposo compraban repuestos para motocicletas y su esposo que es mecánico los vendía, su esposo continúa en el negocio pero ella se ha independizado, actualmente ella compra y vende leña, lo realiza en su casa.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles que devolvió en 4 cuotas compró repuestos para motocicletas y separó una parte para comprar leña y así lo hizo.
Con este crédito de 500 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas piensa comprar solamente leña.
Su sueño es tener una tienda grande.
texts.en:
Emerita, 24, belongs to the San Luis community bank and is its secretary. She also belongs to the "comedor popular" ["people's dining room"] in her area. She lives in te Peruvian "provincia" of La Libertad. She finished elementary school but was unable to study longer because there was no money to do so. She married Agustin Alfaro and they have two minor-age children.

Her husband, a mechanic, used to buy and sell spare parts for motorcycles and she used to help him. He still buys and sells motorcycle parts but she now operates an independent business selling firewood, a business that she runs from her house. With an initial 300-soles loan that she repaid in 4 installments, she bought motorcycle parts and, separately, firewood which is how she got started. With this 500-soles loan, to be repaid in 4 installments, she plans to buy nothing but firewood. Her greatest hope is to have a large store.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood for resale.

loans.name: Fransisco Jose

texts.es:
Francisco José C. tiene la edad de 43, su estado civil es casado, el tiene 3 hijos de los cuales su hija de 21 años de edad estudia anales clínico, un varón de 19 años que recientemente cursa el 5 año de bachillerato y una niña de 9 años que cursa el 4 grado de primaria, su compañera de vida labora como responsable de la boutique glamour, sus sueños son de comprar una casa que sea para sus hijos  para que así puedan vivir unidos y buscar su propia independencia, sus propósitos son de establecer un negocio en su casa de habitación donde pueda ofrecer mejor su mercadería donde sus clientes puedan escoger sus productos .



La actividad económica es de mercadería en general que expande los productos de: pantalones, camisas, camisas sport y trajes para damas Don Francisco tiene este negocio desde hace 4 años, el inicia este negocio por cuenta propia y empieza realizando viajes a Managua donde realiza las compras con pequeñas cantidades de ropa y por sus amistades obtuvo un sin numero de clientes y para suplir la demanda es que decidió ampliarse por el cual es el motivo del financiamiento para la compra de mas producto que se realizara en el departamento de Chinandega y Managua para que asi le pueda favorecer mejor.
texts.en:
Francisco, 43, is married and has 3 children: a daughter, 21, who is studying clinical analysis; a son, 19, who recently finished a 5-year baccalaureate; and a daughter, 9, who is in the 4th grade. His wife manages a beauty salon. They would like to buy a house for their children so that they can live together and gradually become independent. Their goal is to set up a shop at home where they could better show their merchandise and serve their customers. Francisco earns his living selling merchandise such as pants, blouses, sports shirts and suits for women. He has owned the business for 4 years. He started it on his own, traveling to Managua where he buys small quantities of clothing. Thanks to his good nature, he has an endless number of customers. He's decided to apply for a loan so that he can meet the demand for his goods. He'll buy wholesale supplies of merchandise in Chinandega and Managua because that's where he can get the best deals.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Imran

texts.en:
Imran I. is a 39-year-old trader who sells different kinds of food and cigarettes. Imran started his business in 1993, in very hard times of the country and for himself, when he fled to Bilasuvar, an Internally Displaced People Settlement during the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict.

Unemployment pushed him to start selling different kind of goods. He started to sell eggs and step-by-step he expanded his business and now he rents a place. He is married and has a daughter. Imran`s dream is to build his own store and provide for his daughter's education. For this purpose he applied for 1200 USD. He will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs.

loans.use: Purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Anna M. is 49 years old and from Mwanza. She is married with four children, who are between the ages of 12 and 19 years old.

Anna M. has been running a cosmetics business since 2005. She sells many different types of cosmetics, like body lotions, powders, perfumes and "super black." She works at the business for 13 hours per day, 6 days per week.

Anna M. currently earns about $380 USD from her business per month. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD in order to purchase more cosmetics to sell. In the future she plans to add more cosmetics to her business to sell. Anna M. thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Mercy
