texts.en: Mercy A. sells drinks in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Her husband is a commercial driver. Mercy is 36 years old and married with 6 children. She needs a loan to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther G. is in the business of selling fish and beans at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Esther is 45 years old and is widowed.   She has 1 child and her child do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Expand her food selling business

loans.name: Padawo

texts.fr: Agée d’une quarantaine d’année, Mme Padawo P. est mariée et est mère de sept (07) enfants. Son activité principale est la vente de charbon de bois qu’elle achète de l’intérieur du pays et le revend à Lomé, elle sollicite un financement. Les bénéfices tirés de ce commerce serviront à l’éducation des enfants et à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
About 40 years old, Mrs Padawo P. is married and the mother of seven (7) children. Her main activity is to sell charcoal, which she buys in country and sells in Lomé. She is asking for a loan. The benefits from the loan will help finance the education of her children and to improve the living conditions of the family.

Translated from French by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sell charcoal

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Mrs. Carmelita A. is 52 years of age. She is married and has two children. She signed up for her Paglaum membership because she is attracted to the various programs and services that the cooperative has offered.

She runs a sari-sari (variety) store and she sells fruit. Despite going through a lot of challenges in her business pursuits, Carmelita believes in hard work. She said that Paglaum is true to its word in bringing hope to its members and potential members. With the wide array of programs and services, the members can find it all with Paglaum. She dreams of sending all of her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fruit in addition to sari-sari store stocks

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La señora Flora es socia del Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente, no tiene  hijos  y estudio primaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 años, inició su negocio de crianza de truchas; tuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, que le sirvió  como capital adicional para comprar alimento para sus truchas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos, comprará alimento para truchas. Afirma que este negocio le va bien solo que las ganancias demoran (es poco lento).
Ella desea seguir trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus 04 cuotas.

La señora Flora desea comprar una casa en Ilave.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flora is a member of The Community Bank Maria Asuncion Galindo, in Juli district, province of Chucuito, Department of Puno. She is 43 years old, lives with her partner, has no children, and completed primary school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for one year and started her business of raising trout. She had an initial loan of 300.00 new soles which was used as additional capital to buy feed for the trout. With this loan of 500.00 new soles, she will buy feed for the trout. She claims that this business is going well, only that the profits are delayed (a little slow). She wants to continue working with the Manuela Ramos Movement and agrees to punctually make her four payments. Mrs. Flora wants to buy a house in Ilave.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feed for the trout

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Agé de quarante neuf ans (49),Adama chauffeur de camion, transporte des fruits de la Casamance vers la capital Dakar. La Casamance, région située au sud du Sénégal, est la principale région productrice de fruits du pays. Chaque semaine il  fait  le trajet avec son camion pour livrer la marchandise. Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent de payer les traites pour le camion mais aussi de nourrir  sa famille. Pour payer  la vignette et les taxes annuelles, il sollicite un prêt de l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
At 49 years of age, Adama is a truck driver and transports fruit from Casamance to the capital, Dakar. Casamance, a region situated in the south of Senegal, is the main fruit-producing region of the country. Each week, he makes the journey with his truck to deliver merchandise. The income drawn from this activity allows him to pay the costs for his truck and also to feed his family. To pay the road and annual taxes, he is seeking a loan through IMCEC.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay road taxes

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Reyna Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Reyna esta conformado por las personas Reyna Isabel S. O. y Luis Alberto M.. La actividad económica de Doña Reyna es la venta de tortillas y venta de frijoles cocidos. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella inicio este negocio con fondos propios, y le fue muy difícil por que no tenía a una persona que se encargara de vender sus tortillas, por lo que después de elaborarlas Salía a recorrer las diferentes cuadras para venderlas. Los financiamientos le han ayudado para sacar adelante a su negocio, el dinero será destinado para la compra de maíz, leña y cal. Sus sueños son de terminar de construir su casa. En cambio Don Luis tiene 79 años la actividad económica de Luis es la venta de leña. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio. Don Luis inicio este negocio por cuenta propia, por lo que este fue uno de los negocios que más le gusto. El financiamiento será utilizado para capital de trabajo para la compra de medicinas para su caballo ya que es su mejor herramienta para facilitarle su trabajo. el sueño de Don Luis es que su negocio se mantenga activo.
texts.en:
The solidarity Group Reyna is conformed by Reyna Isabel S. O. and Luis Alberto M.. Mrs. Reyna economic activity is the sale of tortillas and baked beans. She has been in the business for over 20 years and started it with her own funding. It was very difficult since she was the one who made them and then went out to sell them.

The loans have helped her to improve her business. The loan will be used to purchase corn, wood and salt. Her dreams are to finish building her house.

Mr. Luis is 79 years old and has been selling firewood for over 15 years. He started his business on his own, because this was one of the businesses he liked the most. The funding will be used for working capital to buy medicine for his horse which he depends on for his work. Mr. Luis's dream is that his business remains active

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes D. is a married and the mother of three children, two sons and one daughter, all of whom are currently in the primary school. She is 25 years old, and lives with her children and husband in a house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a student at the moment, while she makes a living as a baker, supplying bread to her community. Agnes has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She wants to expand her business and make enough money to give her children good educations.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour in bulk

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen C. is already 59 years old. She is married to Vicente, a foreman in a construction site in Cauayan. They are blessed with six children. The couple proudly said that all of their children have graduated from college. The family is residing at Barangay Research Minante 1, Cauayan City Isabela, in a large community with many residents.

Helen is engaged in direct selling. Aside from that, she also sells some kitchenwares to her friends and neighbors. Being a business-minded person, Helen had also ventured into meat vending three months ago. She usually sells her meat products at Gamu, Isabela. With that, she is earning PHP1,000 daily which is very helpful to her family. Wanting to make her meat vending business grow, she decided to avail of a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP20,000 as additional capital.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Sara Sebastiana

texts.es: Doña Sara es originaria de la comunidad de patzarajmac del municipio de Totonicapan desde cuando ella tenia catorce años aprendio ha coser a maquina como operaria cuando ella cumplio veinte años  decidio iniciar su propio negocio  y compro una su maquina, con trabajos pequeños, luego compra otra maquina porque consigue a otra persona, para bordados hasta la fecha realiza un sin fin de costuras, hoy necesita de un credito para otra trabajador la cual necesita incrementar su produccion y  mejorar su nivel de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Sara is from Patzarajmac in the municipality of Totonicapán. At the age of 14 she learned to operate a sewing machine. When she was 20, she decided to start her own business, bought a sewing machine and carried out small orders. Later on she bought another machine to make embroideries. So far she made a great many sewing jobs. Today she needs a loan to hire another worker and increase her production. Sara hopes to better the standard of living of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing materials

loans.name: Isidra De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Isidra R. labora en el departamento de León en su negocio de venta de frutas las que son comercializadas por ella misma con el propósito de mejorar su condición económica en su negocio que tiene en buen dirigir.

Ella ha logrado brindar las condiciones necesarias a su familia para su desarrollo y hoy en día una vez mas ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las frutas como lo son los bananos para ofrecerlos en su establecimiento y satisfacer a sus clientes que a diario le visitan.
texts.en:
Sra. Isidra R. works in the district of León selling fruit. She hopes to manage her business well enough to improve her financial situation.

She has been able to provide for her family’s basic necessities. Sra. Isidra has come to CEPRODEL once again to request a loan so that she can purchase fruits, such as bananas, so that she can offer them at her vending location and satisfy her customers who pass by every day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda J. is from the village of Pan-ay, Claarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Cresilda is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Cresilda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Cresilda is just starting this business.

In 2009, Cresilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cresilda is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Cresilda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Sonia es casada, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Sonia junto a su esposo tienen una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende repuestos de moto, productos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Sonia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuesto de moto.
Los sueños de Sonia son terminar de construir su hostal.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Communal Bank “Alianza” (Alliance). She is 27 years old, married, and has 2 children. Sonia and her husband have a store in a rented location where they sell motorcycle parts. They acquire their inventory from the city of Lima.

Sonia needs a loan of 2000 soles in order to buy motorcycle parts. She dreams of finishing the construction of her hostel.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a moto-taxi

loans.name: Felecien

texts.en:
Felecien R. is 30 years old and single. He cares for two dependents aged 19 and 23. Felecien lives with his parents in Bugesera district, a western province of Rwanda.

Felecien has owned his bakery since 2006. His shop is open everyday from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. and employs three people. His projected monthly profit from his business is 180,000 RWF (approximately US$300).

Felecien is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing additional equipment for making large quantities of bread.

loans.use: To buy additional baking equipment

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco T. lives in the town of P-6 Gata Daku Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 52 years old, married and has four grown children. Francisco makes a living by transporting people around on his motorcycle. He has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from his work.

In 2007, Francisco joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services that would help him improve his life and expand business. He has successfully repaid three previous loans from GDMPC, and is applying for a new loan to use to expand his business. He plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve his family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units overing the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand a small transportation business

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is a home-based tailor and a married woman with 2 children. She's 44 years old. She has been involved in this business since 2004, where she provides, in collaboration with her husband, for the needs of her children. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a new sewing machine to offer a variety of products to her clientele.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza is 47 years old and has a hog raising business. She is married to Sonny and has six children to support. Her additional sources of income are rice farming and a duckery. Liza has limited capital to do business – that's why she sought help from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to obtain a loan. Now she would like to request 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy more pigs. This loan will help her continue her business with a low interest charge.

loans.use: To buy pigs and feed

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Maria es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan” desde hace 3 año atrás del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 37 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos. Estudiò secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales y gaseosas.
Maria nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital y comprar chuño, habas, cebada y gaseosas.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar màs mercadería como chuño ,habas, cebada, y gaseosas.
Su sueño para el futuro es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y la puntualidad de las reuniones.
texts.en:
Maria has been a member of the community bank "San Juan," in the Yunguyo district and province and department of Puno, for 3 years. She is 37 years old, lives in common law marriage, and has two children. She completed her secondary education and now buys and sells cereals and soft drinks.

Maria tells us that with her first loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement, which was for 500 Soles, she was able to increase her capital and buy chuño (dried potatoes), beans, barley, and soft drinks. She now seeks a loan of 1500 Soles with which she will be able to buy more merchandise like chuño, beans, barley, and soft drinks.

Her dream for the future is that her children can become working professionals. Her favorite things about her community bank are the savings and the punctuality of the members.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chuño (dried potatoes), beans, barley, and soft drinks

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Vorn N. (pictured here), age 67, is a widow with three sons. All of them are married; two live outside the family home. She is living in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Vorn has been selling groceries and rice for twenty-five years. She buys them from Takhmao market for resale in front of her house in the village. She is requesting her first loan of US$1,000 to expand her business. She will use the loan to buy grocery items and rice for resale.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and rice for resale

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen B. is from the village of Malipayon, Pangantucan Bukidnon. Karen is single. To make a living, Karen owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Karen has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Karen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Karen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Karen is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Karen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Khoudia

texts.fr: Khoudia N. est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est âgée de 55 ans et membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans. Elle fait de l'élevage de poulets et développe en même temps un petit commerce de chaussures et d'écharpes. Elle vise à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Khoudia N. is married and mother of three childrenn. She is 55 years old and has been a member of the local « Banc Villageois » loan group for two years. She raises chickens and is also starting a small shop where she sells shoes and scarves. Her aim is to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Saye

texts.en: Saye T. is a 40-year-old woman from the region of Diourbel in Senegal. She is married and a mother of three children. She has been a member of the Village Bank "MBarry Gouytane" for eight years. Her main activity is raising sheep and selling them on the market. This loan will enable her to buy more sheep. The resulting revenue will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more sheep

loans.name: Muthui

texts.en: Muthui is a 45 year old married man who is blessed with seven children.   His wife is a farmer, while he works in a quarrying business.  He has been in the quarrying business for over ten years and he has employed four people.  He learned the skills for operating this business from previous employment in the mines.  He has requested Kes.20,000 from Faulu Kenya to purchase quarrying equipment.  He hopes to buy a piece of land and a motorbike in the future.  He sees himself expanding his business and increasing the number of his employees in a few years' time.  He describes himself as hard-working.

loans.use: To buy equipment for quarrying

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
O. is married and blessed with five children who are excelling in school. She is 40 years old and is a native of Edo State, Nigeria.

O. is into the business of tailoring and the sales of sarongs and has been in this business for fifteen years. She sews lovely Nigerian and Western styles for her customers and hopes to own a world class tailoring stall in the future. She has been able to care for her family with the proceeds of her business.

O. needs the loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and beads to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria P. is a 45-year-old widow who supports her family by engaging in an eatery business. She lives in Pader Aguisan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental with her four children, who are all between 14 and 23 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her eatery business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 9,000.

Maria is now borrowing Php 18,000 in order to expand her eatery business. This will be her 14th loan cycle from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step on her journey towards economic freedom. Maria aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Chérifath

texts.fr: Née en 1975 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, H. Chérifath est mariée à METONOU Raphiou et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Chérifath habite depuis dix huit ans, le quartier N'Vènamédé à Cotonou, avec son mari et ses enfants. Chérifath vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges de la famille. Chérifath n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et contribuer aux dépenses familiales, Chérifath vend des fruits et légumes (mangues, bananes, pommes de terre, carottes, concombre, papaye, beterave, feuilles de laitue, oeufs, etc.) à Cotonou. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Chérifath achète ses produits. Chérifath exerce cette activité depuis vingt ans et a déjà obtenu six crédits auprès de AlIDé. Chérifath  est une bonne cliente de ALIDé, qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter le stock de ses produits, pour mieux faire face aux exigences de sa clientèle, Chérifath sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1975 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Chérifath H. is married to Raphiou METONOU and is the mother of four children, all attending (or having attended) school. Chérifath has lived for the past 18 years in the N'Vènamédé borough of Cotonou with her husband and children. She helps her husband and handles jointly with him all family expenses. Chérifath has not attended school. To meet her needs and contribute to family expenses, she sells fruit and vegetables (mangoes, bananas, potatoes, carrots, cucumbers, papayas, beets, lettuce, eggs, etc.) in Cotonou. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Chérifath has been in business for 20 years now, and has already benefited from six loans with ALIDé. She is a good client of ALIDé’s, who readily reimburses her loans. Wanting to strengthen her business and increase her stock of supplies to meet customer demand, she is now requesting another loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of fruit and vegetables, and cartons of eggs

loans.name: Jupilier

texts.en:
Jupilier C., age 25, is from the village of Poblacion Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 25 years old. Jupilier is married, and he and his wife have a baby. To make a living, Jupilier owns and operates a business providing motor transport services. Jupilier has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Jupilier joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. He hoped to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Jupilier has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,0000 PHP from GDMPC. Jupilier is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. 

This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jupilier from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
A newly recognized member of ASHI, Josephine C., is requesting a loan which she will use as additional capital to grow her small eatery, which is located just in front of her house. The variety of foods she cooks and sells has captured the taste of many people living around and in her village. However, growing her small livelihood activity without access to loans was hard, considering that the income she earns every day must provide all the needs of her family. 

Now that she is with ASHI, Josephine is hoping that her business will really grow and become stable so that she will be able to pay for her husband's medications as well as for the education of her four children, especially when they go to college someday. Presently, her eldest (14 years old) is in high school and her second child (11 years old) is in elementary. Her third child is in a preschool while her youngest is only one year old.

Josephine knows that being poor and having a husband who is ill, she will be undergoing a lot of challenges before she can improve her family's standard of living. However, with the services of ASHI that she can access, she hopes to overcome poverty.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and utensils for her small eatery.

loans.name: Richard Lawrence

texts.en:
43-year-old O. Richard Lawrence is a teacher and he has been teaching in Kayunga for the last fifteen years. Because of his vast teaching experience, he has enjoyed a reputable status in the numerous schools he teaches in.

What has made Richard successful in his profession is the fact that he researches a lot and he emphasizes a practical approach in whatever he teaches. He mainly teaches sciences. To all appearances, he is a jolly and friendly gentleman and this is an attribute that most of his students have come to cherish.

The teaching profession has often been cited as one of the lowest paying professions in the country, with teachers earning in the paltry range of 150,000 to 200,000 shillings. This is a fact Richard has been so aware of for a long time. The low remuneration has affected him in many ways. Particularly, he has not been able to readily pay all his children’s fees on time.

Richard says he has faced many challenges as a result of being financially hard-up over the years. He reckons this loan will empower him to sustainably cater for all his six children’s education.

loans.use: To pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Melba Yesenia

texts.es: Melba tiene 22 años, vive en casa con su  hijo de 5 años a su cargo. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a vender prendas de vestir, ofreciendo a personas que en su mayoría son conocidas o familiares, eso le garantiza el pago de la mercadería que vende. Afirma que este negocio es muy rentable porque compra a un precio módico las prendas y puede ofrecer a un buen precio a sus clientes, es así que se abastece de mercadería Una de sus metas es mejorar sus ingresos para realizar mejoras a su vivienda. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en pantalones, camisas, faldas, ropa interior y productos en general.
texts.en:
Melba is 22 years old and lives at home with her 5-year-old son. For the past 5 years she has sold clothing items, selling to people who are mostly acquaintances or family members, which guarantees she will be paid for the merchandise she sells. She says that this business is very profitable because she buys clothing at low prices and can sell them at a good price to her customers, and then she can stock up on merchandise. One of her goals is to increase her income so that she can improve her home. With the loan that she is requesting, she will invest in buying more pants, shirts, skirts, underwear, and general products.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en: Marisol P. is from Barangay Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 44 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Marisol owns and operates a business selling balut, a philippine delicacy, in the local community (a balut is a fertilized duck or chicken egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten in the shell). She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Marisol joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Marisol plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Brgy. Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Bertha Nubia

texts.es: La Sra. Bertha Nubia R. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como Responsable del Cyber en la Alcaldía Municipal de El Sauce donde tiene  1 ½  años de laborar para dicha Institución. En Ceprodel se le han otorgado dos créditos para Gastos personales. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de ropa y zapatos escolares para sus hijos ya que se avecinan las fiestas patrias en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Bertha Nubia R. is from the municipality of El Sauce. She works as a computer systems manager for the municipality of El Sauce. She has worked for this institution for 1 ½ years. CEPRODEL has granted her two loans for personal expenses. She has requested the current loan to buy school clothing and shoes for her children, since the patriotic festivals in our country are approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying school clothing and shoes

loans.name: Florence Piyalo

texts.fr: Mme K.  Florence Piyalo est née le 08 janvier 1975 à Kara au nord du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Enseignante, elle s’est adonnée également au commerce de vente de charbon de bois et d’ignames. Cette activité complémentaire marche très bien et elle compte la développer. Elle sollicite donc un crédit afin de constituer un stock important de charbons et d’ignames qui lui permettra de générer de meilleurs bénéfices et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mme K.  Florence Piyalo est née le 08 janvier 1975 à Kara au nord du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Enseignante, elle s’est adonnée également au commerce de vente de charbon de bois et d’ignames. Cette activité complémentaire marche très bien et elle compte la développer. Elle sollicite donc un crédit afin de constituer un stock important de charbons et d’ignames qui lui permettra de générer de meilleurs bénéfices et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: vente de charbon de bois et d’ignames

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita C. is 51 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. She is from the village of Del Pilar within the municipality of Cabatuan, a part of Isabela province on the Luzon islands. Perlita runs a general store from which she sells both food and daily use products to the local community. Perlita is just starting this business.

In 2009 Perlita joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. Perlita successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell. Perlita is requesting a new loan, her fourth from ASKI, of 12,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement the family's income.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 29 years old and married with 3 children who are between the ages of 4 and 6. Two of the children are currently attending school. He is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya where he has been farming for 5 years. His mixed farm produces tea, maize, tomatoes and vegetables which he sells to the local market. He depends on the income from his farming activities to cater for the basic needs of his family.

He has requested this loan of 30,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and maintain a dairy cow. The proceeds from the sale of milk will help him pay school fees for his children and improve the livelihood of his family. His biggest challenges have been unpredictable weather conditions and lack of enough animal feed. He hopes that in future he will be able to expand his farming activities by acquiring 3 more dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maria Irene

texts.es:
La señora Maria Irene V. es trabajadora de la Alcaldia De Chinandega con quien tenemos un convenio con cuotas deducibles de salario quincenalmente, lleva ya 06 años de trabajar con CEPRODEL y ha obtenido 07 creditos los que ha utilizado para brindar major condiciones de vida a su familia y sufragar algunos gastos imprevistos.

Doña Maria Irene habita en el Barrio San Agustin es madre soltera de dos hijos en edades escolares, ha sido muy cumplida con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Irene V. is employed by the City of Chinandega with which we have signed a Salary Deduction Agreement applicable every two weeks.  

She has collaborated with Ceprodel for 6 years and has obtained 7 loans that she’s used provide improved living conditions for her family and to pay for a few unforeseen expenses.

María Irene lives in the San Agustín neighborhood.  She’s a single mother of two school age children.  She has made her repayments on time

loans.use: For Personal Expenses.

loans.name: Mayerlin

texts.es:
Mayerlin C. es una mujer muy jovial que vive en el Municipio de Malambo área metropolitana De la ciudad de Barranquilla; ella se dedica a la venta de cuadernos, resmas de papel, accesorios femeninos y juveniles y todo lo relacionado con la papelería, en una miscelánea que tiene en su propia casa, donde vive con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 11 a 18 años. 
Su credikiva lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para responder al mes de Diciembre,  que se viene con muchos pedidos de esta  mercancía, pero también comprará  útiles escolares, preparándose para el mes de Enero, temporada en la cual regresan los estudiantes a los colegios y repuntan las ventas de estos materiales. 
La historia de su negocio llamado Shaday que significa “Dios todo poderoso, el todo suficiente” y que inició con el propósito de apoyar a su esposo en la gestión del hogar, que trabaja como vigilante de una empresa y siempre es su gran apoyo, porque es quien después de  su jornada laboral,  hace las compras, pues conoce muy bien como se mueven los proveedores en el mercado,  y las mercancías apropiadas, de acuerdo con las especificaciones que Mayerlin le entrega, respondiendo a lo que sus clientes han solicitado.  
Mayerlin cuenta que su negocio ha contribuido con el mejoramiento de su autonomía, reforzado por los créditos, que le han significado mayor liquidez para irse a comprar de contado y aumento de sus ingresos para beneficiar su hogar. Su credikiva es el sexto financiamiento por parte de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que ha crecido personal y empresarialmente y con la que planea ir de la mano, para lograr su sueño de ampliarlo significativamente hasta lograr el reconocimiento y el posicionamiento no solo de su comunidad sino también de todo el municipio y de sus alrededores.
texts.en:
Mayerlin C. is a cheerful woman who lives in the municipality of Malambo, in the metropolitan area of Barranquilla. She earns her living by selling notebooks, paper, accessories for woman and girls, and anything else connected with the stationery business which she runs from a small store in her house. She and her husband have three children between the ages of 11 and 18 years.

Mayerlin plans to use her Kiva credit to buy clothing as December brings with it many orders for items of clothing. She also wants to buy school supplies in preparation for January when students return to school and sales of this kind pick up.

Her business is called Shaday which mean “All-powerful God”. She started it in order to help her husband with household costs. He works as a security guard for a company and is a great help to Mayerlin. After his day’s work, he buys stock for her store as he knows where the best deals are in the market and the best items to buy according to the instructions Mayerlin has given him which, in turn, depend on what her customers are looking for.

She notes that her business has helped her become more independent. The loans have given her more liquidity to buy on account and increase her income, thus benefitting the household. 

This is her sixth loan with Kiva partner, the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, an organisation which has helped both her and her business grow. She plans to continue working with them so she can fulfill her dream of becoming a well-respected person not only in her community but also within the municipality and surrounding areas.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing and school supplies

loans.name: Ham

texts.en: Ham, a 53-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal Uganda, is charged with the responsibility of looking after his wife and children. Ham owns his home and his wish is to establish a stable and sustainable venture that will earn income for the family. He has been working as a night watchman for three years, and this has enabled him to educate his children. His business plan is to own at least two motorcycles to supplement his salary. Ham intends to buy a motorcycle with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Bendiciones De Dios 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Sylvenia is the coordinator of the group 'Bendiciones D. Dios' 1, 2 & 3 (God Blessing), a group of Haitian immigrants living in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and the tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity that can't be counted on. She lives in a modest home with her husband and two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is the divorce process she is facing right now and the effect on their children. In the meantime, she plans to continue to enjoy doing business.

Sylvenia is excited to be taking out her seventh loan with Esperanza after having repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for more than nine years, starting with her own resources when she was living in Haiti. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying bed cloths, curtains, clothing, etc. Sylvenia will re-invest the profits in her business. She dreams of building her own house.

This Esperanza associate began with us because her business needed capital to grow, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti.

loans.use: To buy clothing and bed cloths

loans.name: María Leonor

texts.es:
Maria Leonor tiene 61 años de edad, es separada y reside en un sector marginal del distrito de Chiclayo, la capital de la región Lambayeque, es una zona bastante conocida a nivel nacional por su abundante movimiento comercial y de  trasporte.

Se dedica a la comercialización de condimentos y especias en un puesto situado en el mercado 9 de Octubre, ella ya tiene más de quince años dedicándose a esta actividad y durante este tiempo ha podido obtener una clientela estable y fidelizada, la cual prefiere los productos de buena calidad y el buen trato que ofrece. María se ha valido de esta labor para salir adelante y mantenerse activa durante todo este tiempo. 

Actualmente ella desea surtir su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y aumentar su nivel de ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles, con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María Leonor is 61 years old.  She is separated and lives in a poor sector of Chiclayo district, the capital of Lambayeque region.  This is an area that is quite well-known nationally for its bustling commercial and transport activity.

María sells condiments and spices on a stall in the 9 de Octubre market.  She has been in this business for more than fifteen years and over the years she has attracted a stable and loyal customer base who like the good-quality products and good customer service that she offers.

María has used her work to get ahead in life and remain active all this time.  She would currently like to stock her business by purchasing more products so that she can meet her customers' demands and increase her sales levels.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will enable her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy more products so that she can meet her customers' demands and increase her sales levels

loans.name: Limainge Ole

texts.en:
Lamainge Ole N. is 40 years old. He is married and blessed with six children.Lamainge is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last twenty five years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his third loan which he is planning to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and educate his children.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land for farming and build  rental houses.Lamainge is a painstaking man who can do more if supported financially

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mr. Koy Touch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In the village of Angk Neareay in Takeo Province, twelve people have made up a village bank group to request a loan. Each member will use his or her portion of the loan for different purposes to improve his or her family's living.

Mr. Koy T. is a village bank president who has been selected by the other members. He and his wife, Mrs. S. Kuov, are farmers who own a 2-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. Mr. Koy T. also breeds some cows. To improve rice production in his field, Mr. Koy T. is requesting a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and gasoline. He is the father of two children. One of his children is a farmer, and his other child attends local public school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and gasoline

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal “Inka Wasi” ubicado en el distrito D. Puno, provincia D. Puno y departamento D. Puno, tiene 59 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene 04 hijos (2  independientes), la señora no tiene estudios.
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace un año, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta D. verduras y frutas.
Con éste crédito D. S/. 400.00 nuevos soles, comprará 100 unidades D. choclo, verduras y naranjas.  La señora trabaja sola pero recibe la ayuda D. su esposo quien es carpintero.
Su sueño para el futuro es agrandar el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la ganancia D. sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of the "Inka Wasi" community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is 59 years old, married, and has 4 children (2 of whom live independently).  She did not attend school.

Andrea has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling fruit and vegetables.

Andrea will use this loan for 400 Peruvian soles to buy 100 units of corn, vegetables and oranges.  She works alone but receives help from her husband who is a carpenter.  Her dream for the future is to expand her business and improve her income.  What she likes about her community bank is the money she makes on her savings.

loans.use: To buy 100 units of corn, vegetables and oranges

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional beans, sugar, rice, tomatoes and other vegetables

loans.name: Geoconda Jacinta

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Geoconda, tiene 40 años de edad, hace varios años tuvo una relación y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos de 19, 17, 16 y 13 años de edad, el mayor de ellos está en Universidad y los tres restantes están en colegio, todos viven en su casa.

Ella trabaja en las mañanas en una cevicheria pero en las noches de los días sábados, domingos y días  de feria atiende su propio negocio, tiene una carreta en la que vende hot dog y hamburguesas. Nos cuenta que esta es una forma honesta de ganarse la vida y que esto lo viene realizando desde hace tres años y que le ha servido para poder sacar adelante a su familia.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pan, carne, salchichas y otros ingredientes para su negocio. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres años y gracias al primer crédito puso su negocio. Su sueño es tener su restaurante.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres con Esperanza” (Hopeful Women) communal bank meets every two weeks in Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds because of the great amount of this fruit that existed here back then.

We found Geoconda, 40, here.  She was in a relationship several years ago that produced four children who are 19, 17, 16 and 13 years of age.  The oldest of them is in the university and the last three are in high school; they all live at home.

During the morning she works at a "cevichería" (seafood cocktail shop) but on Saturday and Sunday evenings she tends to her own business: she has a hotdog and hamburger stand.  She tells us that this is an honest way to earn a living that she’s been doing for the last three years and that has made it possible for her to support her family.

She will use this loan to buy bread, meat, sausages and other ingredients for her business.  She’s been in the communal bank for the last three years and thanks to the initial loan she was able to open her business.  Her dream is to own a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy bread, sausages and other ingredients.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Rodolfo es un hombre viudo que vive en el barrio Carrizal con sus 4 hijos en las edades de 12 a 33 años; en esta comunidad alegre y solidaria está ubicada su tienda llamada “Tienda del señor Rodol”, como comerciante,  Rodolfo tiene una experiencia de 25 años y 5 de haber comenzado su propia tienda, allí vende ranchos, víveres, bebidas y en general productos de la canasta familiar. Rodolfo tiene una familia muy unida  y está rodeado de buenos  vecinos, los cuales  han sido sus pilares para recuperarse en las etapas más difíciles de su vida personal,  como la muerte de su esposa hace 8 meses. El negocio de Rodolfo vende diariamente desde muy temprano en la mañana hasta muy tarde en la noche, por eso es muy reconocido en el sector y esto es su gran fortaleza; él está interesado en hacerlo crecer y por eso recurre a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante un credikiva, con el comprará mercancías en mayor volumen, como arroz, azúcar, aceite, enlatados aprovechando que al adquirirlas en gran cantidad obtiene mejores precios, que así mismo puede trasladar  a sus clientes de manera muy competitiva y también ahorra mediante su credikiva porque lo adquiere   a una tasa de interés apropiada. El sueño de Rodolfo se centra en generar con su negocio, la posibilidad de llevar a sus hijos a ser profesionales de éxito, aumentando sus utilidades a más de un 32%, mientras se recupera poco a poco de la pérdida de su esposa.
texts.en: Rodolfo is a widow living in the Carrizal neighborhood with his 4 children, aged from 12 to 33. He has established his shop, called “Tienda del señor Rodol” (Mister Rodol’s Shop), in this cheerful and caring community. Rodolfo has been a trader for 25 years, and he has been running his own shop for 5 years. He sells meals, groceries, drinks and common products for families. Rodolfo’s family is a very close-knit one, and he is surrounded by good neighbors, who have assisted him when recovering from the most difficult phases of his life, such as his wife’s death 8 months ago. Rodolfo works every day in his shop from very early in the morning till very late at night: this is why he is well known in the field, and this is his great strength. He is interested in making his activity grow, and for this reason he has requested his firs loans to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo though a credikiva loan. He will use the loan to buy greater quantities of products such as rice, sugar, oil, canned food; he will take advantage of the fact that by purchasing large quantities he can buy at better prices, which in turn means he can offer more competitive prices to his customers; at the same time, he will be able to save through his credikiva loan, as he will obtain the loan at a suitable interest rate. Rodolfo drams of being able to offer his children the chance to become successful professionals thanks to his job, by raising his profits of more than 32%, while recovering little by little from the loss of his wife.

loans.use: To buy greater quantities of products such as rice, sugar, oil, canned food.

loans.name: Ritza Zulema

texts.es:
doña Ritza Zulema O. tiene 35 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Arenas de la ciudad de Choluteca, Ritza se dedica a la venta de sandias en su vehiculo desde hace mas de 2 años. reparte la fruta en varias colonias y caserios cercanos a choluteca.
Ritza cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo para cubrir con los gastos del hogar, su esposo trabaja en una gasolinera.
Ritza es madre de 2 hijos los cuales estan pequeños, en sus tiempos libres lo dedica a la iglesia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de sandias al por mayor.
la sandia es una fruta que se consume mucho en esta zona.
texts.en:
Doña Ritza Zulema Ordóñez is 35 years old and lives in Barrio Arenas in the city of Choluteca.  She's been selling watermelons out of her vehicle for over two years, distributing the fruit throughout the colonies and rural areas close to Choluteca.

Her husband, who works at a gas station, helps her cover household expenses.  Ritza is the mother of two small children and in her free time does work for the church.

She plans to use the loan to buy wholesale watermelon which is the fruit with the highest consumption rate in the area.

loans.use: To buy watermelons

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena earns a living through farming and selling meat. She tills a piece of land where she grows rice crops. She also raises pigs and sells their meat to the people in her community. Nena has been engaged in rice farming for 20 years, and started selling pork meat 3 years ago.

Nena is a widow with 5 children to look after. Nena works hard to sustain her family. She is planning to use the loan to purchase fertilizers, piglets and feeds.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, piglets and feeds

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is married and she is 60 years old. She has a tailoring shop in their village. She makes curtains and clothes. Angelita is asking for a loan for PHP 13,000 to purchase materials needed for her business like needles, thread and cloth. Her husband is a farmer. She has had her business for almost 20 years and earns PHP 6,000 monthly. She will use her profits for additional business to gain more income. She hopes that ASKI and KIVA will continue to support her business.

loans.use: to purchase needles, thread and cloth

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is from the village of Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old, married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Betty runs a business venture in the retail sector running a general store in the local community. 

Betty has been engaged in her business for 16 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities. Betty joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35000 PHP from PMPC. 

Betty is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP with which she will purchase more products for her general store such as dry goods, can goods, soap, etc. This loan will be the 20th loan taken out by Betty from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchased products such as can goods, dry goods, soap, etc. for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She is living with her parents and four siblings. She has been working in the agricultural field since 2008. She grows a wide variety of vegetables using large plastic tents. These tents allow her to grow more types of products throughout the year. She is well established in her business and has a wide range of tools and equipment to help with her work. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. for the purchase and installation of a plastic tent. She estimates that with the coming harvest, her profits will be increased.

loans.use: to purchase new plastic tent

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan's husband is a taxi driver. He transports passengers between cities. Hanan is a mother of eight daughters and three sons. Hanan's husband needs to pay for car license and insurance fees, therefore she took out a loan from FATEN to cover the fees.

The taxi is the only source of income for Hanan's family. Hanan is a conservative woman therefore her husband Talal is photographed instead .

loans.use: to pay car license and insurance fees.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 40 years old and lives in Paynesville. She’s married with nine children who all live at home and attend school. For the past seven years, Alice has been selling dry goods from home. Her main challenges are taking care of the children and slow business during the rainy season. Alice learned about the business from her parent. Alice has requested this loan to buy more goods for her business. In the future, she would like to have her own house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her business.

loans.name: Jeanine Adolphine

texts.fr:
Femme mariée, âgée de 45 ans, mère de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 17 et 25 ans. Elle est dans le commerce du poisson salé dans un marché depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les dépôts de vente poisson salé en gros, elle le revend en détail sur une table. Ses recettes journalières sont comprises entre 20.000F et 30.000F, elle joue sur les prix au rabais pour satisfaire les clients à revenus moyens.

Avec le prêt qu’elle va avoir, elle va renforcer son stock de poisson salé en achetant : 3 cartons de morue,  2cartons de poissons soles,  4cartons de thon.
Ce stock lui permettra d’attirer plus de clients, de vendre beaucoup afin d’augmenter ses revenus. 

Ses objectifs sont : acheter au moins 10cartons en stock, faire du poisson localement, fournir sa marchandise dans les grands restaurant de la place. Comme une bonne mère de famille, elle contribue à l’éducation de ses enfants en aidant son époux dans la gestion du foyer.
texts.en:
This is a married woman, 45 years old, and the mother of two children, aged 17 and 25. Her business has involved salted fish at the market for ten years. She gets her supplies from warehouses selling salted fish wholesale. She resells the fish retail from a table. Her daily receipts range from 20,000 to 30,000 francs. She offers cut rates to satisfy middle-income customers. 

With the loan she will obtain, she is going to bolster her stock of salted fish by buying: 3 boxes of cod, 2 boxes of sole, and 4 boxes of tuna. This stock will enable her to attract more customers and to sell a lot in order to increase her revenues. 

Her goals are: to buy at least 10 boxes of inventory, to deal in local fish, and to provide her goods to large restaurants in the area. Like a good mother, she contributes to her children's education by helping her husband to run the household.

loans.use: to buy boxes of cod and salted fish

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam is a 39-year-old humble villager who has been living in Siem Reap Province for a long time ago. She and her husband have given birth to two school-aged kids. 

Mrs. Sam and her husband are working in the same field at construction sector. Mr. Sam’s husband is highly skilled at building stone and wooden houses. He has a few physical laborers to help provide his service. He receives a lot of orders from his clients to construct their houses. Mrs. Sam and husband have been paying money for taxis to get to work because they don't own a vehicle. To solve this trouble, Mrs. Sam and her husband are applying for a loan to purchase a new motorcycle, which will allow them to commute to their work location.

In future plan, Mrs. Sam will buy housing materials for rebuild her old house and to support her children to finish high level of education.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 42 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Susan works very hard to provide for them.

Susan runs a convenience store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her convenience store like toothpaste, groceries, etc.

Susan has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, spices, chips, bread, etc. 

In the future Susan would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her convenience store.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
For the last 10 years, Nancy has been practicing crop farming and raising livestock. She is 47 years old and married to David. They have eight children.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. She paid the other loans well and in good time. She has been loaned KES 42,000. She intends to use the loan to buy animal feed, fertilizers and seedlings.

In the future, Nancy hopes to practice large-scale farming, which will increase her income.

loans.use: To buy animal feed, fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is showing a bar of soap. She sells a lot of things in her provisions shop. She is married and has 4 children. Her business is about 15 years old. Her husband works with the prisons office in Cape Coast. Yaa supports her husband to take care of the general needs of the home. She will use the loan to purchase provisions to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa plans to save, to build another shop.

loans.use: to purchase provisions to sell.

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe FOTEMOGOBAN est constitué de 4 femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles. Les prêts antérieures ont été correctement remboursés.
MAYAMA KADIATOU, qui fait le commerce de bois de chauffe, est la première assise à droite.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 7 chargements de charrette d’âne en bois de chauffe. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de la ville de Sikasso. Elle effectue sa vente dans son  quartiers à Banconi  sur commande et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail et au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The "Fotemogoban" group is made up of 4 married women with an average age of 38 and, on average, 5 children, and who mostly live in polygamous families in the town of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are now on their eighth loan cycle with the microfinance institution of Soro Yiriwaso and are requesting the loan in order to invest in their businesses so that they can satisfy customer demand. All their previous loans have been fully repaid.

Kadiatou, on the far right of the picture, sells firewood. She will use her part of the loan to buy 7 donkey cart loads worth of firewood. She gets her supplies in the villages around Sikasso and, together with her family, resells the wood in her local district of Banconi. The wood is ordered by her customers who pay for it in cash. She predicts an average monthly profit of around 37 500 francs, some of which she will use to repay the loan and interest, the rest of which she plans to save. She would like to increase her revenues so that she can re-invest in her business and increase her level of customer service.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Sari

texts.en:
Sari, 45 years old, is a food seller and earns $3.50 per day. Her husband is a farmer and earns $4 per day. They have three children, one of whom is studying and the other two are working, which earns the family another $9 per day. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $10 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a camera to be a photographer. This loan will help her family to have a new career that can better support the family. She wants to repair her house when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy a camera to be a photographer.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is 46 years old and is married. Her husband operates a lathe machine. He provides iron items and repair services for spare parts to his clients. He is very expert in his work and his clients are very satisfied with his work.  Razia operates a clothes business at her home.  She purchases clothes at wholesale and sells stitched and unstitched clothes to her clients, according to their demand. She makes good profits from her business every month. 
She is the mother of 3 children and all of them are getting their education by attending a nearby school. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her business. With the loan, she will purchase clothes in bulk quantity. That will allow her to offer more variety of clothes to her clients and will increase her profits. 
She has recently started her business and is very hopeful that her business will improve further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr:
Akoua est une femme âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée à un retraité et est mère de 3 enfants dont 1 scolarisé. L’ainé des enfants a 30 ans et le benjamin 23 ans.  
Akoua travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1991. Elle achète et revend des céréales genres maïs, haricot, du charbon et des ignames à toutes personnes à son domicile. Elle s’approvisionne dans les localités environnantes de Lomé. 
Akoua a requis son premier crédit de  WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbon, de céréales et d’ignames. Elle  pense réinvestir ses profits supplémentaires dans la pérennisation de son activité.  
Dans les prochaines années, Akoua voudrait agrandir sa clientèle. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit contribuer aux besoins alimentaires, éducatifs et sanitaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Akoua is a 54-year old woman. She is married to a pensioner and is mother to three children, one of whom is studying. The eldest of her children is 30 years old and the youngest 23 years old. 

Akoua has been working as a retailer since 1991. She buys and sells cereals such as rice, beans, as well as charcoal and yams, to everyone from her home. She gets her supplies from the towns surrounding Lomé.

Akoua has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy sacks of charcoal, cereals and yams. She is thinking of reinvesting supplementary profits in order to sustain her busness. In coming years, she would like to expand her customer base. She says that with the profits she is planning to contribute to her family's nutritional, educational and health needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Avazkhon

texts.ru: Более 8 лет Авазхон занимается выращивание молодых деревьев. Он сам является владельцем данного бизнеса и имеет хорошую репутацию. В данный момент он имеет 5000 шт. саженцев абрикоса. Кроме этого он занимается скотоводством и имеет 2 голов овца. Осенью со своей семьей он занимается переработкой абрикоса, а потом продает зимою. Авазхон хотел бы получить займ для покупки горюче смазочных материалов.
texts.en: Avazkhon has been involved in growing tree seedlings for over 8 years.  He also owns this business and has a good reputation.  He currently has 5000 apricot seedlings.  Besides this, Avazkhon is involved in animal husbandry and has two heads of sheep.  Together with his family, he processes apricots in the autumn and sells them in the spring.  Avazkhon wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of fuel and lubricant materials.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and lubricant materials

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 54 years old and has 3 children, aged between 26 and 31. She sells vegetables at a market where she has been for fifteen years.
 
Christine would like a loan to buy more vegetables to sell at the market. Any profits from the business will be used to buy a home for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is applying for another loan to expand her current business. She will use this 100,000 Kes loan to purchase more stocks of clothes for resale. In the future, Lucy aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Lucy has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe BALIMAYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogamiques à Ouayerma I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
KADIA fait le commerce de la banane Plantain, il y’a environ  1 an et souhaite devenir grossiste. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  quelques dizaine de régimes. Elle s’approvisionne dans au grand marché de Médine à Sikasso chez les grossistes. Elle les revend en détail de façon ambulante et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The four members of the Balimaya group are married women who are on average 31 years old with three children. They live in monogamous families in Ouayerma I, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

They are on their first loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, seeking to meet the needs of their customers.

Kadia has been trading plantain bananas for about a year and wants to become a wholesaler. She intends to use the loan to buy a few dozen bunches. She resupplies from wholesalers at the Medina main market in Sikasso. She retails them as an itinerant vendor and from her home to both women and men customers, against cash.

She expects average monthly profits to attain 17,500 FCFA, part of which will serve to pay the loan and interest and the remainder will be put into savings. She aims to increase her turnover so she can better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: To buy plantain bananas

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 31 years old, married to Esther. They have three children.

He operates a general retail stall for the last 6 years from which he earns a monthly income of Kes 8,500. He is applying for his second loan of Kes 30,000. He paid the previous loan on time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the funds to buy chicken, potatoes, sugar, and wheat flour. He dreams to buy a plot and build residential houses and a hotel in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, chicken, wheat flour, and cooking fat for sale.

loans.name: Mame

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme qui exerce dans le commerce de poissons frais, de poisson fumé et séché depuis plus de 10 ans.Elle est mariée et mère d'une fille.Après trois années seulement, elle était parvenu à gagner un marché d'approvisionnement en poisson d'une usine implantée dans la capitale.Malheureusement, celle ci tombe en faillite et elle se tourne vers la vente de poissons séché et fumé à travers les marchés hebdommadaires de l'intérieur du pays.Elle soutient par ses revenus son mari dans les dépenses d'entretien de la famille et parvient aussi à subvenir à certains de ses besoins propres. Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 15000f afin d'acheter du poisson fumé et séché. Son ambition est de construire sa propre maison.
texts.en: She has been in the business of selling fresh, smoked and dried fish for the past 10 years. She is married and has one daughter. After three years, she started supplying fish for a factory in the capital. Unfortunately, the factory went out of business and she decided to sell smoked and dried fish at the weekly markets throughout the country. With her profits, she helps her husband with the family's expenses and can even take care of some of her own needs. To strengthen her business, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 cfa francs to purchase smoked and dried fish. Her goal is to build her own home.

loans.use: to purchase smoked and dried fish.

loans.name: Fifagbe Pouce Group

texts.fr: FIFAGBE POUCE est un groupement de seize personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupement, Henriette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 58 ans et est mariée à un certain Albin. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un est à leur charge. Henriette a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Henriette vit ensemble avec sa famille. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis une quinzaine d'année, Henriette vend des produits vivriers à son domicile. Henriette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la septième fois que Henriette et les autres membres du groupement FIFAGBE POUCE sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Fifagbe Pouce is a group of 16 people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, who is called Henriette (and whose hand is raised in the photo), is 58 years old and married to a man called Albin. The couple has two children, who are both educated, and one remains in their care. Henriette left school at secondary level. She lives with her family, and she and her husband cover the various household expenses between them. For around 15 years Henriette has been selling fresh food products from her home. She gets her supplies from a Benin market. This is the seventh time that Henriette and the other members of the Fifagbe Pouce group have requested financial support from Alidé, so that they can boost their working capital and better respond to customer demand. The previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: to buy fresh food products.

loans.name: Tania Noemi

texts.es: TANIA NOEMI: Es una joven emprendedora de 28 años de edad, con deseos de superación, originaria de la Ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas, casada con 2 hijos en edad escolar. Con mucho esfuerzo estableció una pequeña pulpería, con el objetivo de generar sus propios ingresos, contribuir con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar: para granos básicos, chiverías, huevo, pan, salsa de toma, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con terminar su carrera universitaria y tener su propia vivienda, ya que actualmente habita en casa de familiares.
