loans.use: To improve his house and to cover some personal expenses.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a forty-one-year-old married man who has three children living in the house that he owns in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family dream is to become a large-scale banana grower. He has been a driver and agriculturalist for the past five years. He also has a banana plantation that he started on family land but later purchased. Fluctuating prices are his major challenge, but he still hopes to be better in the future. Patrick needs a loan to buy chemicals to spray on his Irish potatoes to protect them from pests.

loans.use: To buy chemicals to protect his Irish potatoes against pests.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina tiene 53 años, comparte su vida al lado de su  esposo y de sus 2 hijos de los 5 que tienen, juntos habitan en su casa que es propia. Desde que era niño, se ha dedicado a la actividad agrícola, siendo sus padres, quienes le enseñaron las técnicas del cultivo, hasta hoy se mantiene como una fuente de ingresos importante para su familia. Actualmente trabaja administrando los ingresos, además que también se dedica a la venta de animales, así como la venta de leche que extrae de las vacas que posee. Los productos que cultiva principalmente son: el maíz y la papa, y cuando tiene que sembrar o cosechar, contrata peones para estos trabajos forzados; una vez recolectada la producción son llevados a comercializar a la ciudad de Lima. Paralelamente a estas actividades, trabaja de manera dependiente, como personal administrativo en un centro educativo muy cerca de su casa solo por medio día y esto le da tiempo para atender sus actividades agrícolas. En adelante  desea mejorar la producción de sus cosechas. Es el crédito número 17 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Martina, age 53, lives in her own house with her husband and two of their five children.  Ever since she was a girl she has worked in agriculture.  Her parents taught her how to farm.  Even now farming is an important source of income for her family.

She currently works managing the income.  She also sells animals, and she sells milk that her cows produce.  She mainly grows corn and potatoes.  When she needs to plant or harvest, she hires workers for these jobs.  Once the production is collected, it is taken to sell in the city of Lima.

She also works as an administrator in an educational center that is very close to her house.  She only works half days, and this gives her time to take care of her crops.  Later, she wishes to improve the production of her harvests.

This is her 17th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  Also, she is pleased to be part of her communal bank because she knows all of the members, and they are responsible and very supportive.  She is grateful to the people who will be the lenders of the loan that she is requesting.  The loan will be very useful to the progress of her business.  She will use the requested loan to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Genesis 1 , 2 Group

texts.en:
Clara is the coordinator of her group, 'Genesis' 1 & 2. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and four children. She enjoys reading; in her free time, this is her hobby. She says that her most difficult challenge is to educate her children.

Clara is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 8 month. She was starting to use her savings to run her 'Comedor' (small restaurant in the neighborhood, especially for lunch). After starting, she heard about Esperanza´s loans and decided to be part of the program. She plans to use this new loan to invest in her business by buying a bag of rice, 10 plastic chairs, and 3 tables. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and she is dreaming of having her own restaurant in the town. 

Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: to buy a bag of rice, 10 plastic chairs and 3 tables

loans.name: 26 Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Sam L. T. (39) is a 67-year-old femaL. living in the town of Thieu D. Thieu Hoa Thanh Hoa.  Sam is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 26 Thieu D. Thieu Hoa(09.09.26 Thieu Hoa).


Sam is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Sam operates a family member's business venture raising cattL. for saL..  Sam has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Sam joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Sam is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5,787,900 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Sam from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Sam plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  D. T. Phuong (40) is a 36-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  L. T. Hoi (41) is a 45-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Sam L. T. (39) là 67 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thieu D. Thieu Hoa Thanh Hoa.  Sam là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 26 Thieu D. Thieu Hoa (09.09.26 Thieu Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Sam thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Sam kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Sam đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Sam đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.787.900 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 12th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  D. T. Phuong (40) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  L. T. Hoi (41) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa Mannan is widow and has four children. She has received schooling through primary school. Yaa sells palm oil at Abrafo near Abura, which she has done for the past five years. Yaa uses her income to pay for the necessaries of her family as well as her children's school fees. Yaa will use the loan to purchase larger quantities of palm fruit needed to prepare the oil she sells. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa plans to further expand her business in order to be able to take care of her children, especially of their education.

loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of palm fruit to prepare oil for resale.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a married woman who lives in E.B. Magalona, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: fishing and a ready-to-wear business. Her husband Ramie B., who is 30 years old, works as a fisherman to earn income. They have 4 children between 11 to 15 years old, who are currently going to school. 

Jennifer joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jennifer has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 5th loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000, which she intends to use to purchase fishing nets so that she can continue to save up for future family needs and for her children's education. Jennifer is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and supplies

loans.name: Livia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC AYLLU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Livia; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa y productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y entre otros, ella envía a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado en forma independiente, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de ropa y productos de primera necesidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa y productos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Ms. Livia is a member of the community bank SUMACAYLLU. The bank is located in the district of Cusco in the province and department of Cusco. She is 35 years old and lives with her partner and 2 children. She alternates her daily activities in a business selling clothes and also staples such as rice, sugar, milk and others. She works as an independent sending her products from Puerto Maldonado to the city. She wants to grow and improve her business. She is asking for a loan to buy clothing and wholesale products. She is happy to have the loan and promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: To buy clothes and wholesale products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy slippers in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya is married to H. M. who works in the fields and grows different seasonal crops. He is a very hardworking person and works full-time to get good crops from his land. He then harvests the crops and sells to different shops and people to earn profits for his family. Surriya doesn’t have any child. She spends most of her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. In her spare time, she also helps her husband with his work. 

Surriya lives in Khanewal, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan, famous for its agriculture. She's been living in a two-room brick house with her family in the Shanti Nagar area for the past many years. 

Surriya has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to improve her husband’s business. With this loan, he will buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for his field to get good crops. Surriya has a lot of confidence that her husband will be able to earn good profits after the loan investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In her previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and attended every meeting. In the photo, the lady holding a book (an Asasah passbook) is Surriya.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for an agriculture business.

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité SOP MAME DIARRA est créé le 28 juin 2007. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Elles se sont regroupe par affinité et voisinage. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce. Le groupe fait partie du banc Villageois de MEDINA FALL1.

Madame Seynabou D. (debout à gauche de la photo et levant la main) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfant. Des proches lui ont aussi confié la charge de leur enfants. 

Elle développe une activité de petit commerce. Elle vend de la friperie. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de de renforcer son activité en achetant une quantité plus importante en friperie afin d'accroitre ses bénéfices. 

Son objectif est de renforcer ses épargnes, de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille et de payer la scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOP MAME DIARRA was created on June 28, 2007. It is composed of 15 women from the same district. They have formed a group based on affinity and neighborhoods. Their principal work is in small-scale commerce. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of MEDINA FALL1.

Ms. Seynabou D. (standing at the left in the photo with her hand raised) is the group’s leader. She is 47 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Also, people near and dear to her have entrusted her with their children.  

Seynabou is developing a small-scale business. She sells used clothing. She has good experience in this business domain having worked at it since joining the Banc Villageois. Her new loan will enable her to bolster her business by buying a more significant quantity of second-hand clothing in order to grow her profits.

Her goal is to boost her savings, to support her husband in supporting the family, and to cover the costs of her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing for resale

loans.name: Teddy

texts.es:
Teddy, es casada, tiene 24 años, una hija de 3 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Obreras.
Solicita un crédito de S/. 1500.00.
Tiene una vidriería.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de vidrios, aluminios y accesorios para vidriería. 
Teddy y su esposo tienen una vidriería en la avenida Arenales. Ellos recién llevan unos meses de casados y estan sacando adelante su negocio. Su esposo aprendió de esta actividad de sus padres, pues ellos también tienen una vidriería. Teddy ingreso a FINCA Perú, por la invitación de su suegra, con éste es el segundo ciclo que está. Le gusta FINCA Perú, por la accesibilidad a los créditos y puede ahorrar.
Su meta es ahorrar para comprarse un terreno, construir su casa y que su hija tenga una buena educación.
texts.en:
Teddy is 24 years old, married, and has a 3 year-old daughter.  She belongs to the 'Obreras' community bank and is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles.  Teddy will invest her loan in buying glass, aluminum and accessories for the glassworks that she and her husband own which is located on Arenales Avenue.  The couple have been married for just a few months and they are getting ahead in their business.

Teddy's husband learned this trade from his parents as they also owned a glassworks.  Teddy joined FINCA Peru through an invite from her mother-in-law.  This is her second loan cycle.  Teddy likes FINCA Peru because their loans are accessible and it is possible to save.  Her goals are to save up to buy a plot of land, to build a house and for her daughter to have a good education.

loans.use: to buy glass, aluminum and accessories for a glassworks

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is from the village of Pines, Oroquieta City.  She is 67 years old, and married. To make a living, Lolita has a business running a retail store in the local community. 

Lolita has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities. Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. 

Lolita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP with which she will purchase a variety of products, such as canned goods, shampoo, toothpaste, etc., for her retail store . This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Lolita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products, such as canned goods, shampoo, toothpaste, etc., for her retail store

loans.name: Hermane

texts.en:
Hermane P. is from the village of Bolisong, Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old and married withfour adult-aged children. Hermane  runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Hermane has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Hermane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Hermane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. Hermane is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase snack foods and canned goods to sell. This will be her fifth loan from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional snack foods and canned goods

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 42 years old and married with four children. Two of her children attend school. For the past five years, Juanita has been selling flowers in the Philippines and she has received four previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business. Juanita is currently requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

In the future, Juanita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Mungu Tubariki Group

texts.en:
Christina is in her late twenties and married with two children. The eldest child attends school, while the other is still too young to do so.

For the past three years Christina has sold second-hand clothing, sarongs and fabric. She works from 10:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. each day and is able to earn a small monthly profit.

This will be Christina's first “motisha” loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.

Christina will share this loan with her loan group. The group is called “Mungu Tubariki” and has eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

Christina hopes to buy and sell more second-hand clothing, sarongs and fabric. With her profits she will pay for her children's school fees, and one day, she hopes to build her own home.

loans.use: to buy and sell more second-hand clothing, sarongs and fabric.

loans.name: Sigyongyaakadi Group

texts.fr:
Mme Safiatou est la représentante du groupe SIGYONGYAAKADI. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans et le moins âgé a 4ans.2 vont a l’école et elle a 3 personnes en chage.

Elle vend des pagnes depuis 4 ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 12 complets de pagnes.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut améliorer ses conditions de vie. Elle ambitionne aider son mari à construire leur maison et voyager pour amener les pagnes et vendre en gros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Safiatou is the representative of the Sigyongyaakadi group. She is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 12 years of age, and the youngest is 4. Two of them go to school. She has three dependents.

She sells traditional  colorful “pagnes” fabrics for about four years. She stocks up at the Sector 10 market. Her customers are all women. She would like to buy 12 sets of “pagnes.” Thanks to her income, she would like to improve her quality of life. Her goal is to help her husband build a house for the family and to travel to buy pagnes for reselling wholesale.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabrics

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline has been practicing mixed farming in her hometown of Eldoret, North Rift Kenya. She is married with 5 children between the ages of 5 and 16 years old, all of whom are in school. Her farm produces maize, beans, vegetables and milk with the help of one other farmer. Her farm's produce is all sold to the local market. She also does tailoring to supplement her farming income.

Pauline has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Kiva's partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the dairy business will help her pay for her children's education. She intends to expand her tailoring business and improve the quality of her dairy cows. 

Pauline concurs with other farmers that the drought is their biggest challenge.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jesus El Salvador Group

texts.es:
“Jesús el Salvador” es una Alcancía Comunal Nueva que está conformada por 07 personas entusiasta y comprometidas a trabajar bien con el Programa.
Zoraida tiene 37 años de edad y su familia está conformada por ella su esposo y  2 hijos, la cual sigue apoyando junto a su conyugue en sus estudios. Zoraida nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza hace más de tres años, pero también vende ropa la cual trabaja con pedidos que le hacen sus familiares y conocidos de su zona. Es así como Zoraida a podido ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y mejorar su vivienda. A futuro a Zoraida le gustaría poner una bodega en su vivienda donde pueda ofrecer productos de primera necesidad y así tener más ganancias y brindarle una mejor vida a su familia. Con el préstamo solicitado lo piensa invertir en la compra de ropa como pantalón, chompa, chalinas, polos. La Alcancía Comunal “Jesús el Salvador” agradece la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
“Jesús el Salvador” (Jesus the Saviour) is a new communal bank consisting of 7 enthusiastic people who are committed to wrking with the Programme. 

Zoraida is 37 years old. Her family consists of herself, her husband and their two children, whom she and her husband continue to support through their education. Zoraida recounts how she has dedicated herself to the sale of beauty products for the past 3 years, but she also sells clothing, for which she takes orders from her friends and acquaintances in the area. In this way Zoraida has been able to help her husband with the household exprenses and improvements to their home. In future, Zoraida would like to open up a store in their home, where she could sell basic groceries and thus have more income and offer her family a better life. With the loan she is seeking, she will invest in the purchase of clothing, such as trousers, sweaters, scarves and polo shirts.  

The members of the “Jesús el Salvador” communal bank are grateful for the support offered.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru: Тохир проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. Живет вместе с родителями. Он имеет среднее образование. Уже пять лет как он занимается торговлей. Он арендует торговую точку на рынке "Саховат", где продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для покупки масла, окорочков и закупа еще одного холодильника.
texts.en: Tohir lives in Kulob. He is 26 years old. He is married. He lives with his parents. He has a high school education. He has been working in trade for five years. He rents a grocery shop in the Sahovat market. He is taking out a loan to buy oil, chicken legs, and another refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy oil, chicken legs, and another refrigerator.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Mary Jane has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her shop.

Mary Jane is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Pape Lamine

texts.fr: Monsieur Pape Lamine vit au Sénégal depuis plusieurs années. C’est un jeune marié de 33ans qui s’active dans le secteur de l’enseignement coranique  dans sa zone d’habitation. Parallèlement  aussi  il pratique des activités agricoles. Il a choisi ces activités par amour mais  dans le but de se procurer des revenus stables. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus dans ses activités c’est l’éducation qu’il inculque aux enfants pour les aider a mieux affronter la vie. Il est membre d’un des guichets  de l’U-IMCEC  depuis avril 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs prévu pour la réfection de sa maison  qu’il  veut sécuriser. Ce financement  lui permettra de réaliser un grand projet qu’il a longtemps rêvé.
texts.en:
Pape Lamine has lived in Senegal for several years. He is 33 years old and married, and works as a teacher of the Koran in his neighborhood. At the same time, he does some farming. He chose these activities because he likes them but also with the goal of having a steady income. What he enjoys most about his work is the education that he passes on to the children, to help them meet life's challenges. 

He has been a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches since April 2011. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 CFA francs for improvements to his house, which he wants to make more secure. This loan will allow him to carry out this important project that he has been dreaming of for a long time.

loans.use: to carry out home improvement.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drugs for resale.

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe BENKELEMA sont majoritairement des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 36  ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et  vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à LOULOUNI (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieures se sont bien dénoués.
BARKE, fait le commerce de condiments alimentaires dans ce groupe femmes BENKELEMA, elle est la première à droite avec un pagne blanc au cou. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  50kg de sel gemme, 2 cartons de cube Maggi, 1 bidon de 20 litres d’huile alimentaires et 3 paquets d’oignon séchées. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et à Sikasso ville et effectue sa vente en détail, dans sa famille au quartier BOBOKIN et les jours de foire, au marché de la ville de LOULOUNI, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes, au comptant souvent à crédit . 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.250FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The six members of the group BENKELEMA are married women for the most part who average 36 years of age and three children each. They live mostly in polygamous families in Loulouni (third administrative region of Mali).

They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for the tenth time to meet the needs of their customers. Previous loans were repaid without problems.

BARKE sells food condiments. A member of BENKELEMA, she is first from the right in the photo, wrapped in a white shawl.

She will use her loan to buy 50 kg of salt, two boxes of Maggi broth cubes, one 20-liter can of cooking oil, and three packages of dried onion. She gets her merchandise in Bamako and Sikasso. She conducts her sales at retail, among family members in the district of BOBOKIN, and also on fair days at the Loulouni market, to a clientele composed mainly of women, and mostly for cash but occasionally on credit.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 37,250FCFA, part of which will be used to pay the loan and interest, and the rest added to her savings.

loans.use: to buy food condiments for resale

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 38 years old and married with one child.  She has a shop where she sells toys, souvenirs, and hair accessories.  She has had this business for one year.

Bernardita plans to use this loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos to buy more toys and hair accessories for her shop.  She has been a member of Kiva field partner HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Bernardita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy toys and hair accessories for a retail shop

loans.name: Gladiz

texts.es: La señora Gladiz es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de edredones a profesoras; además es jubilada. Con esta actividad de venta de edredones cubre sus gastos. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de edredones para variar y satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona Norte en la Ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene dos hijos. Esta será la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva y la quinta vez que solicita un crédito de Impro.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladiz is a merchant who sells quilts to teachers. She is also retired. Through her business of selling quilts, Gladiz is able to cover her expenses. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy various quilts so that she can cater to the preferences of her customers. Gladiz lives in her own home in the northern part of the city of La Paz. She is married and has two children.

This is the second time she has requested a loan through Kiva, but this is her fifth loan with IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy quilts of various colors and sizes.

loans.name: Marizela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LAS MERCEDES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marizela; ella tiene 24 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales, ella cría chanchos, pollos y cuyes y también tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maíz, papa y hortalizas y luego los vende en el mercado de Urubamba, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales y también quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de terreno de. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales como gallinas, cuyes y chanchos y también para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Marizela is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Las Mercedes” which is located in the District of Huayllabamba, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 24 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has one child. Marizela divides her time between her daily activities and her business of raising animals such as pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs. She also has a plot of land on which she grows corn, potatoes, and vegetables that she eventually sells at the market in Urubamba. Marizela works from 7am to 6pm. Through this business, she is able to help her child move forward. She wants to expand her business of raising animals and also improve her land, so she is requesting a loan to buy animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs, as well as seeds and fertilizers.

Marizela is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Luzonia

texts.en:
Luzonia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Luzonia has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Luzonia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Luzonia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Tu's Group

texts.en:
Tu was born in 1960. She lives in Kinh No, Uy No, Dong Anh, Ha Noi. She has one child. Her husband is retired. Mrs. Tu has a shop in the market. She sells clothes. She has this job for six years. She has a monthly income of about 4.000.000 Vietnamdong(VND). She needs a loan T. expand her business. She has participated in SEDA since 2010. This is the second time she borrowed a loan from SEDA. The last time she borrowed 5.014.000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle she would like T. borrow 6.758.000 VND T. invest in her shop and T. buy more new clothes. She is the leader of 5 member group loan.

About the other borrowers in her group:
 Tuoi is 30 years old. She has two children. She wants T. borrow 6.758.000 VND T. buy grocery for her store.
 Phuong is 30 years old. She has one child. She wants T. borrow 6.758.000 VND T. breed pigs.
 Ly is 39 years old. She has three children. She wants T. borrow 6.758.000 VND T. buy more new clothes for her shop.
 Thuy is 29 years old. She has one child. She wants T. borrow 6.758.000 VND T. buy more new clothes for her shop.

loans.use: to invest in her shop and to buy more new clothes

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael is a 32-year old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a charcoal stall that he started ten years back with capital worth two hundred thousand shillings and now it is worth five hundred and fifty thousand shillings.  He faces the challenges of price fluctuations, inflation, seasonal weather and inadequate capital to boost his business. However, Raphael's dream is to educate his children, build a permanent home and expand his business into new markets. He thus needs the loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe SOUTOURA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43  ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Ouayerma I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
FILY, au gauche de la photo, fait le commerce de  banane Plantain dans ce groupe de femmes SOUTOURA. Il y'a environ 10 ans qu’elle mène cette activité et jouis d’une grande notoriété à la matière.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt:  une quarantaine de régimes de bananes plantains.Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Médine à Sikasso, le jour de foire et effectue ses ventes au  grand marché de Sikasso ville au niveau du rond point central et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant et en détail. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 42.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The four members of the Soutoura group are married women averaging 43 years of age with three children. They live mainly in monogamous families in Ouayerma I, a working class district of the town of Sikasso. They are on their 10th loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of meeting customer demand.

Fily, on the left in the photo, is a member of the Soutoura women’s group who sells  plantains. She has been doing this work for about 10 years and is well known for this. She plans to use her loan to purchase about 40 bunches of plantains. She stocks up at the big market of Médine in Sikasso on market days and retails at the big market of Sikasso near the central roundabout, as well as out of her home to a customer base composed of both men and women, for cash.

She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 43,500 West African francs, a part of which will be used to repay her loan with interest and the rest put away as savings. Her goal is to increase her sales volume and better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy plantains

loans.name: Khouloud

texts.en:
Khouloud is a 22-year-old married Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and two children. Khouloud and her husband find it really hard to cover their expenses because of life costs even though they’re both working. Khouloud's husband has been working as a freelance constructor since 2005. As for her, she has her own home business where she sells artisan clothes and scarves. 

Khouloud is requesting a 1,100 USD loan from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase her inventory of clothes and related accessories. This will allow her increase her sales after making special offers on her products. In the future, she plans to open her own shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes and accessories

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a junk shop business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years now, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and raising livestock.

Lucena requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more recycled materials to sell.

Lucena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 19-year-old young man. He is the youngest of his four brothers and one sister. He recently finished high school and successfully applied to one of the Jordanian universities. He is now in his freshman year majoring in accounting.
Ashraf is hoping that when he graduates and gets his bachelors degree he will be able to continue studying to get higher certifications and a masters degree in accounting. He has applied for a loan to pay his semester's fees.

loans.use: pay his semester's fees.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба милая и добрая женщина и умела мастерица из района Сарбанд. Ко всем ее положительным качествам она мать четверых детей. Насиба занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она мастер своего дела. Насиба выкладывает душу к каждой выполненную ей одежды. Она работает в маленьком помещении, где помещается 2 швейных машинок, стол, стул и одна большая железная палка, на которой она вешает законченные работы. Насиба в таких условиях работает уже 7 лет. Она просит ей помочь отремонтировать ее маленькую мастерскую, чтобы создать себе условия работы.
texts.en: Nasiba is a gentle and kind woman, as well as a skilled craftswoman from the Sarband district of Tajikistan.  In addition to all her positive attributes, she is the mother of four children.  Nasiba is an experienced seamstress, and she puts her whole soul into the making of each and every dress that she sews.  She works in a small space where she has two sewing machines, one table, one chair and one big iron rod on which she hangs her finished works.  She has been working in this environment for the past seven years.  She is requesting support to renovate her home, including her workshop, so that she can improve her working conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her workshop and improve her work environment.

loans.name: Maria  Santos

texts.es: MARÍA  SANTOS: Es una señora jovial de 51 años de edad, trabaja como  docente de educación primaria, desde hace más de 25 años. Está casada con 3 hijos en edad escolar. Desde hace 20 años habitan en una vivienda de tambo y madera, sin embargo se encuentra en mal estado. Solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: madera, clavos, zinc y cubrir los costos de mano de obra, debido a que con su salario con su salario no le ajusta para realizar la mejora. Su sueño es tener una vivienda de concreto (cemento), ya que es de mayor durabilidad.

loans.use: para comprar materiales de construcción: madera, clavos, zinc y cubrir los costos de mano de obra

loans.name: Joaquín

texts.en:
Joaquin has a store where he sells snacks and other foods. He was a butcher for a very long time and had a stand at a local market but he had to move the business to his home when the market was shut down. Joaquin suffered a very unfortunate accident where he lost a leg and since then has not been able to continue working as a butcher. Despite this situation he has persisted and has opened a small store with the support of his family. He has three children, two of which are already independent. They have been great for their father and helped him set up two rooms in his home that he rents out for a complimentary source of income.

Joaquin is seeking the loan in order to continue to invest in his business. He will buy products in bulk and also make improvements to the store. This business keeps him motivated and with a high self esteem. His wife is a seamstress who also helps him at the store.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy products in bulk and make improvements to the store

loans.name: Saeu

texts.en:
Saeu is a hard-working mother living in Faleula who is seeking to expand her fishing business in order to improve the lot of her family.  Although she has not been in the fishing business very long, living near the ocean for her entire life has given her the knowledge necessary to conduct such a business.

She has succeeded because as soon as she brings her fresh-caught fish to shore, she takes them to a stand at the end of the road or to the local fish market, where she sells them to local restaurants.

She is now applying for a loan of $850 from SPBDF to allow her to purchase additional nets so that she can increase her sales.

loans.use: To acquire more fishing nets

loans.name: Allama

texts.en: Allama lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is uneducated and she makes artificial flowers. She  works in her house. She is a very talented girl and she has a lots of clients who come to her house. She needed money so she took her 4th cycle group loan and bought new flower designs to make a beautiful shop in one of the good places in Kabul. Now she wants to take anther loan to expand her business to make a  good income for her family and to support them better than now.

loans.use: To buy extra materials

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang's husband was in a serious accident on a motor bike and now his mental state isn’t good. He often complains to his wife and children. Hang works as a day laborer; she owed money to pay her husband’s hospital bills. They have no land. Their oldest daughter quit school, the second is in the 6th class, and the youngest is still too young to be in school.

Hang wants to borrow $ 50 for her fried banana sales business to get more profit to support her family. She will pay back $ 10 per month over a 5 month period.

loans.use: invest in her fried banana business

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: An industrious woman who sell plastic products, Mrs. Bridget A. is 38 years old, married, and the mother of one child. She is from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting the above loan of $800 to buy more plastic products for her business. She has 6 years of experience in business and has been a LAPO member for 2 years.

loans.use: To buy more plastic products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in different types of meats

loans.name: Estrela Drive-In Group

texts.pt:
The group entered the program in 2005 with an initial loan of 1800 MT. They are now in their 8th cycle. They have been performing quite well and running their businesses successfully. The group leader is Amelia Alberto T.. Amelia is 36 years of age and unmarried but lives with a partner and her 3 children in the Zimpeto neighborhood. She sells construction materials, furnaces, etc. The group is now taking a loan of 5,600 MT to invest in the business, to be repaid in 4 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

O grupo entrou no programa em 2005 começou a tomar o valor de 1800 e agroa encontra se no 8º ciclo tem se comportado muito bem esta desenvolver bem os seus negócios, a lider do grupo é Amelia Alberto T. Tem 36 anos de idade não é casada mais vive maritalmente tem 3 filhos vive no bairro do Zimpeto, vende Material de contrução , fugões etc, o grupo vai tomar o valor de 5.600,00mt para pagar em 4 meses para investir no negócio .

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Rokayah

texts.en: Rokayah is a 47-year-old woman whose husband H. has been unemployed for quite a long time. To support her family, Rokayah sells plastics such as bottles, glasses, etc., earning US$3.7 per day. She is requesting a loan of US$175 to expand her business, so that she could earn more income and pay for her children's education. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of business

loans.name: Mambo Kwisha Group

texts.en:
Clients are appreciating our services because of the funding you provide. I am writing this to deliver a message from Betty N., the Chairperson of Mambo Kwisha Group, Ndeeba, who had failed before at joining the group, but now nothing can stop her from prosperity. She has been running a restaurant business for 2 years preparing all sorts of dishes: matooke (local term for unripened bananas), rice, posho, Irish potatoes, and sweet potatoes. She is a widow of 48 years with 5 children and cares for 3 relatives. Her dream is to finish the construction of her business premises just next to her home to reduce transport and renting costs. She has also managed to pay school fees for her children and now 2 have enrolled as teachers and have secured jobs, while the rest are still in high school.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Betty Namyalo’s dream is to finish the construction of her business premises just next to her home to reduce transport and renting costs.

loans.name: Nsumbi A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Shamim B.. She is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to buy more chicks. Shamim is 36 years old and is divorced. She has 2 children ranging from age 4 to 6 and her children go to school. Each week, Shamim makes approximately UGX 90000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children Shamim has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy chicken mash (feed) and chicken drinkers and the loan was paid back on time.

Shamim is joined in her small group by Joseline K., Robinah N., Annet N., and Harriet N.. Joseline K. has a nursery school business and wants to buy stationery. Robinah N. is currently operating a restaurant business and wants a loan to purchase more utensils. Annet N. operates a shoe sales business and wants to increase the volume of shoes. Harriet N. is currently in the business of selling cold drinks and is requesting a loan to purchase another fridge.

loans.use: To add working capital to poultry business

loans.name: Michail

texts.en:
Michail owns a small clothing sales business in the town of Morshin, in western Ukraine. He has space at a market area near the center of town where he sells a variety of men’s and women’s clothing. Michail has been in business for about eight years. He has benefited from having a great location with no other serious competitors close by. Michail is married and has one daughter for whom he is helping pay college expenses.

Michail has requested a loan to purchase a supply of sportswear to sell in his business. Michail has built an excellent reputation with Nadiya Ukraine and we are happy to be able to continue assisting him with his business.

loans.use: Purchase sportswear inventory

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Alvina is married to Justino Ortega. While Alvina attends the grocery store, Justino works in a primary school.

Both have a despensa (grocery store) in a strategic place located in Luque. They are well-known in their neighborhood and that is why people prefer their despensa rather than the competition. The products they offer include: meat, rice, sugar and others.

Despensas are a very profitable market in Paraguay since it is considered a tradition to buy thing from a despensa (grocery store).

The credit provided will be used for the purchase of products in order to expand their variety of offerings.

loans.use: Purchase of drinks, sugar, rice, meat, oil, pasta,  milk, cheese

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
Monica is determined to keeping pushing herself continuously in order to benefit her small daughter. For this reason, a little after having joined with a family member in business she decided to take-on her occupation independently. She is already very content because in a short time she has obtained a great deal of satisfaction and has decided to improve her sales space.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Mónica, está decidida a esforzarse continuamente en beneficio de su pequeña. Por esa razón poco después de haberse asociado con un familiar decidió emprender su ocupación de manera independiente. Y está muy contenta porque en poco tiempo ha obtenido muchas satisfacciones y ha decidido mejorar su espacio de ventas.

loans.use: Renovation of her sales space.

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Mrs. Him V. lives in Trapaing Chrov Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a rice farmer. Her husband, Mr. Kosal Im, helps her and, in addition, collects palm juice and processes it into palm sugar.

Because of their poor living conditions, Mrs. Him V. has insufficient money to buy a cow to add to the old one to use as draft animals. Thus, Mrs. Him V. asks for a loan for this purpose.

Mrs. Him V. is 25 and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Last year, Mrs. Him V.’s grandmother got ill and she had unforeseen expenses to treat her. Presently, her grandmother needs to be treated again. Because of these obstacles, Mrs. Him V. cannot afford her cow to start her new business. Mrs. Him V. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow to add to the old one to use as draft animals.

loans.name: Flora Marina

texts.es:
Flora is a born fighter who, with her husband, decided to generate income for themselves independently by making use of their inherent skills. It all started ten years ago, when they saw the financial potential in raising livestock since they possessed extensive land on which to grow alfalfa (an excellent feed for cattle). This is how they embarked on this activity, which today bears the fruits of their labor. They also sell the milk produced by their cows to a processing plant. Additionally, they are always aware of the veterinary care they must provide for their livestock. This loan would help them to buy fertilizers for the grasslands that they maintain for their animals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Flora es una mujer luchadora que junto a su esposo han decidido generarse ingresos económicos de manera independiente explotando las potencialidades que poseen, todo comenzó hace 10 años cuando vieron la posibilidad de criar ganado vacuno, ya que poseían terrenos extensos donde podían cultivar forraje, es así que incursionaron en esta actividad que hoy da los frutos de esa perseverancia, también venden la leche de sus vacas a una planta procesadora.De la misma manera, están pendientes de los cuidados veterinarios que deben de ofrecer a sus animales.El préstamo que solicitan es para comprar abono para los terrenos de pastos para sus animales.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for the land where they cultivate grasses for their livestock.

loans.name: Livia

texts.es:
Livia is a single, 54 year woman who lives with her parents and supports them economically. She is a natural of the city of Junin. She started her own business 18 years ago in her parent’s home. She runs a grocery store which is her main source of income. Usually she works on her business every day of the week, and she runs her business with love and dedication. Livia wants to give her parents a good life, since she is the one that is providing for them. She would like to buy more products so that she can grow her store and increase her sales and in the future make her business a more stable source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Livia tiene 54 años, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres a los cuales apoya económicamente. Es natural de la ciudad de Junín, hace 18 años, puso en la casa de sus padres una pequeña tienda de comestibles, que el día de hoy es su principal fuente de ingresos.Usualmente, atiende en su negocio todo el día, durante toda la semana, siendo la única actividad que realiza, ya está acostumbrada a este tipo de trabajo, el cual hace con amor y dedicación. Livia quiere brindarles a sus padres una vida digna, ya que ella aún los ayuda económicamente. Piensa comprar muchos productos, para hacer crecer su tienda y así incrementar sus ventas, en el futuro sea una fuente de más ingresos muy estable.

loans.use: To buy more products for her store.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca de 23 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, quienes son su motivo de seguir luchando por salir adelante, junto a su esposo Juan, trabajan duro por sus hijos, esperando que algún día sean profesionales.Blanca  se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, este negocio es el que vela por el sustento económico  de ella y para los estudios de sus hijos.El propósito de Blanca es ampliar, comprar productos comestibles y sobre todo mejorar la estructura de su vivienda, por lo que necesariamente estima de un capital que la llevará a cumplir con su objetivo.
texts.en:
Blanca is 23 years old; she has two children who are the reason she keeps fighting to get ahead. Together with her husband, Juan, they work hard for their children. They hope one day they will be professionals. Blanca makes a living selling groceries and everyday use items. This business is what pays for her expenses and that of her children's education. Blanca's objective is to expand and buy food items, and more importantly improve their home. This is why she needs money- to achieve her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the stock in her store and improve the structure of her home where her business is based out of.

loans.name: Diana Estefanía

texts.es:
El negocio al que se dedica la señora Diana E. es a la venta de pollo en el mercado central de Chinandega. Esta dama se ha destacado por ser una persona muy esforzada el cual ha invertido recursos para mantener su tramo en el mercado y así mantener a su familia compuesta por su pequeño hijo.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo, el negocio de la señora Diana requiere inversión para la comprar de pollos y por este motivo espera que su crédito en Ceprodel sea aprobado para continuar con su negocio. Una vez que obtenga el crédito se beneficia tanto ella como su humilde familia.
texts.en:
Mrs Diana E. sells chicken in the central market of Chinandega. Diana is a very hardworking women who has invested resources in order to keep her stand in the market. Her business allows her to earn money to rise her son. Like all developing businesses, Diana's needs investment. Diana needs to buy more chicken and hopes her credit will be approved so she can continue with her business. The credit will benefit her and her humble family.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken

loans.name: Carlota Tembe

texts.pt:
Carlota Tembe D. é natural de Maputo, tem 35 anos de idade, casada maritalmente como segunda esposa, onde vive somente com a sua filha o marido vem de vez em quando, mãe de uma filha de 14 anos de idade, para alem da sua filha sustenta os pais enviando lhe géneros alimentícios.

Carlota estudou até 6ªclasse e parou quando ficou grávida e dai nunca conseguiu continuar com os estudos, cresceu com os pais e devido a gravidez não planificada teve que entrar nos negócios para obter algo para o sustenta dela e sua filha, diz que numa primeira fase o marido não assumia a filha. Neste momento vive numa casa própria.

Carlota vive basicamente de negocio a mais de 10 anos e tem duas empregadas, onde vende, roupas, artigos / utensílios  domésticos e géneros alimentícios. Onde destacas as roupas de cama tais como. Djuvetes que compra na terra do rand por 110rands e vende por 1000,00mts e de 200rands vende por 1500,00mts.a cerveja que compra a caixa por 230,00mt e vende por 300,00mt,  Com isso tem um rendimento mensal de 5000,00mt.

Para Carlota este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, assim pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro afim de reabilitar a sua casa e também pretende comprar uma viatura para lhe facilitar nas compras na africa do sul.
texts.en:
Carlota Tembe D. is from Maputo, 35 years old, married as a second wife and lives only with her daughter as her husband is only home once in a while. She is the mother of a 14 year old girl and apart from supporting this daughter, she also supports her parents, sending them food.

Carlota was in school until the 6th grade and left when she became pregnant, never managing to resume her studies. She grew up with her parents and due to her unplanned pregnancy, had to start working in order to support herself and her daughter, as she says that in the beginning her husband would not acknowledge his child. She currently live in her own house.

Carlota has basically lived off her business for more than 10 years and has two employees. She sells clothes, home wares and food. She mostly sells bed linen such as duvets, which she buys in South Africa for 110 rand and sells for 1000,00 MZN or buys for 200 rand and sells for 1500,00 MZN. She also sells beer which she buys for 230,00 MZN per box and sells for 300,00 MZN. She has a monthly income of 5000,00 MZN.

This is Carlota’s first loan from Hluvuku and from Kiva and intends to pay it back early in order to request another loan to repair her house. She also intends to buy a vehicle to facilitate her purchasing from South Africa.


Translated from Portuguese by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing more stock to be sold through her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a single Mom and is the sole support of her daughter. Her daughter’s father is an alcoholic and unable to help out. Victoria has to work hard to be able to provide for her daughter and pay all her bills. She runs a small vending business selling clothing items and linen sheets in the local markets in Levanevskyi district, Belaya Tserkov. She has just moved her vending location to a new market where she has purchased a container for her merchandise.

Victoria is requesting a loan of  5000 Grivnas (about $875) to increase her stock which will improve her sales. She has been running this trade for a year and a half. Victoria's first loan helped her double her inventory and complete renovation in her apartment, a costly project for a single mother. Lending assistance has also helped Victoria hire an employee and run her venture more smoothly and effectively while enabling another person to have a job.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra T. has been applying for loans from MicroInvest since 2004 when she started her business in street small wares.  She started practically from scratch, but today, she has her own department selling food products.  She opened the department in the first floor of her own house.  She sells drinks, cakes, tea, sugar and vegetable oil.  She dreams of having her own mini-market where she can trade big-scale assortments.  

Gulchehra asks Kiva to support her existing business; she requests a loan for 3000 STJ over eight months to increase business assortment.  She hopes for her business turnover to increase.  She thanks Kiva lenders for their support and wishes all the best for the people who help low-income entrepreneurs around the world.

loans.use: Increase assortment

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is 24-years-old and single. She rents music videos to the people in her community. Blessing hopes for a loan amount of $550 (N80, 000) to purchase more music videos to add to her inventory. She says thanks to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more music videos for rent

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Candelaria tiene 66 años, vive sola desde hace más de 10 años en su casa propia. Ella es una mujer que desde los 20 años viene trabajando en multiples actividades, pero desde hace 10 años empezó a vender ropa en los diferentes mercados de su distrito, es más rentable vender en zonas alejadas, pues las personas no tienen fácil acceso para trasladarse a la ciudad para comprar, y en otros casos cuentan con muy escasos recursos economicos. Pero para ser de ayuda a sus vecinos, Candelaria trata de adquirir diversas prendas de las mismas fábricas, donde compra al por mayor y puede vender a sus clientes a precios bajos. En el futuro desea poner una tienda donde pueda vender sus prendas y otros productos para estar a tiempo completo al servicio de sus clientes, ya que son la única  compañía que tiene. Candelaria tiene 6 años trabajando con MFP, y espera seguir junto a la institución que le brindó apoyo cuando más lo necesitaba. Con el dinero que solicita comprará uniformes, ya que es época escolar y quiere aprovechar esta campaña.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 66 years old. She has lived alone for more than 10 years in her own home. She is a woman who since the age of 20 has worked in several activities, but for the past 10 years she has begun selling clothes in the different markets in her District. It is more profitable to sell in the further zones, because the people there don’t have easy access to travel to the city to shop, and in other cases they have very restricted economic resources. But in order to help her neighbors, Candelaria tries to have various items from the same factories, where she buys for a better price and sells to her clients at lower prices. In the future, she wants to have a store where she could sell her items and other products in order to be on time completing services for her clients, at the moment this is the only company that she has. Candelaria has spent 6 years working with MFP, and she hopes to continue with the institution that gives her help when she needs it most. With the money that she is asking for she would buy uniforms, as it is currently time for school and she wants to try this business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Nelson Cecilio

texts.es: El sr. Nelson es un cliente, soltero, muy responsable, es un joven muy trabajador, tiene su servicio de Internet, con máquinas que él  mismo ensambló, tiene también juegos de play station. Esta ubicado en la popular zona de Pampahasi, en la avenida principal. Con este trabajo sustenta sus estudios, que ya está por terminar, y ayuda también en los gastos de la casa. Cliente de la institución desde el año 2007, invertirá en la compra de material para el ensamblado de nuevas computadoras ya que piensa abrir un nuevo local en otra zona.
texts.en:
Mr. Nelson is a young single man who is very responsible and hardworking. He has an Internet cafe with computers that he assembled himself, and he also has PlayStation games. His business is located in the popular part of Pampahasi, on the main avenue. He uses income from his business to pay for his studies, which he has almost completed, and also to help pay for the household expenses. A loan customer since 2007, he will invest in the purchase of materials to build new computers so that he can open up a second location in another area.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to build computers

loans.name: Gufron

texts.en:
T. Gufron is a very hard working and responsible entrepreneur. He and his family live in Khujand, Tajikistan. He is married and has two children. Gufron works in the central city market selling kid’s clothing, table-cloth, coverlet and towels. His business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. He has been working in the market for 2 years. Once a month he travels to the neighboring city Istaravshan to purchase new goods. When he is absent, his wife (pictured) helps him with the business.

Gufron likes to work for himself. His business has been the main source of income for his whole family. Today Gufron would like to ask for a loan of $1000 USD to purchase new inventory. We believe Gufron‘s drive for success will help this young entrepreneur succeed and thrive in business. You can be an important part of the growth of Gufron’s business.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.


IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to sell.

loans.name: Emelina

texts.es: La Señora Emelina S. Ríos tiene la edad de 46 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Emelina tiene 1 hijo. La actividad económica de Doña Emelina es una pulpería y venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio y con esto logro incrementar sus ventas y sobre todo el negocio y con una excelente administración. Los propósitos de Emelina son de proporcionarle mejoras a su negocio y ampliarlo y así obtener espacio para más productos. Doña Emelina solicito un financiamiento para capital de trabajo como granos básicos, ropa de adultos, golosinas y refrescos naturales. Su sueño es incrementar su negocio y con los ingresos mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Emelina S. Ríos, 46, is married and has a son. Emelina has a small store and sells general merchandise. She has been doing this for more than 11 years. She has increased her sales and her business through excellent administration. Emelina plans to make improvements and expand her business, which will allow her to get the space for more products. Emelina is asking for a loan for working capital such as; basic grains, adult clothing, sweets, and natural fruit drinks. Her dream is to increase her business and use the income to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bayasgalan

texts.en: Bayasgalan D. is 46 years old, divorced and lives with her mother and 16-year-old daughter in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her daughter is a student in the local high school. Bayasgalan runs a small retail business selling food products. She opened his store in 2004 with a small amount of capital, selling fewer than 10 different food items from a small stall at the local market. Today, her business has expanded and more than tripled in value. In the future, she would like to open her own food store where she would be able to supply quality food to residents of her community. She has applied for this loan to buy more products to sell.

loans.use: to buy more food products to sell.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia B. is a widow with two adult-aged children. Their major source of income is from a motorcycle for hire,  which has an estimated net revenue of Php 3,000 per month. Always hoping to have enough daily savings for their daily living and future, Letecia is now requesting a loan amount of Php 20,000.00 for motorcycle registration and repairs.

loans.use: Body repair of motorcycle and registration

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.en:
Angelina G. initiated contact for this committee. She invited and organized her friends and neighbors in order to form a program of Women Entrepreneurs.

1 Angelina G. D.- Convenience store 2 Fermina V. B.- Medicinal remedies sales 3 Salvadora V. B.- Small grocery store 4 Elizabeth R. B.- Clothing sales 5 Ariela B. G.- Jewelry and accessory sales 6 Elizabeth B. D.- Fruit sales 7 Blanca A. B.- Charcoal sales 8 Gloria Mabel G.- Food sales 9 Ysidora D.- Clothing and shoe sales 10 Lilian V. B.- Medicinal remedies sales 11 Silvia Clotilde E.- Manicurist 12 Marcelina A. M.- Clothing and cosmetics sales 13 Clides Daina G.- Food sales 14 Ana Fernanadez- Dressmaker 15 Buenaventura L.- Small grocery store and clothing sales

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Mr. M. Patrick, forty-two years old, is a businessman. He is in the motor parts business. He has a shop in town where he has been operating his business for over ten years. He is using the loan to purchase more spare motor parts in his shop to meet his customers’ demands. He has six children and his future plan is to enlarge the business and to educate the children.

loans.use: To purchase motor spare parts.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Our featured entrepreneur is Michael H., 24, a young and active resident of Minsubong, Tangub City. Michael and his wife Merizel operate a mini-grocery in the city of Tangub. With an initial capital of P5,000.00 from their savings, they were able to sustain their business so far. The couple devote most of their their time to their business since they are still unblessed with a child. Michael joined PAGLAUM MPC in June 2009 because he was interested in our products and services. Now, he is applying for a loan of  P20,000.00 to add his capital for their mini-grocery. His future plan is to expand their business and be able to open another outlet in the city. He is also hoping that someday they will be blessed with an angel to complete the word “Family”.

loans.use: Additional capital for their Mini-Grocery Business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 52-years old and married with three children. She is engaged in a variety of business ventures including selling Unique and Avon brand beauty products, selling cookware and sewing. Mary’s husband is a retired teacher.

Mary has been working with Kiva partner Manuel Ramos for three years and is a member of the communal bank “San Fernando II.” She used her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to purchase fabric. She will use this loan of 1,000 soles to purchase fabric, specifically for making children’s undergarments.

Mary’s first business was sewing children’s clothing. She is now an entrepreneur involved in quite a variety of ventures. In addition to selling beauty products and sewing clothing, she also sews sheets and furniture covers. Mary’s goal is to conduct her own sewing workshop.

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 24 year old engaged man.

He has been working as a home-based calligrapher since 2007 to provide, along with his brothers, better living conditions for the family. Today, Mohamad wants to borrow $700 to open his own shop and improve his income.

loans.use: Open his own shop.

loans.name: 017 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
"Tuyết  N. Thị is a 39-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Tuyết  is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 17 (017 Quảng Hưng).

Tuyết  is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Tuyết operates a family member's food stall.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling rice products in the local community.  Tuyết has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately $84 a month from these activities.

In 2004, Tuyết  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tuyết  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3079800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6000000 VND which will also be used to invest in renovating the business.  This will be her ninth loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Tuyết  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  N. Thị Huyền (42) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

2.  N. Thị Hà (38) is a 48 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

3.  P. Thị Quê (20) is a 46 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Tuyết  N. Thị (21) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Tuyết  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 17 (017 Quảng Hưng).
