Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Tuyết  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tuyết  kiếm được khoảng 1500000 VND.  Vào 2004, Tuyết  đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tuyết  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 9th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Huyền (42) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  N. Thị Hà (38) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  P. Thị Quê (20) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Kim Hang

texts.en: Mrs. Kim Hang R. lives in Srae Kaek village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetable. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to expand for her growing. Thus, she decided to request for a loan to hire laborer with two oxen to plow on the field and to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support the rice field. Her husband, Mr. Siem Mahn, is a fisherman. Mrs. Kim Hang R. is 37 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is attending the local school; one of whom is a monk and the remaining is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To request for a loan to hire laborer with two oxen to plow on the field and to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support the rice field.

loans.name: Sabenti Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Sabenti Group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Sierra Leonean leones (or Le 500,000 for each) for the first time from SMT/Kiva in order to help themselves improve their businesses and living conditions.

Abu K. (pictured on the left) is the leader of the group. Abu was born in a village call Yele in the Tonkolili district in northern Sierra Leone. He is approximately 55 years of age. Abu is married with four children. His wife is a businesswoman and the children are attending primary and secondary schools respectively. Abu sells used clothes and has been in the business for more than 25 years.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Junalyn

texts.en:
Junalyn Q. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. She is 22 years old. Junalyn is married and has 1 infant. To make a living, Junalyn owns and runs a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling boiled duck eggs, locally known as balot, and penoy products to the community. Junalyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month.

In 2009, Junalyn joined HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Junalyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Junalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing additional products to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva S. is from the village of Eastern Pob. Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Eva is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Eva owns and operates a "sari-sari" general store, selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap, sugar, candies, salt, vinegar, soft drinks and toothpaste, in the local community. Eva has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Eva joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eva is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Eva from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Sorth Shem Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank loan consists of thirteen people who all live in Veal Kandal village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sorth S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns 1 hectar of land to cultivate rice. Now she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to hire workers to harvest the rice. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Auk Sam Ol, is a construction worker. This couple has eight children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, two are construction workers, and the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To hire workers to harvest rice.

loans.name: Regina Maruja

texts.es:
La señora Regina es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 2 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió primaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales de la región.
Regina nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar chuño, habas, tunta, papa, cañihua, quinua, etc.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia en Ilave y mejorar su negocio.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y la puntualidad de las socias en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Regina has been a member of the “Great Power” cooperative bank for 2 years, located in the Ilave district of the El Collao province, in Puno. She is 34 years old, married, and has 2 children. She completed her primary school studies, and dedicates herself to the purchase and sale of regional grains. Regina tells us that, with her first loan of 500.00 Peruvian soles from the Manuela Ramos Movement, she was able to augment her working capital. She is requesting a loan of 1,000.00 soles with which she will be able to buy potato flour, beans, potatoes, cañihua (an Andean grain), quinoa, etc. She is requesting a loan of 1,000.00 soles to purchase more of the same types of products. Her dreams for the future include owning her own home in Ilave, and to improve her business. What she enjoys most about belonging to a cooperative bank is the ability to save, and the punctuality of the members at the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potato flour, potato, cañihua (an Andean grain), quinoa, etc.

loans.name: Taï

texts.fr: Taï D. est une femme de 47 ans elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de COLOBANE FASS depuis le 19 février 2001. Elle a eu 17 expériences avec le crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle développe un commerce de jus de citron et d'huile de palme. Avec ses bénéfice elle participe à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Taï D. is a married 47-year-old woman with 9 kids. She has been a member of the COLOBANE FASS Banc Villageois since February 19, 2001. She has had 17 loans and has never had a problem repaying them. She is developing a business selling lemon juice and palm oil. She will use her profits to help pay her family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase her ability to self-finance

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is a Kiambu-based businesswoman who operates a salon, a business she has run since 2004, in the Karia-Ikinu area. She offers hair dressing services and also sells beauty products. She describes her business environment as busy, and she sells her products and services to locals. She also earns extra income through dairy farming. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES in order to purchase cosmetics, a blow dryer, and a carpet for her business. A mother of two girls, Judy hopes to expand her salon business into a hair dressing institute and to own rental and residential units. She describes herself as aggressive, determined and self-driven.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, a blow dryer, and a carpet

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en: Josephine P.'s main source of income comes from selling personal products such as lotion and underwear in her community. She is 44 years old, married and has five school-aged children. They are from the village of Minallo, Naguilian, Isabela. Josephine has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase products to sell. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her seventh loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. Josephine is the leader of a 12 member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Josephine P.". About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hawa Gull Group

texts.en:
Hawa G. Group is a group of 5 borrowers led by Hawa G.. She is 38 years old and is married with 3 children ages 16–20, their educational levels from 7th–8th grade. Hawa is an illiterate. She could not go to school due to poverty.

She and her family live in the Old Road community, and she sells at the Old Road Joebar Market located in the downtown part of Monrovia. Hawa’s business is the sale of dry goods. She buys at wholesale and sells at retail to customers. Hawa has been running this business for more than 7 years and hopes to own a shop to serve more customers.

Hawa started selling with funds that were given to her by her husband. Her most challenging times are when her goods remain too long and get spoiled. With the help of her husband and the susu group (community savings club) that she joined, she is able to buy quality goods and sell them to her customers to encourage them to continue buying from her.

Hawa needs this loan to purchase more foodstuff, such as peppers, bouillon cubes, salt, okra, etc., to add to her business. She dreams of owning a shop and building a house for her family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Hawa is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy peppers, bouillon cubes, salt, okra, and other foodstuff for resale

loans.name: Zahy

texts.en: Zahy, a 50-year-old man living in Aley, Mount Lebanon with his wife and their four children, has owned a shoe shop for eight years. He decided on opening his shop because of his extensive experience in sales, which led to a great deal of networking.  When he first started his work, he had some difficulties making himself known to the public because he didn’t have a budget for advertising, having to content himself with word of mouth; as well, early on he  didn’t have enough cash to purchase all the needed merchandise for his shop. To improve his work, Zahy turned to microfinance and is now requesting his fifth loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for the coming season. For the future, he plans to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is a 27-year-old married woman. In order to help with her family’s expenses, Maya has opened a beauty salon in her home. She has taken a first loan of $1,000 and she was able to expand her home business by adding new services and purchasing more equipment. Maya says that her business productivity and income have both increased as a result of this loan. She has also been able to attract new clients. Over the course of her loan term, Maya has consistently paid on time and she has even repaid the full loan amount earlier than her scheduled end date. 

Today, she is asking for a loan of $2,000 to prepare a big beauty room with all the arrangements needed. In the future, Maya would like to open a formal beauty salon for women. She is working to achieve even greater business success in the coming year.

loans.use: To prepare a big beauty room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more salon materials to sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 22 years old and single. He is a hardworking farmer in Eastern Kenya near Nkubu town. He has been farming for the last two years with only one employee. His main produce has been bananas, but in the last two years he decided to venture into poultry farming. He sells his bananas to the local market. Nkubu is a region that is well known for banana farming, and this has led to insufficient markets for the produce. 

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kshs.30,000 to buy chicken layers (chickens reared mainly for egg production). He says the income from the sale of eggs will improve his family's living standard and enable him to educate his siblings. In the future he intends to expand his farming activities by buying another piece of land.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project.

loans.name: Ma. Rosa

texts.en:
Ma. Rosa R. is a 47-year-old woman living in the village of Barangay Polopangan, Toboso, Negros Occidental.  She is married and has five school-aged children.  To make a living, she sells daily use products such as rice and other basic commodities in the local community.  She has just started operating this business and earns approximately $230 a month from these activities.

In 1998, Ma. Rosa joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 19,500 PHP from NWTF. She is now requesting a new loan of 19,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This will be her 19th loan from NWTF.  Ma. Rosa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
Comité La Amistad, así se denomina el grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita el 23 de Junio de 2009.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Es un grupo muy activo y el trabajo solidario se nota en cada una de sus integrantes, ya  que todas ellas a parte de ser compañeras en el Comité son muy buenas amigas.
Una de las señoras muy sacrificadas es Doña Eleuteria quien después de procurar bastante logró montar su negocio vendiendo todo tipo de artículos necesarios para la casa.
A parte de su despensa ella prepara dulce y masa para vender, y sus hijos le ayudan para la atención del negocio.
Ella agradece a todas las personas que de alguna manera ayuda para que ellas pueda trabajar.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideos, enlatados, panificados, lácteos  y otros.
texts.en:
La Amistad group is the name of a group of women that was formed in the city of Ita on June 23, 2009. All of the members carry out activities for raising money, and all of them help each other to reach their common objectives within the group and with Fundación Paraguaya. The group is very active and each of the members shows strong group solidarity, since in addition to being part of the group, all of the members are also good friends. One of the women is Eleuteria. She is very selfless, and after saving enough money she started her business selling all types of household necessities. In addition to her store, she also makes cake and pastries to sell. Her children help her attend to her business. Eleuteria is grateful to all of the people who have helped in some way so that she and her friends can work. She is asking for the loan so that she can purchase rice, sugar, noodles, canned foods, baked goods, dairy products, and other items for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing canned foods, dairy products, vegetables, fruits, meat, eggs, cleaning supplies, plumbing supplies, cosmetics, etc. at wholesale prices to sell at retail

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Shagufta N. lives in the city of Multan with her husband and three children. All of her children attend school. She is a housewife and takes care of her children by staying at home. 



Her husband is involved in the medicine business and runs his own medical store in the market. As new research goes on in the medical industry, Shagufta’s husband needs to improve his store by constantly adding more medicines. 



She is applying for a loan for her husband who will use it to buy medicines for his store. This will help them to improve the financial condition of their family.

loans.use: to purchase medicines

loans.name: Everyne

texts.en:
Everyne is 32 years old. She is married and three children who are all in school.  Her children range from ages 4-12 years. 

Everyne has a bar and a food store.  She has been in  this business for 8 years. Her husband is a driver. 

Evelyn hopes to use this loan to buy more alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks in order to make more profits. With the profits, she hopes to expand her business by buying more drinks and food.

loans.use: Buying more alcoholic drinks and food for her bar

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
N. Teopista, aged 50 years, is a good-humored, widowed lady operating a pub in Kayunga Town. She has banked on profits from this pub business for the last 20 years. With profits from this business, she has supported her family of seven to the fullest. This is a testimony to her sense of responsibility, will power and ability to work hard. 

Her pub is a melting pot every evening, with patrons flocking to partake of her assortment of drinks. In a week, she makes profits that total up to 115,000 shillings. She is upbeat her circumstances will improve with the acquisition of this loan. She wants to buy more crates of both hard and soft drinks for her pub.

loans.use: The purchase of more crates of hard and soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda R. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 55 years old. Erlinda is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling different kinds of vegetables in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetables to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Erlinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the  business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Myskal's Group

texts.en:
Myskal A. is the leader of the group. She is 75 and married. She has raised seven children; most of them are married and live separately.  The first son and the first daughter are bookkeepers, the second son is a musician, the second daughter works in a sewing workshop; and the other children went to work in Russia.  Myskal herself is engaged in poultry, she has been doing it for 45 years. By selling the eggs and chickens, Myskal makes 1200 soms per month. With the money received from the loan, she wants to purchase chickens and a cow for breeding. 

Aichurek A., 57, is married. She has a daughter; the daughter is married and lives in Osh.  Aichurek herself works as a teacher at school, and she also engaged in cattle breeding. With the money from the loan, she wants to purchase hay for her cattle. 

Gulnara T. is the treasurer of the group. She is 50 and divorced. She has raised two sons and two daughters.  The sons went to work in Russia; the first daughter studies at university; and the second is at school.  Three years ago with an initial investment of 50000 soms, Gulnara opened her own shop near the house. She sells convenience goods and makes 7000 soms per month.  That profit made it possible for her to purchase household appliances and improve her living conditions. With the money from the loan, she wants to purchase a variety of convenience goods and also 150 watermelons in order to resell them at a higher price. 

Kurmanjan A., 62, is married. She has three sons and two daughters, most of them are married and live separately with their families.  Kurmanajan and her husband are engaged in cattle breeding. Kurmanjan applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase hay to feed the cattle during the winter season. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance, at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and a cow for breeding

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Mrs. Sina C., 30, and her husband, Mr. Sarith Song, 38, live along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married for four years and have one young daughter.   

Sina runs a grocery store out of her home. She buys grocery items from Koki market, which is a bit far from her house. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and farmer. She is applying for her first loan of $800 to stock additional grocery items to sell.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Batjargal L. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and her family live together in a ger, a traditional housing tent. His wife works as a bookkeeper in a company while his two oldest children both attend a local elementary school. 

Batjargal operates a food retailing business out of a small shop. He recently started his business in 2010 and has built a stable operation. He is a modest and helpful man and says, "I want to enlarge my grocery store and to start operating a cafe next to my store." 

He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan both to increase the working capital for his store and to open new cafe for his future business.

loans.use: To open a new cafe

loans.name: Batsuuri

texts.en:
Batsuuri O. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two young children in Uvs province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His wife stays at home to take care of their little children.

Batsuuri operates a grocery business in his town. He provides his customers with potatoes which he plants and harvests himself. This year he was able to harvest six tons of potatoes. Batsuuri started his grocery business in 2006 and has gained a lot of experience. His monthly business profit is between 80,000 and 100,000 MNT. He uses his earnings to provide for his family.

In the future Batsuuri hopes for continued success and to increase the types of vegetables that he grows. He is requesting a 200,000 MNT loan to purchase more vegetables such as cabbages, beets and carrots for his grocery business.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To puchase construction material (cement, sand, stone, metal sheets, bricks, etc.)

loans.name: Carlos Xavier

texts.es:
Este cliente que se dedica a la reparación de vehículos en un taller de vulcanizadora tiene 5 años de experiencia en este trabajo es un hombre que trabaja para mantener a su familia que son 3 hijos y su esposa le taller lo tiene ubicado en un barrio de la ciudad
Esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de accesorios para la reparación de los vehículos y también repara el motor que utiliza para la generación de aire que es indispensable en le taller
texts.en: This borrower works repairing vehicles at a tire repair shop.  He has five years of experience in this job.  He is a man who works to support his family, which is made up of his three children and his wife.  His shop is located in a neighborhood of the city.  He is requesting this loan to buy tools for repairing the vehicles, and also to fix the motor that he uses for generating air, which is indispensable to his shop.

loans.use: to buy tools for repairing vehicles, and to fix the motor on his air pump

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 26-year-old male. He is married with three children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a motorcycle for transport business. However, he has the challenge of his motorcycle breaking down due to poor roads. He started riding other people’s motorcycles but later acquired his own and expects by 2013 to have at least three motorcycles of his own. Christopher intends to use the loan proceeds to buy a motorcycle for transport business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza es socia del Banco Comunal “Bellavista 1”  ubicado en la provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y tiene 01 hijo, la señora estudió educación superior (incompleto).

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 04 meses, su   primer préstamo  fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizó para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de artículos artesanales como animalitos y títeres.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en comprar lana y napa para elaborar sus tejidos.

Su sueño para el futuro  es ser una gran empresaria y tener convenio con el extranjero para exportar sus productos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las ganancias de sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member if the Communal Bank “Beautiful View 1” located in the Puno Province and Department. She is 25 years old, single, and has one child. She studied higher education (incomplete)

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 4 months. Her first loan was for $500 Peruvian Soles, money which she used to supply her business. She sells local art pieces such as animal figurines and puppets.

Maritza will use the $600 Peruvian Soles loan to buy wool and leather to make fabrics.

Her dream for the future is to become a great business woman and have an agreement with foreigners to export her products.

What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the profits from her savings.

loans.use: To buy wool and  leather to make fabrics

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto, de 30 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Martha de 22 años y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. Muy temprano por la mañana, Alberto sale a trabajar en sus tierras que se encuentran a una hora de caminata, él tiene sembrado cacao, café y hojas de coca, cultivos que cuida con mucho cariño y esfuerzo, ya que sabe que de la buena cosecha que tenga, dependerá el sustento económico con el que cuente su familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la  plaga de insectos que pueden afectar sus plantaciones, es por eso que nunca se olvida de fumigar sus tierras. En el futuro, desea comprar un carro, con el cual él mismo pueda transportar sus productos al mercado mayorista para la comercialización de sus productos. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y no quiere dejar de pagar por falta de dinero, así que ya esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas, es de los pocos varones de su banco comunal, motivo por el cual siempre trata de ser responsable y respetuoso con las demás socias. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en: Alberto, age 30, is a very unassuming and hard-working man. He lives in his own home with his wife Martha, age 22. What he most desires is to excel in life. Very early in the morning, Alberto leaves to work his lands, which are an hour's trek away. He has sown cocoa, coffee and coca leaves-- crops which he cares for with great care and hard work, since he knows that his family's sustenance depends on his good harvest. What he most enjoys about his work is sowing his lands. He has been doing this work for 20 years and finds that the hardest part is keeping his crops safe from the plague of insects that can affect his crops. Thus he never forgets to fumigate his lands. In the future, he wants to buy a car with which to transport his products to the wholesale market for sale. This is his fifth loan with MFP and he does not want to stop paying for lack of funds, so he is already saving to pay his quotas. He is one of the few men in his community bank, so he always tries to be responsible and respectful with the other members. With the 1500 soles, he will invest in the purchase of fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is married and has 4 children. She has received no formal education. Rose sells a local food called Fante Kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) which she makes herself at Ankaful near Abura.  She has done this for 2 years now. Her husband is a security man. Rose uses her income to assist her husband in the upkeep of the home.

Rose will use the loan to purchase more maize for the preparation of Fante Kenkey for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to reinvest back into the food business.

In her hand are a few balls of Fante Kenkey for display.

loans.use: to purchase more maize for the preparation of the Fante Kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Edson

texts.en: Edson is a thirty-nine-year-old married man with seven children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has run a retail shop for the last four years, which he started with capital of 500,000 shillings and grew to 4,000,000 shillings. He says his hardship is that he has many debtors, and that vision is to have a wholesale business and to be able to educate his children.  Edson intends to use the proceeds from this loan to buy inventory such as rice, sugar and salt.

loans.use: To buy inventory such as rice, sugar, and salt.

loans.name: Estrellas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS” iniciará el ciclo número catorce en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes,  un varón y siete señoras.   La asociación comunal “Estrellas” está dirigida por una mesa directiva , a la cabeza la presidenta, la señora Juana, como tesorera la señora Adela y como secretaria de actas, la señora Olimpia.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la banca comunal llevan adelante son variados: venta de ropa, venta de abarrotes, comerciante de papa, venta de chamarras, ropa de varón (Ternos), chofer de Trufi, venta de verduras, comercial – ferretería y venta de papa y chuño.

La señora Juana, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que forma parte de la A.C.  “Estrellas” desde hace 3 años.  La señora Juana tiene 40 años edad, está casada, tiene 5 hijos,  el negocio  que desempeña actualmente es la venta de verduras, actividad que realiza en la Feria 16 de Julio y la Feria de la Ex - tranca, por ahora trabaja sola.
El crédito de este ciclo será destinado a la compra de mercadería. 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  el crédito.
texts.en:
The Estrellas Group will start its 14th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the central hub of Panamericana. The group is comprised of eight members: one man and seven women. The Estrellas Group has a board of directors; the president is Ms. Juana, the treasurer is Ms. Adela, and the secretary is Ms. Olimpia. The group members partake in several types of businesses: clothing sales, general store, potato sales, jacket sales, menswear (suits), minibus driver, vegetable sales, hardware sales, and potato and freeze-dried potato sales.

Ms. Juana, president of the microfinance group, indicates that she has been a part of the Estrellas Group for 3 years. She is a 40-year-old married mother of five. She currently sells vegetables for a living in the 16 de Julio Market, and in the Ex-tranca Market. For now, she works alone.

This loan will be used to purchase merchandise.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she stated that she likes the loans.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Urantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Urantsetseg is 40 years old.  She lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two daughters attend a secondary school. Mrs. Urantsetseg is an optician. Since 1999, she has been selling glasses.  A few years ago she bought optical instruments and started running as a private optician. She fits optical lenses and also sells different fashion and sunglasses to customers. She has been in this business for many years and has lots of trusted customers. She is planning to extend her business by opening one more service point in the future. 

Mrs. Urantsetseg’s family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar city. She is building a house for her family at the moment and she is planning to complete it before the autumn of 2011. She is asking for the loan to complete the building project and to use in her business to buy more lenses and frames for glasses.

loans.use: to complete a building project and to buy more lenses and frames for glasses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of pans and dishes

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan H. is a 47-year-old married woman who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She and her husband earn a living by growing rice crops on their own farmland. This couple has been working in this sector since their children were very young.  They currently have four children -- three of them are married and live independently, while the remaining one is still single and helps them in their farming business. 

Presently, Chan H.’s house is very old and a few parts are broken. She very much wants to repair it but lacks cash on hand. Thus, Chan H. would like to ask for loan to repair her broken house. She believes that his loan will give her whole family a good environment for living.

loans.use: to repair her broken house

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng P. is a 29-year-old married woman and a local villager living in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops: rice and vegetables. Her husband works as a construction worker.

 Seng P. is blessed with a child who is attending local school. Seng P. is looking for a loan as capital to support her farming business. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed for planting.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for planting.

loans.name: Von

texts.en: Von C. is a 30-year-old married woman who earns a daily income by producing clay crocodile to sell to her regular clients in bulk from her house. On average, Von C. makes a profit of about $2 per day. She also has other financial earner in her husband who is a boat deliverer in Siem Reap province. Recently her husband has been finding it difficult to catch as many fishes as before, since his boat is broken. So Von C. is applying for a loan to repair the old boat for her husband. Von C. is blessed with four children, all of whom are not yet working and living under her income.

loans.use: to repair the old boat for her husband.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is from the village of Daan Lungsod, Gingoog City. She is 33 years old. Liza is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Liza runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap, and biscuits in the local community. Liza has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month through these activities.

In 2006, Liza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and to serve as working capital. Liza is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods, and beverages. This will be Liza's fifth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods, and beverages

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: Wilson tiene su negocio que es una pulpería y cyber. Tiene más de 6 años de tener este negocio, con mucho empeño y sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante. Wilson inicio el cyber por medio de ciertas ganancias de su pulpería, fue así que poco a poco fue estableciendo esta actividad. El negocio está ubicado en su vivienda en donde asisten varios clientes. El crédito es para la compra computadoras, impresoras, tintas, papel, mouse, teclado y otros.
texts.en:
Wilson has a business that consists of a store and a cybercafé. He has been in business for more than six years and was able to get ahead through much effort and sacrifice.

Wilson started the cybercafé using the profits generated from his store. Over time he was able to get it established. His business is located in his home, where he is able to attend to different customers. This loan will be used to buy computers, printers, ink, paper, a mouse, keyboard, and other supplies.

loans.use: to purchase computers, printers, ink, paper, a mouse, keyboard, and other supplies.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам житель города Душанбе. Возраст, 52 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка, дочка работает поваром, а сын студент. Сам Рустам предоставляет услугу. Он развозит людей по маршрутной линии №55. В этой области он имеет богатый опыт. Кроме того он занимается торговлей на рынке Корвон. В основном он продает в оптом мужские трусы и носки. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже год. В продвижении его деятельности ему помогает его сын. Он берет кредит для ремонта автомашины марки Тангем и приобретения сезонного товара для торговли.
texts.en: Rustam lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 62 years old, married and has two children.  His wife is a homemaker, daughter works as a cook, and son is a student.  Rustam provides a service.  He transports people on route number 55.  He has extensive experience in this field.  Besides this business, Rustam is involved in sales at the Korvon market.  He primarily sells men's undergarments and socks wholesale.  He has been involved in this business for one year.  Rustam's son helps him with growing the business.  He is requesting this loan for the repairs of the Tangem automobile and purchase of seasonal merchandise for sale.

loans.use: to repair automobile Tangem and buy seasonal goods for sale

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
La dame Fatou agée de 44 ans parraissant plus jeune que son âge est très active et exerce ce métier depuis plus de 6ans.Elle a eu à bénéficier de 4 crédits à l’IMCEC  payés avec succès.En plus de son expérience avéré dans le commerce, Fatou est aussi mère de 8 enfants  dont l’aîné à 28 ans.
Elle vend des lègumes provenant du champ de ses proches, ce qui réduit son coût d’achat.
Elle cherche le crédit pour renforcer son stock de carotte,choux,poivron,aubergine ….
Etant veuve et soutien de famille elle a besoin d’augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire pour pouvoir faire fasse aux dépenses alimentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs Fatou, aged 44 but looking younger, is a very active woman. She has been in her trade for more than six years. In the past she benefited from four loans granted by the microfinance institution U-IMCEC, which she has repaid successfully. In addition to being an experienced businesswoman, Fatou is the mother of eight children, the eldest being 28.

Fatou sells vegetables harvested on the fields of her next of kin, which reduces her purchase price. She seeks this loan to increase her supply of carrots, cabbages, peppers, eggplants, etc. Since she is a widow and the breadwinner of the family, she needs a higher profit margin to be able to provide her family with food.

loans.use: to buy vegetables (cabbages, carrots, eggplants, peppers) for sale at the market.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara is 47, widowed, and has four children. Her one son went to Russia in search of a living. Two of her other sons are her main helpers in breeding cattle and land cultivating. Her youngest daughter goes to kindergarten. They have been engaged in the breeding and cultivating businesses since 2004. They work hard to grow beans and potatoes on the rented plot of land and breed 15 sheep at their farm. These activities allow them to earn about 6,000 KGS a month. Gulnara plans to use her loan of 70,000 KGS to purchase mineral fertilizers to manure her land, which will allow her the best quality harvest. With the revenues, she wants to help her son build a barn for the cattle and in the future, she plans further development of these businesses. 

About Bai-Tushum and Partners:

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.ru: Одилжон проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Ему 42 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Одилжон имеет высшее экономическое образование. По профессии он не работает. На сегодняшний день он занимается производством пельменей. Арендует помещение, где открыл свой маленький цех. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 6 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения нового оборудования. Он хочет заменить устаревшее оборудование.
texts.en: Odiljon lives in the town of Qurgan-Tube. He is 42 years old. He is married. He has four children. His wife is a homemaker. Odiljon has a higher education in economics. He does not work in his profession. He produces pelmeni (meat-filled boiled dumplings similar to ravioli). He rents a place where he opened his small shop. He has been doing this work for six years. He is taking out a loan to buy new equipment. He wants to replace obsolete equipment.

loans.use: to buy new equipment

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with two children. Alma has a retail shop that sells clothes and cosmetics. She has had this business for five years. She has asked for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional products from Natasha and Avon. Alma is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Alma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products from Natasha and Avon/

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es: Ana Vilma de cuarenta y ocho años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos. Ella posee una panadería muy conocida en la localidad donde vive, pues el pan que prepara Ana tiene un sabor inigualable siempre está recién horneado, es de excelente calidad  y lo vende a un precio accesible, la demanda ha aumentado cada vez mas y Ana Vilma ya está dispuesta a ver crecer su negocio y como toda mujer emprendedora y llena de buenas decisiones le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina por mayor, azúcar, bandejas entre otros a fin de obtener los ricos pastelitos, semita, torta alemana entre otros mas. Ana Vilma tiene la esperanza que con su duro trabajo lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana Vilma is 48 years old and lives with her life partner and their four children. She owns a bakery which is well-known in the area where she lives, since the bread that Ana prepares has a unique taste, is fresh baked, and is of an excellent quality, and she sells it at a reasonable price. Demand has increased and Ana Vilma is ready to expand her business and since she is an enterprising woman and full of good ideas she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to allow her to buy wholesale flour, sugar, trays and other things in order to make the delicious pastries, sweet bread, german cake and other baked goods. Ana Vilma has hope that through her hard work she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale flour, sugar, and trays.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and has one child. She sells smoked fish and rice at Krofofordo. Ama's husband is a mason. Ama assists her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for resale. She anticipates reinvesting her profits back into the business.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Mamou

texts.fr:
Mamou  est âgée de 49 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants.Elle  réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle dans la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Mamou après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité génératrice de revenus d’achat et de vente des articles en plastiques (seaux, bols gobelet, etc) depuis plus de six  ans. Elle achète ses marchandises à Sikasso, avant de les revendre de façon ambulante au grand marché et au marché de Médine à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes de ménages. 
Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses articles. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de deux ans. Après plusieurs prêts solidaires dans une association de femmes de leur quartiers, elle est à son premier prêt individuel.
Ce premier prêt individuel lui permettra d’acheter, 10 douzaines de seaux, 20 douzaines de bols et 30 douzaine gobelets.
 Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mamou is 49 years old, and married with 7 children. She lives with her husband and their children in a large traditional family in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the republic of Mali )
Mrs Mamou, having had several  unsuccessful  business ventures,started this income generating activity  buying and  selling plastic articles (cups, bowls, buckets  etc.) over six years ago .She buys her merchandise at Sikasso, before reselling it as an itinerant saleswoman at the grand market and at the market of Medine to a clientele mainly made up of cleaning women.
She is very popular with her clients due to the quality of her products.
To satisfy her ever increasing clientele, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution over two years ago. After several solidarity loans in a local women’s association, this is her first individual loan.
This first individual loan will enable her to purchase 10 dozen buckets, 20 dozen bowls and 30 dozen cups.
With this loan She plans to make a monthly profit of 75 000 FCFA which will be used mainly to increase her stock, contribute to the family expenses and pay the loan interest.

loans.use: To buy plastic articles.

loans.name: Welma

texts.en:
Welma is 47 years old and married. She has 10 children.

Welma works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells rice in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Welma has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been buying and selling rice for five years and also earns an income from farming rice and coconut.

Welma aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: El señor Leonardo es agricultor y maestro albañil que realiza trabajos dos veces al mes  y su esposa lo ayuda con las actividades agrícolas, produciendo papa. Con el dinero del crédito cubrirá el costo de una motobomba así mejorar el riego para su  producción. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Vicarani en la provincia Aroma; es casado y  tiene cinco  hijos. Es la primera vez que Leonardo obtiene un crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Leonardo is a farmer and master bricklayer who works on masonry jobs twice a month. His wife helps with the farming activities and growing potatoes. The money from this loan will cover the cost of a water pump so that he can improve the irrigation of his crops. Leonardo lives in his own home in the town of Vicarani in Aroma Province. He is married and has five children.

This is the first time Leonardo has obtained a loan.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to improve the irrigation of his crops.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un célibataire sans enfants.Il exerce le transport de clients et de bagages avec une charette et un cheval.Il vend également durant la saison sèche de la paille d'arachide pour augmenter ses revenus.Ce qui fait que ses deux activités lui permettent de prendre en charge sa famille qui se trouve au village situé à quelques kilomètres de la ville ou il travaille.Actuellement il sollicite  un pret de 400000f pour acheter une seconde charette et un cheval .Son ambition est d'acquérir plus tard un traxi de transport urbain.
texts.en:
The borrower is single and does not have children. He works as a transporter of people and baggage with a cart and a horse. During the dry season, he also sells groundnut straw to increase his revenues. As a result of these two activities, he can provide for his family; they live in a village located a few kilometers away from the city where he works.
He is currently requesting a 400,000 XOF loan in order to purchase a second cart and a horse. His ambition is later to acquire a taxi for urban transportation.

loans.use: to buy a second cart and a horse.

loans.name: Perlita Group

texts.en:
Perlita is 54 years old and lives in Segatic Daku, Osamiz City. She is married with three children. Perlita has a general store business and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has a requested loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, a sack of rice, noodles, etc. Perlita has been a member of PMPC for three months. In the future, Perlita hopes to be successful in her chosen business. 

Perlita is the leader of a four-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her business.

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en: Sopheak, 26, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province. She started selling groceries and sugar cane juice in 2010 to support her daily expenses. Her husband works transferring data from the PC to a hand phone. This couple has one young child. To earn more money to improve her standard of living, she is asking for a loan of US $800 to add her stock of her groceries.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Naser

texts.en: Naser is a 38-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents. He’s the main income provider in the family after his father became too old to bear this big responsibility. He has been working as a blacksmith since 2000 and has fifteen years' experience in this area. Until now he has gotten a fair number of customers asking for his services. Today, he’s requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new blacksmith equipment for his business. This will help him continue his work in a proper way and respond to his customers’ demands. In the future, he plans to join a local company and benefit from their experience.

loans.use: to purchase new blacksmith equipment for his business

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont essentiellement des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 39  ans,  5 enfants et vivant majoritairement dans des  familles polygamiques à Ouayerma I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes le commerce d’articles divers : fruits et légumes, habillements etc.
AMINATA, la première à droite de la photo, fait le commerce de pagnes wax, il y’a environ  5 ans et souhaite devenir grossiste. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 15 pièces de pagnes wax de différentes sortes. Elle s’approvisionne dans au grand marché de Sikasso chez les grossistes. Elle les revend en détail (pièces découpée en trois pagnes, deux et 1 pagne, suivant le besoin des clients) de façon ambulante et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The four members of the Sabougnouma group are mainly married women. They are on average 39 years old with five children, and live for the most part in polygamous families in Ouayerma I, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

They are on their eighth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, seeking to meet the needs of their customers. This group of women trade various items: fruits and vegetables, clothing, etc.

Aminata (on the right in the photo) has been trading pagnes wax (a type of colorful West-African fabric) for over five years and wants to become a wholesaler.

The loan will enable her to purchase 15 lengths of various kinds of pagne wax. She resupplies from wholesalers at the general market in Sikasso. She retails them by selling the whole pagne length, or by dividing it into two or three pieces, depending on the client's needs. She sells from her home and as an itinerant vendor, to both men and women customers, for cash only.

She envisions average monthly profits of 22,500 FCFA, part of which will be used to pay off the loan and interest, and the rest put into savings. She wants to increase her turnover to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: Buy pagnes wax (type of colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new stocks of shoes

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio anterior de la compra y venta de cereales y lana de alpaca, verduras, la socia tiene sus terrenos de cultivo de maíz y ganaderia y en esta ocasión la socia requiere el prestamo para la compra de semillas de verduras, cuyes y ovejas, la socia tiene pensado comprar semillas para sembrar y comprar ovejas, comprar cuyes como 20.
texts.en: Juana continues with her earlier business, buying and selling cereals, alpaca wool, and vegetables. She has her own fields for cultivating corn and raising sheep and, on this occasion, she needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, guinea pigs and sheep. Juana is also considering buying green pea seeds to sow and buying more sheep, plus buying around 20 guinea pigs.

loans.use: buy supplies for her farming and sheep-raising business.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,ella sigue alquilando un taxi y su esposo lo maneja,la socia ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de productos como galletas y champanes,ella vende en forma independiente desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender galletas y champanes.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar galletas y champanes al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member continues working in transportation leasing a taxi that her husband drives.  She’s also now selling products like cookies and champagne independently from 8am until 7pm.  Through these businesses she’s able to support her children.  Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell the cookies and champagne.  She’s asking for a loan to buy cookies and champagne at wholesale.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy cookies and champagne at wholesale.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok has been operating a farming business together with her spouse in Prey Chor district. It’s the only business for a low educated woman like her to earn her livelihood, she said.  She is 44 years old and presently she has been blessed with 8 children, 4 of whom are living separately with their own family. 

Sok grows rice both in rainy season and in dry season on a few hectares of farmland.  This is her fifth loan from HKL and the first loan from Kiva.  She intends to use it to build a bathroom with a toilet in it.  With the remaining funds, she will use it to buy materials for farming, such as fertilizers, rice seeds and pesticides.  In the future, Sok hopes to run another small micro business, pig-raising in her backyard to increase her income.

loans.use: To build a bathroom with a toilet in it.

loans.name: Wadagbe Group

texts.fr: WADAGBE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. Le représentant du groupe, Oussou Augustin (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgé de 49 ans et est marié à Marie. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Oussou Augustin et sa femme vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Il y a près de douze ans que Oussou Augustin vend du charbon de bois par le système de distribution. Oussou Augustin exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Oussou Augustin s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Oussou Augustin sollicite un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe WADAGBE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.

loans.use: Acheter du charbon de bois.

loans.name: Cruz Rosario

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Soraya se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Cruz, tiene 48 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 30, 26 y 25  de edad, todos ellos ya son independientes. El marido es maestro en construcción. 
Cruz con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar desde hace casi 3  años atrás se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta, ella sale en sus ratos libres y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Gracias a sus ganancias ha podido solventar muchos  gastos y más cuando su marido no tiene mucho trabajo, es allí cuando sus ganancias les ayudan a seguir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Lleva dos años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos compra más prendas. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su familia.

loans.use: comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.

loans.name: Krasimir

texts.en: Krasimir V. is 45 years old and lives in Vratza. In 2001 he decided to start a small manufacture of furniture in a rented workshop. He produces home equipment – bedroom suites, kitchen equipment, wardrobes and others. His customers are people of the city and the region. Krasimir V. needs $ 2 000 to supply wooden material for his manufacture.

loans.use: To supply wooden material for his manufacture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand and diversify my business

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Four  years ago this 33-year-old man decided to start his own business selling discs, audio cassettes, and video cassettes. 
He used his first loan of $400 to buy discs and cassettes.
Now he is asking for a loan of $1200 to buy equipment for the montage of cassettes.
Khalil is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Agdam region. He lives in the Khirdalan settlement with his wife and 2 children.

loans.use: To buy equipment for montage of cassettes

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
Born on May 25th, 1983 in Vogan in the prefecture of Vo, Miss Adjovi T. abandoned her studies due to lack of means and came to Lomé to learn how to sew. She has now gained her diploma but her brother does not have the means to open a workroom for her. She is asking for a loan of $600 to buy a sewing machine and put her expertise into practice. This will lead her towards financial autonomy and allow her to become independent.

Née le 25 mai 1983 à Vogan dans la préfecture de Vo, Mlle T. Adjovi a abandonné ses études fautes de moyens elle est venue à Lomé pour apprendre la couture. Aujourd’hui, elle est sortie avec son diplôme mais son frère n’a pas les moyens nécessaires pour lui ouvrir son atelier. Elle sollicite cet apport financier de $600 pour s’acheter une machine et mettre en pratique son savoir-faire. Ceci l’amènera a avoir une autonomie financière en vue de se prendre en charge.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and open a tailoring workroom

loans.name: Feiloaiga

texts.en: Ms P. is a widowed lady of sixty three years of age with two kids. Even though she is old, she is still an active woman in the family because there is no father to support her. She is a very good tailor; she started doing this particular business when she was twenty five years old, and so far she wants to continue with her talent. That’s why she has applied for her $300 loan just to maintain the good supplies of her business and to hold on to her usual clients. She is wanting to get another extra loan to build a special place for her business.

loans.use: Buy materials needed for the business

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene takes care of her 6 year old daughter, and for the last four years she has worked selling used clothing. She started this business thanks to the initiative of her sister Gregoria and now she's doing well.

She works from 5 in the morning, 6 days a week, moving around the plaza dominical selling her clothing. Her daughter, always by her side, has become a partner and a great model.

Marlene would like to expand her business, and to continue her work she is requesting a loan which will allow her to expand the variety of clothing during this season of greater demand.

Work with us so that this can become a reality for Marlene, a diligent mother who continues to work hard to improve the quality of life for her and her young daughter.

Marlene tiene bajo su cobijo a una pequeña niña de seis años y desde hace cuatro años se dedica a la comercialización de ropa de segundo uso, trabajo que emprendió gracias a la iniciativa de su hermana Gregoria y que ahora desempeña satisfactoriamente. Inicia arduamente su labor a las cinco de la mañana y durante seis días a la semana en forma ambulatoria en la plaza dominical, acompañada siempre de su adorable niña quién se ha convertido en su engreída socia y modelo espectacular. Marlene está deseosa de seguir expandiendo su negocio y para continuar con su labor desea obtener un préstamo que le permitirá ampliar su puesto de ventas e incrementar la variedad de prendas de vestir aún más en esta temporada en la que existe mayor demanda. Colaboremos para que este deseo se haga realidad en poco tiempo y para que esta diligente madre siga cobijando en su corazón deseos de superación.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INVEST IN MORE VARIETY OF CLOTHING TO SELL, GROW HER BUSINESS, AND IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HERSELF AND HER YOUNG DAUGHTER.

loans.name: Itohan

texts.en: Mrs. Itohan A. is 45 years old and married with eight children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has a shop where she sells provisions and drinks. She has been in this business for the past 8 years. She is an LAPO member and she is requesting a loan of $350 to buy more stock.

loans.use: Itohan would like to buy more provisions and drinks

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa K. is a 37 year old woman who is married with five children. Hawa’s husband is a petty trader and both of them have to work hard to generate income to meet their family's expenses. Hawa has been running a restaurant business for the last five years.

Before becoming an SMT client, Hawa used to obtain items for her business from a Lebanese merchant on credit. She realized that the expense involved in such loans is considerably high and could not meet her daily repayment. With subsequent loans from SMT she reduced her purchases on credit and her income increased. Hawa’s aim now is to build a permanent retail shop with her own capital and she is therefore requesting a $300 loan.

loans.use: To increase her revenue by  purchasing more items with cash and saving money by not purchasing on credit.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah N.. She runs a retail store and is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to purchase a payphone. Sarah is 30 years old and married to a businessman. She has 2 children ranging from ages 4 to 7 and her children go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 70,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400,000 to expand her business and paid back the loan on time.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Prossy N., Nulu N., Eva N., and Mary N.. Prossy N. runs a restaurant and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to expand her business. Nulu N. runs a salon and is requesting a loan of UGX 200,000 to buy more equipment. Eva N. makes and sells cookies and is requesting a loan of UGX 300,000 to invest in her business. Mary N. runs a small retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 300,000 to buy more stock.

loans.use: To buy a new public payphone

loans.name: Nassuti B(Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Babirye E.. She is currently in the business of farming and is requesting a loan to purchase more farm supplies. Babirye is 32 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 10 to 18 and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

Babirye is joined in her small group by Mercy B., Agnes B., Berna N., and Gertrude N.. Mercy B. has a business in tailoring and wants to purchase a sewing machine. Agnes B. is currently operating a public pay phone business and wants a loan to purchase more airtime cards. Berna N. operates a business of tailoring and wants to purchase more cloth material. Gertrude N. is currently in the business of hardware sales and is requesting a loan to add stock.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Susana Luz

texts.es:
Mrs. Susana Luz Q. R. is a 45 year old woman who attended school through the sixth grade. She has 4 children, with one still living at home. Susana lives in the El Cortijo section of the Trujillo district in the La Libertad department of Peru. She sells food outside her home every weekend, offering chicken sausage, potato sausage, tallarines (a pasta dish), lomitos (a South American sandwich), and other soup-style dishes. During the week she works at a kindergarten near her home; selling food only on Saturdays and Sundays. Susana is a member of the “Nuevo Peru” community bank where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles ($100) which she used to purchase necessary cooking ingredients. With a 1000 sol loan ($375) which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase a box of oil, a sack of rice, a sack of potatoes, and a package of noodles and vegetables. Her greatest dream is to obtain a location where she can open a large restaurant complete with all of the cooking equipment.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Susana Luz Q. R. tiene 45 años de edad, estudio hasta el sexto grado de primaria. Tiene cuatro hijos en total pero solo dos aun dependen de ella. Vive en el sector El Cortijo en el distrito de Trujillo departamento La Libertad – Perú. Vende comida todos los fines de semana fuera de su casa. Prepara salchipollo, salchipapa, tallarines, lomito y otros potajes. Entre semana trabaja en un jardín de niños cerca de su domicilio. Desde años atrás vendía menú diariamente pero debido a que consiguió el trabajo en el jardín, solo vende los sábados y domingos. La señora Susana integra el Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro todos los ingredientes necesarios para cocinar. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 el cual será cancelado en seis meses comprará una caja de aceite, un saco de arroz, un saco de papas, un paquete de fideos y verduras. Su mayor sueño es conseguir un local en donde instale un gran restaurante con todos sus implementos.

loans.use: The loan with be used to purchase rice, oil, etc. for the business.

loans.name: Virinia

texts.en:
Virina is a single mother of three sons, the oldest one is 28, the other 22, and the youngest one 18 years old.

Virina used to work as a housekeeper. Since her salary was extremely low she decided to change her job. She started collecting cardboard and then recycled it. Later on she invested in the purchase of a little cart to collect and transport recycling products such as cardboard, plastic, and glass.

Virina wants to save some money to invest in the purchase of a car to facilitate transportation. The money from this loan will be used to buy recyclable materials such as paperboard, plastic and glass.

loans.use: Purchase of paperboard, plastic, glass for recycling

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
The agriculture business is one that requires much effort for the simple reasons that it requires sun exposure, the physical exertion of moving animals from one place to another, as well as the work it takes to tend to various crops.

Mr. Juan Narváez, from the El Sauce municipality of the city of León, has dedicated himself for a number of years to farming which supports his humble family who so relies on him. Currently, he has turned to CEPRODEL for a loan to purchase calves that he can raise. It’s important to note that the granting of this loan will not only benefit him, but also his children and wife who he loves greatly.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio agropecuario es un negocio que requiere de muchísimo esfuerzo por la sencilla razón de que se necesita exposición al sol y al desgaste físico en el traslado de los animales de un lugar a otro y además en el proceso de asistencia en los cultivos para llevar a cabo las siembras.

El señor Juan Narváez es originario del municipio de El Sauce en la ciudad de León dedicándose desde ya hace varios años al negocio agropecuario con el cual sustenta a su humilde familia que tanto necesita de él. Actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito con el cual comprar vaquillas para el desarrollo. Es de importancia destacar que con el otorgamiento de este crédito se beneficia tanto él como sus hijos y esposa a los que tanto ama.

loans.use: Purchase calves to raise.

loans.name: Uputaua

texts.en: Uputaua P., 40, is married with 4 children.  She has many years of experience in the Samoan healing business. She sells to the public and villagers 6 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Uputaua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.
