She will also use the loan for buying cements and timbers to repair her home. Her husband works and helps out with the family needs.

loans.use: Purchase oils and equipment needed for the healing

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos S. lives at home with his parents (on Otto Richter Street in the area of Obispo Indaburo in the city of La Paz) and has a wife and children. He supports his family by selling hardware (his only source of income) and his wife gets a low wage (she’s a maid) so Carlos is requesting a loan to increase his capital and improve his income.

In previous loans, Carlos has stood out by always paying his installments on time, which means he is suitable to receive your help.

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Carlos S. vive en casa de sus padres (calle Otto Richter de la zona de Obispo Indaburo, ciudad de La Paz), tiene una esposa e hijos. Se mantiene con la venta de material de ferretería (su única fuente de ingreso), la esposa percibe un salario bajo (es sirvienta), por lo tanto, Carlos solicita crédito para incrementar su capital y mejorar sus ingresos.

En créditos anteriores Carlos se destacó por hacer los pagos a tiempo, lo que quiere decir que es apto para recibir su ayuda.

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Melinda

texts.es:
Melinda is 33 years old. She is the single mother of one daughter named Melinda like her. She is 7 years old. She is dedicate to run her beauty shop. She performs this activity at her home where she spends most of her day. The business is profitable. The only negative side to it is that she has to work most of the day and can't share as much time with her daughter as she wants. But her 15 years of experience in this business makes her enjoy it and it doesn't bring any difficulties to her. Melinda works and will work ardously for her daughter so she can be happy and have a promising future. With the money she is asking, Melinda will buy more hairdressing equipment and accesories. Melinda wants to grow and consolidate her business so it can be bigger.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Melinda tiene 33 años, es madre soltera de una hija de 7 años llamada Melinda, como ella. Se dedica a atender su peluquería, esta actividad la realiza en su casa dedicándole la mayor parte del día, el negocio es rentable, lo único malo es que al trabajar durante casi todo el día y no pueda compartir el tiempo que ella quisiera con su hija, por lo demás los 15 años de experiencia en el negocio, hace que éste no le traiga dificultad y que más bien le agrade hacerlo. Melinda trabaja y trabajará arduamente por su hija, para que ella sea feliz y tenga un futuro promisorio. Con el dinero que solicita comprara más accesorios de peluquería, Melinda quiere crecer y consolidar su negocio, para que sea cada vez más grande.

loans.use: Implementing her beauty salon and adding more hairdressing accesories.

loans.name: Mrs. Hor Srey Group

texts.en:
This group loan is located in Kampong Prasat Village in Kampon Chhnang Province. The group consists of four members and Mrs. Hor S. is the group leader. She owns a small grocery store in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy grocery products for her inventory.

Her husband, Mr. Pin Mi, is a body guard in the market and he makes $42 per month which is a small income to support the whole family. Mrs. Hor S. is 44 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are too young to work or study because they are at the age of five and three.

loans.use: To buy grocery products for inventory

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
El Seños Juan José junto con su esposa la señora Nadia tiene dos hijos que son pequeños de edad escolar están solicitando un préstamo, para construir la barda trasera de su casa ya que donde está ubicada la vivienda solo hay un terreno solo y se encuentran muchos animales es por eso desea construir la barda y así darles mas protección y seguridad a su familia.

El Seños Juan José trabaja casi todo el día en una compañía de mantenimiento industrial en el área de ayudante de soldador y plomería éste es el ingreso de su familia. Don Juan José y la señora Nadia necesitan la cantidad de $325.00dlls para comprar el material ya que él mismo construirá la barda.
texts.en:
Juan Jose and his wife, Nadia, have two small children. They are asking for a loan to build a fence around their house, which is located in an area with a lot of animals. They'd like to build a fence to provide more protection and security for their family. Juan Jose works nearly all day as a welding and plumbing assistant in an industrial maintenance company. This is the family's only source of income. Juan Jose and Nadia need a loan of $325 to buy the materials that Juan Jose needs to construct the fence.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a fence around their house

loans.name: Yaa Asantewaa

texts.en:
Yaa Asantewaa A. sells clothing and fabric at Elmina. She has received a primary education. Yaa Asantewaa is a single parent with 4 dependents, and she is responsible for providing the basic needs of her family.

Yaa Asantewaa started selling clothing and fabric not long ago. Her loan will be used to purchase more clothing and fabric to sell. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business into her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing and fabric to sell

loans.name: Chilimicenco

texts.en:
This client has grown and sold potatoes for 17 years. With her family, she cultivates of 1.62 hecaters of arable land. The loan will be used for digging a well to irrigate the potatoes. The practice of 17 years of client activity has proven that this business is profitable. There are competitors in the market, but sales are still going well. The monthly net income in the business season is about 5000-6000 Moldovan Leu. The profit from the business is directed towards strengthening the business.

This client has taken a loan from Microinvest in the past.

loans.use: Dig a well

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Lợi  57 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002.  Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ thu nhập của gia đình Lợi chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi và làm ruộng. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ nhờ có vốn vay gia đình chị đã  đầu tư làm vườn trồng rau màu vì thế kinh tế gia đình phát triển hơn với thu  nhập 3.500.000đ/ .Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 13.000.000đ để đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại và mua trâu về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L. is 57 years old. She has participated in TYM Fund since 2002. Before joining the Fund, her family's main income sources were from raising livestock and growing rice. After joining the fund, with the loan received, her family changed to grow vegetables and therefore the family's economic situation has improved with an income of VND3,500,000.

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND13,000,000 to renovate the barns and buy buffaloes to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovate the barns and buy buffaloes to raise

loans.name: Rocío Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Rocío del Pilar A. S. tiene 38 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Jesús Nazareno del distrito de Agallpampa en la provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió primaria completa y no continuo estudiando porque quería trabajar y ver surgir a su familia.
Se casó a los 16 años y tiene 4 hijos los cuales son aun estudiantes.
Su negocio consiste en la compra venta de animales los que vuelve a vender en pie.
Su primer crédito fue de 300 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas y lo invirtió en compra de animales.
Con este crédito de 500 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas invertirá en la compra de animales.
Rocío sueña con ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Rocío del Pilar A. S. is 38 years old and belongs to the Jesús Nazareno Communal Bank of the Agallpampa district in the province of the Otuzco, department of La Libertad, Perú. She completed primary school and did not continue studying because she wanted to work to help her family. She got married at 16 years of age and has 4 children who are still students. Her business consists of the purchase and sale of animals which she returns to sell in an ambulatory way. Her first loan of 300 soles was paid back in 4 installments and she invested it in the purchase of animals. With this loan of 500 soles that will be re-paid in 4 installments she will invest in the purchase of animals. Rocio dreams of seeing her children as professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more animals for her business.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena B. is fifty-five years old. She is a widowed mother of four children, a girl and three boys. She says some of her children have completed senior high school and are hoping to continue while others are in junior high and primary school.

Abena lost her husband some years ago. She lives with the children in a rented apartment in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Berekum is a busy business centre which is about twenty-five minutes' drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Abena works very hard to meet the demands of the family, and most importantly, the children’s school fees. She sells cereals such as beans, maize, etc. Abena buys her goods all the way from Techiman and sometimes directly from the farmers in the surrounding villages to beat the high cost. She sells in the local market, mostly to food vendors. Abena has been in business for over thirty years and is full of experience. She says it is necessary to be in business to make some income to support her children in school. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure bags of cereals in bulk.

loans.use: To procure cereals

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita P. is a resident of South Western Poblacion, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has children. Her husband is presently working in Malaysia. She is engaged in the buying and selling of ready-to-wear clothing.

She was one of the pioneering members of Paglaum MPC, a Kiva partner, under the microfinance program. She is an active member of Morning Glory Center credit services and her highest loan was Php 10,000.00, which she used as additional capital for buying assorted dry goods. They were challenged with financial difficulties. Her business was affected and they had no other source of income aside from her business.

But despite those challenges, she’s trying to move on in order to recover. She’s now on her fourth loan amounting to Php 10,0000.00 to purchase additional items like t-shirts, shorts, pants, curtains, pillows and many other items. She is very thankful to Paglaum for giving her another chance.

Her hope and aspiration in life is to expand and have a stable business someday, and that all her children are able to finish their studies and have a decent living for their families.

loans.use: Purchase t-shirts, shorts, pants, curtains, pillows and many other items

loans.name: Kuoh Julius

texts.en:
Julius is married with three children and lives in Belo, Cameroon. Julius has been running a tailoring business for some time now. He purchases many pants and tailors them to his customers' specifications. With this loan, Julius would like to buy 40 pairs of pants, some thread for sewing, and buttons.

This is Julius's second loan from GHAPE since he became a beneficiary in 2007. He did well enough with his first loan that he can now take out a much larger loan. With the last loan he was able to increase his business capital, and now he looks to do the same with this loan. Julius has a variety of customers ranging from school children to his adult neighbors, and believes he does so well because he is a unique suit specialist in his area.

Julius notes that he sews uniforms for Mjangi groups in his community. Theses groups exist to provide financial services to their members. They meet regularly and everyone contributes dues to the group. At each meeting a different person will receive the group's dues, a variation of micro-finance. Julius caters to these groups who often purchase uniforms from him.

With the profits from this loan, Julius will help pay his children's school fees. He also plans to put away money for medical emergencies. He will also use part of his profits to put back into his business, as he did this with his last loan. Julius takes out GHAPE loans because of the favorable loan conditions and he appreciates the business guidance they provide.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: buying trousers, thread and buttons

loans.name: Abdumutalib

texts.ru: Хабибуллоев Абдумуталлиб-мужчина 20 лет. Абдумуталиб с юности помогал отцу ухаживать за домашнем скотом. Абдумуталлиб узнал о нашей программе кредитования и решил кредитоваться. Он занимается откормом и продажей скота со своим дядей который является мясником который имеет мясной ларек в джамоате Костакоз Б.Гафуровского района. На полученный займ он хочет построит коровник и купить оптом жмых с Зафарабадского района.
texts.en:
Abdumutalib H. is a 20 year old man. Abdumutalib has been helping his father to take care of livestock since his youth. Abdumutalib found out about our credit program and decided to become a borrower. He fattens and sells livestock with his uncle who is a butcher and has a meat shop in Kostakoz village in the Gafurov region. He would like to use the loan to build a cow shed and to purchase oil cake in wholesale quantity from the Zafarabadsk region.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build cow shed

loans.name: Ndipona

texts.en:
Ndipona owns a small cafe in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya but currently earns very little monthly profit. Each day she works at her business for twelve hours. She belongs to Nzovwe X group loan (Group code 2021).

Ndipona is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Ndipona is 30 years old, married, and has three children: ages 13, 10 and 6. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Leena Auma

texts.en:
Leena is a 26-year-old woman married to a matatu (a share taxi) driver. They do not have children. Leena runs a video show and sells cereals like maize and beans. She shows Christian movies in a small shop, charging 5 shillings each. The programs usually last one hour.

Leena hopes to use the loan to improve her business by buying a fan for the video shop and a fridge for sodas and water. She says she is not facing any big challenges right now. In her free time, she likes to read storybooks and watch movies. Leena heard about K-MET from her friends.

In this video, you can hear me greet Leena saying "Idhi Nade", which is Luo for "How are you?" Leena responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "thank you" and "Erokamano", which in Luo means "thank you." The voices you hear in the background are people coming for a weekly K-MET borrower meeting. To see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post. K-MET, the NGO distributing the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional MFI. Rather, it is a development corporation focused on raising health standards in Kenya. You can read more about K-MET’s work here.

loans.use: To buy a fan and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle R. is from Oroquieta City. She is 24 years old, married and has one small child. To make a living, Michelle owns and operates a sari-sari store selling a variety of different products in her community. Michelle has been in this business for over one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Michelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from PMPC. Michelle is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Mubashira Nadeem Zahid Group

texts.en:
Mubashira baji, wife of N. Z., has lived in the city of Lahore, Pakistan, for the past eighteen years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods.

Mubashira baji is a very active lady and runs a food-selling business. She prepares food items such as potato cutlet and vegetable rolls and sells them in the community. Her food items are very popular with people. She does this work to pay off the utilities of her house.

Mubashira baji’s husband runs a beauty salon in the community and has been in this business for the past five years. His salon is famous for its variety of haircuts and hairstyles. Mubashira baji is applying for a loan to buy items (scissors, creams and hair gels) for her husband’s beauty salon.

In the photo, Mubashira baji is standing in the middle of the group showing her food items.

This loan also consists of two additional people: 
 
Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell.

Anwar baji wants a loan to buy rice to sell.

loans.use: To buy materials for her husband's beauty salon

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane F. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 33 years old. Jane is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jane owns & operates a sari-sari store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jane has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Jane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Jane is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Jane from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
César es un padre de familia que vive con sus padres, su esposa y sus hijos de 3 y 4 años de edad en el caserío La Garita, un sector ubicado en la carretera Pimentel – Chiclayo, a 15 minutos de la ciudad.

Se ha dedicado a la agricultura durante casi toda su vida y de esta labor dependen no sólo el sustento de su esposa y de sus menores hijos sino también el de sus padres, los cuales son de edades muy avanzadas y están bajo su responsabilidad desde hace algunos años.

El ha sembrado una hectárea de camote en el terreno que poseen cerca a su casa, pero no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para seguir solventando los gastos de mantenimiento de su cultivo por lo que ha solicitado un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de fertilizantes y foliares para mantener su cultivo y obtener una buena cosecha.

César desea seguir sustentando a su familia y también brindarle a sus padres una buena calidad de vida es por eso que trabaja arduamente en su parcela, ya ha solicitado anteriormente un préstamo a nuestra Institución y lo ha cancelado puntualmente por lo que es considerado un cliente responsable.
texts.en:
César and his family live with his parents. He and his wife have 2 children, ages 3 and 4. They live in the village of La Garita, a sector located along the road between Pimentel and Chiclayo; it is 15 minutes from the city. He has worked in agriculture almost all his life and depends on this work to support not only his wife and young children but also his parents, who are elderly and have been dependent on him since a few years ago. César has sowed a hectare of sweet potato on the land he owns near his house, but doesn't have sufficient resources to cover the costs of maintaining his crop. For these costs he has requested a loan of 3,000 PEN to cover maintenance expenses and obtain a better harvest. César hopes to keep supporting his family and also to provide a better quality of life for his parents. That's why he works so hard on his land. He has already had a loan with our institution and repaid it punctually, so he is considered a responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and topsoil to maintain sweet potato.

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es: Dalila E. vive en Tonacatepeque municipio dentro del departamento de San Salvador. Desde hace 10 años maneja una venta de zapatos dentro de un centro comercial. Dalila nunca estudió, pues nunca tuvo las posibilidades económicas para hacerlo, pero este obstáculo nunca ha podido detenerla, y siempre ha buscado la forma de crecer y avanzar en la vida. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería para su zapatería y así ampliar la variedad de productos que en ella ofrece.
texts.en:
Dalila E. lives in the Tonacatepeque municipality within the San Salvador department. For ten years she has managed a shoe sales place in a commercial center. Dalila never went to school; she never had the economic possibility of doing so. But, this obstacle never stopped her. She has always looked for the way to grow and advance in her life. She is currently asking for a loan to buy new merchandise for her shoe store. This way she will increase the variety of products that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
C., 28, (who was not available for photographing) is a long-term business woman. She is married and has given birth to three school-aged children. Her husband is shown in the photograph.

Before C. had children, she used to sell a few cooking supplies from her home. In the past, she used her little capital to build a mall store, which is where she now sells her items. She currently relies on part of her husband’s income from his work as an electrician.

C. hopes to improve and enlarge on her investment by using a Kiva loan to accumulate a quantity of grocery inventory to resell for additional profits.

loans.use: To accumulate a quantity of grocery inventory to resell.

loans.name: Dorjsuren

texts.en: Dorjsuren is 48 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Arkhangai province of Mongolia. The family all lives together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  His three youngest children attend high school while his wife cares for the family’s livestock herd. Dorjsuren operates a mobile dairy trading business which sells the dairy products his wife prepares to local markets.  He started this business in 1990 with working capital of 50,000 tugrug (~35 USD) which has since reached 700,000 tugrug (~490 USD). In the 19 years of running his business, Dorjsuren has gained a reputation amongst his customers as a reliable supplier of quality dairy products. He has also been able to gain a lot of business knowledge and experience in this long period of time. Dorjsuren is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan to purchase more dairy supplies in order to increase his sales.

loans.use: to purchase more dairy supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his grocery store and buy more and new products

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is a thirty-two-year-old married mother of five children, who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming-dominated community in the Western Region of Ghana. Most of the dwellers practice farming alongside other trading activities.

Matilda is a trader. She runs a cold store in her community. She sells fresh fish and all kinds of meat. Matilda says she also supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys the goods from big cold stores in nearby towns. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish and meat in bulk

loans.name: Amgalan

texts.en:
B. Amgalan is 42 years old and lives with her husband and 17-year-old-son in Arkhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a "ger". Her son currently attends a local secondary school. Amgalan operates a consumer goods trading business at a local trading center in her town with the help of her husband. Her husband also operates a taxi service in the evenings to supplement their income. Amgalan started her business in 2007 with working capital of 500,000 tugrugs (approximately 350 USD). She has quickly grown her business over the last two years and has built a strong customer base. Today, her working capital exceeds 1,500,000 tugrugs (approximately 1050 USD). Amgalan hopes to build on her experience in the future and says, "I want to expand my business and have my own shop." She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (approximately 700 USD) loan to import clothes from China to sell in her business. 

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To import clothes from China

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La señora Olga es socia del Banco Comunal “Lupakas” desD. hace 2 años atrás, del distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 46 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Estudió primaria incompleta y se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado.
Olga nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo comprar ovejas.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar una vaca.
Su sueño para el futuro es comprar una casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Olga has been a member of the Lupakas Community Bank for two years in the District of Plicuyo, Province of Collao, Department of Puno. She is 46 years old, married, and has three children. She attended but did not complete primary school and now works buying and selling livestock. Olga tells us that with her first loan of 500 PEN from Movement Manuela Ramos she was able to buy sheep. She will request a loan of 1,500 PEN with which she will be able to buy a cow. Her dream for the future is to buy a house and that her children have good jobs. What she likes most about her Community Bank is the savings plan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Adelayda

texts.es: Adelayda tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y junto a su pareja tienen 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica de ella es una pulpería Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica. Todo inicio porque ella decidió establecer una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda y ofrecer los granos básicos a sus vecinos y demás clientes, pero necesitaba más financiamiento por lo que acudió a Fundación León 2000 y fue así como logro salir adelante con su negocio. El motivo del financiamiento es para la inversión de productos en su pulpería. Ella sueña con incrementar su negocio para mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Adelayda is 38 years old, is married and she and her husband have two children they support. For more than 15 years now, she's been running a grocery store. This grocery store is run out of her home and she sells basic grains and products to her neighbors and other customers. Recently, she needed additional funding and reached out to the Leon Foundation with the idea that this loan would help in the success of her business. Adelayda dreams of growing her business and improving her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo (working capital for her business)

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng S. lives in Phngeas village, Takeo province. She is a grocer, selling in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to sell. 

Her husband, Mr. Ngeng Nhaon, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice. Mrs. Heng S. is the mother of two children, one of whom is a farmer and the other is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Jumabubu's Group

texts.en:
In Kyrgyzstan, not far from its capital, there is a town which is named Kara – Balta. The citizens of this town are hardworking people and most of them have their own livestock and work in the fields. One of these citizens is Jumabubu O. a sixty-one-year-old widow who brought up five children: three of them are daughters and two are sons and now all live separately with their husbands and wives. Jumabubu’s husband was also hardworking and they bought a cow with their savings. Later on they sold it and bought two cows with the proceeds. Unfortunately, as life is an unpredictable thing, her husband died from a heart attack, leaving all his children and the little farm on Jumabubu’s brittle shoulders. Nowadays, Jumabubu is a caring grandmother who has her little farm. She does animal husbandry and sells milk and also rears cattle. She has expanded her livestock and has already married off her children. Now she wants to marry off her grandchildren as well. Thirty years ago, nobody thought that this family, with 15,000 soms ($340) in their pocket, would succeed one day, especially after their grief, but they did. Now her profit is 11,500 soms ($262). Jumabubu wants to obtain a loan to buy ten sheep to raise and sell. Gulnara S. is forty and is married with four children: two sons and two daughters. Her elder children attend the local school and the younger one is a preschooler. She wants to give a high level of education to her children and to buy a big house as well. Her husband transports passengers. Now, Gulnara sells milk and breeds cattle. Everything started with 10,000 soms ($228) which they got from selling their harvest and which they used to buy a cow. Now they already bought a car, a tractor and have increased their head of livestock. With the loan they will buy a heifer to raise. Kuldjamilya K. is a fifty-four-year-old widow who has three daughters and a son. Her elder daughters are married and live separately; her younger daughter works in the shop and her son is busy about the house. Her children already received an education. Kuldjamilya is a seamstress, making national garments. About forty years ago for cost of about 5,000 soms ($114) she and her husband bought a heifer. Now, from selling milk and other items, they earn 2,100 soms ($43) per month. They are planning to increase their head of livestock and to build a barn and a fence. The loan will be used to buy a heifer to raise. Arsygulbek M. is a married man at the age of forty nine. He has five children to whom he wants to give a good education and he also wants to buy a house. Three of his children are sons and two are daughters. His spouse is a housewife. His elder daughter is married, the second one works in the garment factory, his son is busy about the house and the youngest ones go to the local school. Arsygulbek’s wife and son always help and encourage him. They sell milk and look after cattle while he works as a taxi driver. A few years ago they bought a cow for 12,000 ($273) and thus they started their business. Now their profit is 8,400 soms ($190) per month. Arsygulbek wants to obtain a loan to increase the total number of their cattle. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy ten sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: Fausta

texts.es: Fausta, tiene 73 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos que ya son independientes. Fausta forma parte del banco comunal “Sol D. Oro” D. la Asociación Arariwa. Fausta tiene una cabina D. Internet, ella contrato un joven para la atención D. la cabina. Ya son 3 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Fausta es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora requiere el crédito para comprar  3 computadoras. Fausta se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Fausta is 73 years old, married with five adult children. Fausta is a member of the “Sol D. Oro” (Golden Sun) communal bank, of the Arariwa Association. She has a cyber café and hired a young man to run it for her. She has been doing this for three years and she has been doing well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Fausta is a hard working and enterprising woman who needs a loan to buy three computers. She is thankful for the opportunity provided by this medium and she promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Computers

loans.name: Abdel-Kader

texts.en:
Abdel-Kader, a married man, 56 years old, has owned an auto repair shop in his town since 2000 and has a previous twenty-six years of experience in this occupation. He is the only provider for his wife and his six school-age children. With this big family, he has to work hard and on an extra time basis to satisfy their needs.

Abdel-Kader has great demand in his shop. Thus, he wants to take a loan of $1,200 to buy additional spare parts to offer good service to his customers.

loans.use: To buy additional spare parts

loans.name: Rachidatou

texts.fr: Née en 1970 à Djigbé dans le département de l'Ouémé au Bénin où elle vit depuis sa naissance, A. Rachidatou est mariée à GLOGJINON Thomas, un chauffeur. Le couple a cinq enfants, mais trois sont à leurs charges. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Rachidatou vient en aide à son mari et assure avec elle les différentes charges de la famille. Rachidatou n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Rachidatou fabrique et vend des gâteaux (faits à base de manioc et d'huile de palme) à son domicile. Rachidatou s'approvisionne à Hozin dans l'Ouémé au Bénin. Rachidatou exerce cette activité depuis 10 ans et a déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé. Rachidatou  a bien remboursé les crédits. Rachidatou voudrait augmenter le volume de son activité et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. C'est donc pour renforcer son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle que Rachidatou sollicite un troisième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Djibé in the Ouémé region of Bénin where she has lived since birth, Rachidatou A. is married to Thomas Glogjinon, a chauffeur. The couple has five children, three of whom are now under their care. Some of their children went to school. Rachidatou helps her husband and takes on different family responsibilities. Rachidatou never went to school. To meet her and her children's needs, Rachidatou makes and sells cakes (made from a cassava and palm oil base) from her home. She stocks up on supplies in Hozin in Ouémé, Bénin. Rachidatou has done this work for ten years and has already received two loans from ALIDé. She repaid these loans in full. Rachidatou would like to increase her amount of work and her sales. Rachidatou is thus asking for a third loan from ALIDé in order to strengthen her business and better satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cassava and palm oil

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is 31 years old and married with one child. He runs an electronics shop to earn a living. He had previous employment before he started this business. He has been in business for three years and has great plans for the future. He plans to grow his business and start his own company. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to buy a drilling machine. He describes himself as hardworking and honest. 
The photo has been taken in the office.

loans.use: To purchase a drilling machine

loans.name: Babunga's Group

texts.fr:
Mangaza K. est présidente du groupe de crédit  Baraka-Alanine, elle lève sa main sur la photo,devant le portail rouge,  cliente au 16e cycle, âgée de 36 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants parmi lesquels 4 étudient, 2 autres enfants n’étudient pas car ils n’ont pas encore l’âge scolaire. Son mari est petit commerçant des Planches (bois).
Mangaza K. s’entraide avec son mari dans le business de vente des planches. Elle  a commencé son petit commerce  avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Son capital initial était de 50$ . Son business est de vendre les planches au long de la route Katindo, point d’arrêt  Afia bora. Il y a 12 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité de vente des  planches. Avant de  s’installer dans la ville de Goma, Mangaza K. vendait de la bière à Kalehe, village situé dans le sud Kivu, à 180 km près de la ville de Goma. 
Avec  le crédit  de  l’IMF Hekima, Riziki Chahi souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant  50 planches de 250$.
Dans l’avenir, elle planifie de changer  l’activité et faire le commerce général, étant donné que le service public  de l’environnement et conservation de la nature a pris des mesures pénales à la coupe de bois et demande  beaucoup de taxe dans ce secteur pour le décourager à détruire l’environnement. 
Mangaza K. préférait  augmenter auprès de l’IMF Hekima ses epargnes. Elle ambitionne entrer dans le groupe solidaire qui offre plus des avantages opérationnels que la banque communautaire dont elle fait membre. En outre, elle compte  construire confortablement sa maison.
Mangaza K. remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grâce à ces crédits, elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. 
Ce groupe Neema est  composé de 18 membres majoritairement femmes.
texts.en:
Mangaza K. is the president of the loan group Baraka-Alanine. She is the one with her hand raised, in front of the red door. On her 16th loan, she is 36 years old, married and the mother six children, four of whom attend school. The other two children are not old enough to attend school yet. Her husband is a businessman who deals in lumber. Mangaza K. helps her husband in the lumber business. She began her small business with her own money that she received from her husband. Her starting capital was $50. Her business was to sell boards along the Katindo road at Afia Bora. She has been selling lumber for 12 years. Before settling in the town of Goma, Mangaza K. sold beer in Kalehe, a village located in the south of Kivu, 180 km from the town of Goma. With her loan from the IMF Hekima, Riziki Chahi hopes to increase her turnover by buying 50 boards at $250. In the future, she plans to change to general commerce, given the fact that public environmental and conservation services have taken measures to control the cutting of wood and imposed high taxes to discourage destruction of the environment. Mangaza K. prefers to increase her savings through the IMF Hekima. Her ambition is to join the group which offers more operational advantages than the community bank of which she is a member. In addition, she hopes to do some work to her house to make it more comfortable. Mangaza K. thanks the IMF Hekima for the loans she had received without any material backing because, thanks to these loans, she is able to meet the needs of her children. The group Neema has 18 members, most of whom are women.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 50 boards

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To develop her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying manure and other farm supplies

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim D. is 52 years old and is the leader of this group loan, having been selected by its four members, who live in Lekh n Bei village in Kandal province. Mrs. Kim D. and her co-members of this group loan will each use their share to support their different purposes.
 
Mrs. Kim D. and her husband, Mr. Pov Chroeng, are farmers who rent some land to grow crops. For this farm, Mrs. Kim D. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and other farm supplies to support her crops.

This couple has four children; three are seamstresses in a garment factory while the last one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and other farm supplies

loans.name: Kossiwa Dodo

texts.fr:
D. kossiwa a 40 ans  et reste encore très dynamique. Elle est mariée et a un enfant. Elle tient une boutique de vente de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle y vend différents produits tels que savon de Marseille, sacs de riz, boites de conserves, de lait.
Avec le prêt demandé, elle envisage acheter des cartons de savons, de sardines et de beurre pour soutenir les besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Kossiwa D. is 40 years old and remains very energetic She's married and has one child. She runs a shop were she sells food staples and other products, such as Marseille soaps, sacks of rice, canned food, and milk. She intends to use the loan she's seeking to buy boxes of soaps, sardines, and butter, to meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of soaps, sardines, and butter

loans.name: Violetas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "Violetas 1", decidieron ponerle este nombre por que así se llama la nieta de la señora en donde hacen las reuniones, esta historia es acerca de la señora Virginia Inés R. M. ella es la representante del grupo, tiene 52 años es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 ya están casados, y el menor tiene 17 años y estudia el bachillerato. La señora Virginia Inés se dedica a la venta de dulces y vende en la escuela primaria que esta cerca de su casa y también en su propio domicilio.
 
Ella eligió esta actividad ya que como es madre soltera tenia que buscar la forma de sacar a sus hijos adelante y fue por eso que decidió empezar con este pequeño negocio y con el préstamo que recibió va a invertir en otro pequeño negocio, en la venta de antojitos y tiene que comprar los ingredientes necesarios para su preparación como son: tomate, variedad de chiles, cebolla, ajos, sal, papas, zanahorias, etc.
 
Su negocio le esta sirviendo de mucho, ya que de las ganancias obtenidas, esta saliendo para comprar los útiles escolares, uniforme y zapatos de su hijo, también algunos artículos de uso personal .su tienda beneficia mucho a los niños de la escuela por que asi no tienen que salir de la institución, para comprar lo que buscan y no corren ningún peligro, ya que también ella vende sus golosinas a un buen precio
 
La señora Virginia nos comenta que su propósito es que en un futuro su negocio crezca empresarialmente, para con ello poder solventar los gastos de la educación superior de su hijo, ya que quiere que siga estudiando para que tenga una carrera y una muy buena profesión.
 
Ella conoce muy bien a sus compañeras y nos comenta que son personas responsables, gente trabajadora, confiable y que quiere salir adelante y superarse
Da las gracias a los prestatarios de kiva, por darle la oportunidad y confianza, pero sobre todo por creer en ella puesto que gracias a su ayuda pudo invertir en su negocio y asi tener un mejor futuro.
 
Las otras integrantes de este grupo y actividades que realizan son:
Ana María Ariza M.-repostería
Cristina virginia G.-cafetería
Alma Rosa Téllez R.-librería
Inés Lourdes A. R.-dulcería
Mayran Nallely E. C.-librería
Lissie Lucely E. C.-perfumería
Marina C. Méndez-antojitos
Sofía O. L.-electrónica
Zulma R. Rodríguez-deposito de refrescos
texts.en:
This group is called “Violetas 1” (Violets I). They decided to name it thus because that’s the name of the granddaughter of the lady whose house they have their meetings in. This story is about Virginia Inés R. M. who is the group representative. She is 52 years old, a single mother of three children two of whom are already married. The youngest is 17 and in high school. Virginia Inés is a candy vendor at an elementary school near her house and she also sells candy at her house. She chose this activity because being a single mother she had to find a way to support her children so she began with this small business. The loan she got allowed her to invest in another small business: fast food sales. Now, she has to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare them like: tomatoes, assorted chilies, onion, garlic, salt, potatoes, carrots, etc. Her business is being very useful because she’s using the profits earned to buy school supplies, school uniforms and shoes for her son as well as some personal use items. Her store is of great benefit to the children in the school because they don’t have to go outside the school yard to buy what they need so they are protected from any danger besides she sells them her sweets at a very good price. Virginia tells us that her goal for the future is that her business grow so that she can earn enough to pay for her son’s higher education because she wants him to continue going to school so that he will have a career and a very good profession. She knows her fellow group members very well and tells us that they are all responsible, hard working, trustworthy people who want to improve themselves and get ahead in life. She is thankful for the help from Kiva, for the trust they have placed in her and for the opportunity she has been given but most of all for believing in her because thanks to the help she got she was able to invest in her business and thus have a better future. The other group members and their activities are: Ana María Ariza M.-pastries Cristina virginia G.-cafeteria Alma Rosa Téllez R.-bookstore Inés Lourdes A. R.-candy shop Mayran Nallely E. C.-bookstore Lissie Lucely E. C.-perfume shop Marina C. Méndez-snacks Sofía O. L.-electronics Zulma R. Rodríguez-soft drink warehouse

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, assorted chilies, onion, garlic, salt, potatoes, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Malo

texts.en:
Malo T. is 48 years old and married with ten children between the ages of 9 and 30.  She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has four years of experience in this business. 

Malo needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be about $125 per week) to improve the business.

In 2006, Malo joined SPBD and this is her 7th loan with them.  SPBD's loans are Malo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD:

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD, and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas N. is 45 years old and is married to Rose Nthiga who supports his income. They have seven dependents.

Nicholas operates greengrocery in Kongowea, Mombasa, where most of his customers can easily receive his services. He has been in this business for the last year.

Nicholas hopes to purchase more stock of green vegetables for his greengrocery and to open up other grocery shops in potential areas with the anticipated profit. In future he hopes to be a potential supplier of greengrocery items all over the country.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of green vegetables for his store

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en: Mrs. Oeun P. is a 48-year-old married woman and a villager. She lives in a medium-sized home with family members in Phnom Penh. She owns a piece of farmland that she uses to grow different kinds of crops. She is married with five children. Her husband works on the farm with her. Two of Oeun P.’s children are married and have started new households, while the other three are single. Presently, Oeun P. works on the farm, which is located far from her house. She does not have a vehicle to travel to the farm fields. To solve this problem, Oeun P. decided to borrow a loan in the amount of 500 USD to purchase a secondhand motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorcycle

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a housewife and mother of two sons and three daughters, she started a small poultry farm in the backyard of her house seven months ago. Siham raises chicks and sells them to shops when they become mature chickens. 

Siham is responsible for the whole family as all her kids are very young and not able to work yet, therefore she came to FATEN and took a $800 loan to purchase a bigger number of chicks and prepare them for sale to shops.

Siham sells also to her neighbors as there's no chicken shop in the area which ensures a stable income for the family.
Siham appears in the picture in her small farm.

loans.use: Increase the number of chicks

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia V. is from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela, Philippines. She is 55 years old. Nelia is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Nelia owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making glutinous rice cakes, ice cold snack (mixed fruits with milk & sugar) and other delicacies for sale. Nelia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Nelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Nelia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Nelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Working capital for food business

loans.name: Brayan Josue

texts.es:
Brayan es un comerciante de ropa y empleado de una funeraria, tiene 22 años y reside en el departamento de San Miguel; Él vive con su esposa y su hija de 6 años. Comercializa ropa con la ayuda de su esposa los fines de semana y durante los días lunes a viernes trabaja en una funeraria en el área de ventas desde hace ya vario tiempo.
El solita un préstamo pues se ve en la necesidad de adquirir más ropa para la venta, por lo que este préstamo le servirá para hacer la inversión y contar con mas prendas de vestir para ofrecer a los clientes quienes siempre buscan nuevos estilos y colores de moda, satisfaciendo así la demanda y la preferencia de estos.
Los objetivos de Brayan son contar con un negocio estable y propio, que le genere los ingresos necesarios para dar a su familia una mejor vida con las condiciones adecuadas para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Brayan is a clothing merchant and a funeral parlor employee. He is 22 years old and lives in the department of San Miguel. He lives with his wife and 6 year old daughter. He sells clothing with the help of his wife on weekends. Monday through Friday he works in a funeral parlor in the area of sales. He has done this for some time.  

He is asking for a loan because he sees the need to acquire more clothing. This loan will be used for investment and to have more clothing items to offer his customers because they are always looking for new styles and colors and he wants to satisfy their demand and preference.   

Brayan's objectives are having his own stable business that makes enough income to give his family a better life with the adequate conditions for their development.

loans.use: Buying clothes

loans.name: Dolores De La Concepción

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	La Señora Dolores de la Concepción C. L., inicia realizando la compra en el mercado la terminal desde 6 am, luego se traslada a su puesto de venta   a ofertar sus productos.

Este crédito fue utilizado para compra de Frutas, Golosinas, y Cigarros

La Señora C. L., con los créditos que le ha brindado CEPRODEL  se siente muy conforme por que ha logrado a incrementar su negocio y así ha  mejorado su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Dolores de la Concepción C. L. starts at 6 a.m., making purchases at the "La Terminal" market.  Then, she goes to her stand where she sells her products.

She will use this loan to purchase fruit, candy, and cigarettes.

Thanks to previous loans offered by CEPRODEL, Ms. C. L. feels very satisfied because she has been able to grow her business and therefore has improved her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruit, candy, and cigarettes

loans.name: Aasia's Group

texts.en:
Aasia lives in a small city in the Punjab province of Pakistan, called Khanewal. She shares a two-room brick house in the Christian Colony area with her husband and five children. She shifted here after her marriage. 
Her husband's name is J. N., and he has a bicycle repair business. His shop is located in the market and he has a good number of clients who prefer his services because of the quality of his work.  
Aasia (who is holding the loan book in the photo) supports her family by doing sewing at her home. She receives regular orders from her neighborhood clients, and produces quality work. She is also a housewife and does her household responsibilities very well.  
Three of her five children are enrolled in school and are getting their education. The other two are too young for school.  
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy the latest repairing tools to offer better quality services to his clients. 
Aasia is hopeful that after investing the loan, her husband’s business will grow further and his income will be increased.  
This is her second loan application to Asasah. During the period of the previous loan, she always paid her instalments on time and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: To buy latest repairing tools for bicycle repairing business

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia, de 23 años de edad, reside en la ciudad de San Miguel, vive con su esposo llamado Mateo de 38 años de edad, sus cuatro hijos Graciela, Alejandro, Alexander, Alonso; desde que se casaron  venden frutas y verduras en los municipios cercanos, en su vehículo, recorriendo casi toda la zona oriental,  de esta manera ellos logran vender sus verduras y proveer para sus hijos la alimentación.
En este momento el vehículo donde se transportan a realizar las ventas está dañado por lo que solicitan un préstamo para llevarlo al mecánico para que lo repare, con esta ayuda contaran con el vehículo en buenas condiciones para seguir su rutina diaria por los diferentes pueblos que visitan, evitando posibles accidentes.
Su objetivo es seguir conquistando clientes, tener un negocio prospero para tener estabilidad económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia, 23 years old, lives in San Miguel city with her 38 year old husband Mateo, her four children Graciela, Alejandro, Alexander, and Alonso. Since they married they have sold fruit and vegetables in nearby villages, traveling all over the western region in their vehicle. In this way they are able to sell their vegetables and provide a home for their children.

At the moment the vehicle they use to make their sales is in need of repair so they are seeking a loan to take it to the mechanic so it can be repaired. With this help they will be able to depend on a vehicle in good condition to continue their daily routine to different villages they visit, avoiding possible accidents.

Her goal is to continue gaining customers and have a prosperous business in order to have economic stability for her family.

loans.use: Vehicle repair in order to make sales

loans.name: Soledad Fabiola

texts.es:
La Señora. Soledad T. es socia del banco comunal Las Caleras, vive por el sector que tiene el mismo nombre del banco comunal en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de su centro histórico, sus iglesias, su gran variedad en la gastronomía y su gente que conserva su cultura y tradiciones.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y  tiene 1 hijo de 6 años y  un bebe de 11 meses de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es pintor de casas, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven cuidando la casa comunal del sector.
 
Doña Soledad se dedica a la venta de chuzos (carne en palito), actividad que la desempeña hace 2 años, empieza la preparación de su producto desde las 6 de la mañana y vende desde las 4 de la tarde hasta las 10 de la noche, sale a vender su producto en la vereda de la calle de lunes a sábados.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito y fue su vecina quien la invito a formar parte del  banco comunal, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de carne, aceite, carbón, etc.  para continuar con su negocio. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Soledad T. is a member of the Las Caleras communal bank. She lives in the Las Caleras neighbourhood in the city of Cuenca, renowned for its beautiful historic centre, its churches, its diverse cuisine and its people, who maintain their culture and traditions. 
 
She is 26 years old, married with a 6 year old son and an 11 month old baby. Her eldest goes to school in the city. Her husband is a painter-decorator. They don´t own a house so they live in a communal house in the neighbourhood, which they look after. 

Soledad sells chuzos (meat skewers). She has been doing this for 2 years. She starts preparing the products at 6am in the morning and sells them from 4pm to 10pm. She sells her products in the street sidewalks from Monday through Saturday. 

This is her second loan. Her neighbour invited her to join the communal bank. She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of meat, oil, coal, etc to continue with her business. Her dream is to own her own house.

loans.use: Buy meat, oil, coal, etc.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua S. is a single parent with three children. She has received no formal education. Ekua buys bags of rice and boxes of other items, such as canned tomatoes, and sells them to customers in smaller, more affordable quantities at Ankaful near Abura. She has been doing this for eight years. Ekua uses her income to pay school fees and other expenses of her children. She will use the loan to purchase more food stuffs for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more food stuffs for resale.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina, de 46 años, es viuda, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 6 queridos hijos.
Los verdes campos del poblado del distrito de Samugari, ubicado en la selva ayacuchana, han sido, en la vida de Faustina, un lugar muy agradable para trabajar y vivir, pues desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a labrar la tierra. Con el apoyo de su esposo, ahora fallecido, compraron sus propias tierras donde sembraron hoja de coca, café y cacao. Pero desde que su amado esposo falleció, ella se ha convertido en el pilar de su casa y clave en el destino de sus hijos, es por ello que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que su arduo trabajo tuvo frutos, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, que es el lugar donde vende, además el servicio de transporte de sus productos es muy caro. Con el tiempo, Faustina espera juntar el dinero suficiente para comprar nuevas tierras.

Este es el 15avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal siempre está al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan sus compañeros para el bienestar común.
Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas para su parcela.
texts.en:
Faustina is 46 years old, widowed and lives in her own home with her 6 dear children. The green fields of one village of Samugari, located in the Ayacuchana jungle, have been, for Faustina, a very pleasant place to work and live. With the support of her husband, now deceased, they bought their own land to plant coca, coffee and cocoa.  But since her beloved husband died, she has become the pillar of the house key to the fate of their children, which is why she works with great dedication and sacrifice. 

What she likes best about her job is to harvest the land, since she feels this arduous work is the fruits of her labor.  She has been doing this for 20 years and the hardest part is transporting her crops to the city of San Francisco, where she sells. Also, it is very expensive to transport her products. In time, Faustina is counting on making enough money to buy new land. 
 
This is her 15th loan from MFP and she knows that she is responsible for paying all of her dues on time and is willing to do so. In the community bank she is always aware that the agreements between her and her peers are for the common good.  With the money requested she will buy seeds for her land.

loans.use: Buying seeds

loans.name: Byambanorov

texts.en:
Byambanorov, 37, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her daughter attends a local secondary school and her son goes to kindergarten. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in someone's backyard on the outskirts of the city.

Byambanorov sells meat at a local market, and started her business in 2006. Her business was running successfully until their house burnt down in 2009.  Her family's living standard is now below average because of that unfortunate fire, however they are trying very hard to rebuild their lives. Byambanorov is a very hardworking and active person whose family needs a house on their own land. She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase more meat for her business during the busy time of Tsagaan Sar, the Mongolian traditional New Year.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya, 46, is married and lives with her husband, son and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land on the outskirts of the city. Her daughter studies at a university while both her husband and son work. 

Enhtuya began operating a drugstore in 2002. She rents a room in a private hospital for her pharmacy. She now has an official state certificate for her business which proves that her business is registered  and is allowed to operate legally.  She purchases medicine from large drug producers to sell in her drugstore.  She employs a salesperson and a cleaning person.

Enhtuya is a hardworking and active person who says, "I am planning to enlarge my store and make some improvements, as the drugstores and pharmacies are being examined by the Government strictly". She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to expand her product line and enlarge her drugstore.

loans.use: To expand product line

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
El señor Hilario Rodríguez C. tiene 61 años de edad, casado con la señora Felipa Miranda Ledezma mas de 15 años radican en la comunidad de Primera Candelaria hacia el norte de Colomi hace 23 años atrás, tienen 6 hijos dependientes de diferentes edades que estudian en nivel primaria y secundaria. 
                                                                                                                                                            
El señor Hilario y su esposa se dedican a la producción agrícola a la vez al cuidado de sus animales de ganado vacuno, necesitan un crédito para comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza) y semilla de papa, con el objetivo de ampliar su producción agrícola ya que este año los productos subieron de precio, además por las exigencias económicas para su estudio de sus hijos hasta que salgan bachilleres y profesionales, que tengan un futuro mejor , por lo cual se tubo la iniciativa de ir a la zona y facilitar el presente crédito.                                                                                                                                                                                 
El señor Hilario nos cuenta que acudir a las Entidades Financieras le queda muy lejos a la ciudad de Cochabamba y piden muchos requisitos.
texts.en:
Hilario R. C. is 61 years old and he has been married with Felipa Miranda Ledezma for 15 years. They have lived in the community of Primara Canderlaria for 23 years, located north of Colomi. They have 6 children who are dependents and they are in grade school and in high school. 

Hilario and his wife are agriculturists and they also raise cattle. They need the loan to purchase organic fertilizer (chicken fertilizer) and to purchase potatoes seedlings, with the goal of increasing production. This year the products have become more expensive and to pay for the high school and professional training for his children. He wants to give them a better future and it is the reason for the initiative he took to go the region to request a loan. 

Hilario says that requesting loans from other financial institutions requires him to travel very far, to the city of Cochabamba, and they have a great many requisites.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by rice retailing. Her husband Ricardo, who is 48 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 8 and 24 years old. Grace joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Grace has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to buy more stocks of rice to sell to customers so that she can continue to save up for future improvement and expansion of her business. Grace is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more rice

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Mary K.. She is married and has five children, aged 7, 9, 13, 17 and 23 years. She has 15 additional dependents who live with her -- two are her parents, she helps in educating some and the others help in the business.  

In 2005, Mary established her essential drugs business. She began her business because she wanted to educate children, buy land and help with the upkeep of the home.  

Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 400,000 Sierra Leone Leones (Le) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Mary K. has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy essential drugs and hire a pharmacist. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Mary plans to buy larger quantities to supply to other traders and travel to neighboring Guinea for lower costs. She is very determined. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more essential drugs for her shop

loans.name: Shiella

texts.en:
Shiella A. is from the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 27 years old, married, and has two infant children. To make a living, Shiella owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Shiella has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Shiella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shiella is requesting a loan for 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase services to increase crop yield. This loan will be Shiella's first loan  from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Muhumure

texts.en:
Muhumure S. is an individual client from Ibanda. He is 35 years old, married, and has 4 children. Three of his children are already in school. S. has had a bar business in Bugorobi trading centre for 5 years and he sells mostly sodas, beers, wines, spirits, water and so on. His customers are mostly the surrounding community. He is able to generate 700,000 UGX weekly. In addition, he also sells produce, films with DSTV and bananas from his farm. He owns a boda boda (bicycle taxi) that he hires out for extra income. 

S. is committed to succeed. He is business-oriented and his dream is to be able to own a big bar, to own lodging facilities and to educate his children. S. is a new client and he hopes to improve his business with the loan by buying more inventory for the bar.

loans.use: To buy more liquor and soft drinks for the bar.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mr. Sopheap S. is 38 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sokhan Heng is 37 years old. They live in a village on National Road Number Two, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married for almost 10 years and have two children--one son and one daughter. Both of them are in school. 

Sopheap and his wife are farmers. They grow rice on farmland in the village where they live. Sopheap is asking for his first loan of $300 to add to his own money to purchase a motorized hand tiller. 

Picture: Mr. Sopheap S. is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To add to his own money to purchase a motorized hand tiller.

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en: Chuon, 58, is a village woman living in Kompong Cham Province. Since the beginning of 1980, Chuon has owned a small farm where she and her husband plant potatoes and rice, making $4 profit a day to meet the family’s daily expenses. This couple has four children, two of whom are married and the other two are single. With this loan, Chuon will plant more potatoes which will enable the family to make extra profit to meet their daily expenses.

loans.use: to plant potatoes.

loans.name: Sainte Marie Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sainte Marie est créé le jour de l'inauguration du BV, le 01 juin 2011. Le 30 femmes qui composent ce groupe habitent le même quartier et font toutes du petit commerce.

Madame Anne Marie, à droite de la photo avec la main gauche levée, est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 46 ans, mariée, mère de trois enfants et elle a six autres personnes sous sa charge.

Elle est commerçante depuis plus de dix ans et elle possède une boutique où elle vend divers produits (riz, sucre, huile végétale etc). Elle fait comme seconde activité la restauration.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer sa boutique en marchandises afin de mieux fidéliser sa clientèle.

Avec les bénéfices escomptés, Mme Anne Marie compte faire un agrandissement de sa boutique et dans le but de la transformer en épicerie.
texts.en:
The Sainte Marie group was set up on the day the Banc Villageois was inaugurated, that is 1st June 2011. The 30 women who make up this group live in the same district and all have small trading activities.

Anne-Marie, who is on the right of the photo with her left hand raised, is in charge of the group. She is 46 years old, married and mother to three children; she has six other people in her care.

She has been a trader for more than ten years and has a store where she sells various products (rice, sugar, vegetable oil etc.) She has a second activity which is restauration.

This loan will allow her to build up the stock of goods in her shop in order to gain her customers' loyalty. With the income she makes, Anne Marie is planning to extend her shop with the aim of converting into a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy products to build up her general grocery store

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Aty se formo con la union de varias vecinas de la comunidad de la ciudad de Santaní.
El comité está en el quinto Ciclo con 11  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento de responsabilidad con la institución.
La Sra. digna, desde pequeña se dedica a la cria de animales de granja, es una mujer laboriosa y emprendedora, ella lucha para salir adelante, piensa en darle un mejor futuro a sus familiares por medio de su trabajo.
Solicita el credito para la compra de los balanceados para sus animales, como asi tambien los medicamentos que estos podrian llegar a necesitar. Cree que la ayuda quee podria Brindarle la Fundación Paraguaya le seria de gran ayuda para poder aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The committee Kuña Aty was formed when various residents of the city of Santaní joined together. The committee is in its fifth loan cycle with 11 members. The group stands out in its neighborhood for being very united, mutually supportive and responsible. The members are possessed of a great enterprising spirit since they are up-to-date with their payments and expect to finish this phase having complied very well with their responsibilities with the institution. 

Mrs. Digna has raised farm animals since she was a young girl. She is a hard-laboring and enterprising woman. She fights to get ahead and hopes to give her family members a better future through her work. She is seeking the loan for the purchase of feed for her animals, as well as medications which they may need. She believes that the help which Fundación Paraguay could give her would be of great assistance in order to increase her earnings.
