loans.use: to purchase feed and medicines for farm animals.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda tiene 50 años, resiD. en la localidad D. Huaylahuichan. Ahí formó su familia desD. hace 32 años, junto a su esposo Juan, quien ahora está en el país D. Argentina. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 D. ellos en una casa alquilada. La bodega D. Olinda es la primera en abrirse en su Pueblo, desD. las 6 D. la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo D. la variedad D. la mercadería que tiene no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad D. que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse D. las cosas que suceden en su Pueblo, lleva 3 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro D. su tienda, sin poder salir. Pero sabe que su mayor distracción es la agricultura. Ya que en los 3 terrenos agrícolas heredados por parte D. su esposo, siembra 2 veces al año; maíz y arveja y gracias a sus cuidados logra obtener una buena cosecha. Con el tiempo, anhela hacer crecer su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Victoria”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donD. está contenta D. recibir el apoyo financiero que tanto necesita. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Olinda D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en surtir su tienda D. comestibles, comprando los productos más solicitados en este mes.
texts.en:
Olinda, 50, lives in the town of Huaylahuichan, where 32 years ago she formed a family with her husband, Juan, who is now in Argentina.  They have five children, but only two are living with them in their rental house.  The store that Olinda established was the first in her town.  It opens at 6 in the morning to receive the first early shoppers, who know there is always a variety of merchandise to buy and they will find what they are looking for.  

What she likes most about her work is talking to the customers and learning about what goes on in her town.  She has been in this business for three years and feels that the most difficult part of her job is staying in the store all day without being able to leave.  But she knows that her greatest pastime is agriculture.  She has three patches of farmland that she inherited through her husband.  She grows corn and peas two times a years and obtains a good crop because of her hard work.  

In the future she would like to grow her business and give her customers better service.  She belongs to the communal bank "Victoria" and this is her second loan through MFP.  She is grateful for the financial support she needs and is committed to paying it back on time, as she did with the other one.  Being part of the communal bank is important to her because all the members are responsible and supportive.  Olinda plans to use the loan to buy more goods for her store, especially the ones in more demand this month.

loans.use: To buy products for her store.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina vive en la  localidad de Ajilho, ella es madre soltera con una hija de cinco meses de edad de nombre Ana Gabriela.
   Ella dedica  a la elaboración de bordados de manta y esta  vez invertirá el préstamo en la compra y venta ganado para luego venderlo en la misma localidad en este negocio apenas lleva cinco meses y comenta que le está dando un buen resulto  ya que ha visto un mejor ingreso.
Desde que se casó ella se dedicaba al bordado, sin embargo hace unos meses du esposo la abandono  y decidió  trabajar algo que en realidad le dé buenas ganancias con la que pueda salir adelante, es por ello que ahora quiere invertir en ganado, sin dejaqr de trabajar el bordado de mantas que es con lo que ha esto apoyando en su hogar.
     Lo que desea es que con el préstamo y  su negocio pueda tener una mejor calidad  de vida para sacar adelante a su pequeña hija que aun esta creciendo.
texts.en:
Cristina lives in the town of Ajilho.  She is a single mother and has a 5 month-old daughter called Ana Gabriela.

Cristina embroiders blankets and, on this occasion, she will invest her loan in buying livestock which she will later sell in the same town.  She has been in this business for barely five months but she tells us that it is providing her with good results as she has seen her income improve.

Cristina has been embroidering since she got married.  Some months ago, her husband left her and she decided to work on something that makes her good profits so that she can get ahead in life.  She would like to invest in livestock but without stopping her work embroidering blankets as it is through this work that she has been managing to support her family.

What Cristina would like is, through this loan and her business, to be able to enjoy a better quality of life and get her young daughter, who is still growing, ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy livestock which she will later sell in the same town

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is still single and does not have children yet. He runs a clothing sales business at Mutindwa in Nairobi. He has been in this business for 10 years now and he says his major challenge is financial constraints. He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy clothes to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and in the future open a shop in the Central Business District. He describes himself as honest, sincere and focused.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Vy (in the photo) is a mason. His wife is now a garment worker. They have been married since 1997 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. The family lives in a village about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. 

Vy is requesting a loan of $500 to put an addition on the house where he lives.

loans.use: To put an addition on the house where he lives.

loans.name: Silvia Margarita

texts.es: Silvia Margarita de cincuenta y seis años de edad, habita en su casa con su esposo José y su hijo. Silvia es una mujer trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado poner una pequeña tortillería en su hogar de residencia. Ya tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse a este negocio ya que gracias a su carisma y buen servicio las personas cada día la prefieren más. Además cuenta con la ventaja de que es la única persona que vende tortillas en la zona donde habita. Silvia es de las mujeres que no les gusta estar sin hacer nada. Para ella lo más importante es su trabajo y su familia. Ya que del trabajo depende el bienestar de la familia. Últimamente ha estado pensando en la posibilidad de aumentar la oferta de sus deliciosas tortillas ya que  su sueño es mejorar su situación económica y la de su familia. A partir de todo esto ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar los principales insumos (maíz, agua, leña, gas propano)  para la elaboración de sus deliciosas tortillas. De esta manera espera tener la oportunidad de acceder a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Silvia Margarita is 56 and lives in her home with her husband, José, and her son.  Silvia is a very hard-working woman, and through her hard work, she has managed to start a small tortilla-making business in her home.  She has had this business for a long time since thanks to her charisma and good service, people prefer her business more every day.  She also has the advantage of being the only person that sells tortillas in the area where she lives.  Silvia is a woman who doesn’t like not to be doing anything.  For her, the most important things are work and her family, since her family’s well-being depends on her work.  Lately, she has thought about the possibility of increasing the sales of her delicious tortillas since her dream is to improve her family’s economic situation.  To do this, she has decided to request a loan from Integral to buy the main supplies (corn, water, firewood, and propane gas) to make her delicious tortillas.  In this way, she hopes to have the opportunity to achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, propane gas, etc.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 54 years old, married and with two children who go to school.  To earn a living, he runs butchery.  He has been in the business for two years and has employed two people.  He also does dairy farming for more income generation.  He has improved his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya.
John hopes to improve his business and meet his customers’ demands comfortably.  He has requested for a loan of 9, 000 Kenya shillings to buy a solar lamp for lighting his house.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Kudratullo

texts.ru: Кудратулло проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 64 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Кудратулло уже четыре года как занимается животноводством. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа бычка.
texts.en: Kudratullo lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 64 years old, married and has three children. Kudratullo has been raising livestock for the last four years. He purchases calves and raises them for further sale. He would like to take out this loan to purchase another calf.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Houng

texts.en:
Mrs. Houng is an intelligent and conscientious businesswoman. She is the 56-year-old mother of five lovely children; one of her children is already married and lives in a separate house, the other four are all single. Presently, she farms rice and corn in Baray District, Kompong Thom Province, Cambodia.  She learned how to farm from her parents and has been a farmer since 1980.

Now, she faces challenges like insect plagues and crop illnesses, as well as changes in the climate. She is requesting this loan through HKL, a Kiva partner, to buy agricultural supplies, pesticide and fertilizers.  She is very grateful for the loans she has received because, thanks to them, she was also able to fix up her house and buy some other things she needed.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, fertilizers, and other agricultural supplies

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Валентина проживет вместе со своей семьей в городе Мелитополе. У нее есть собственный бизнес. Валентина имеет точку на привокзальном рынке. Продает продукты питание и разные сладости. На этот товар всегда есть спрос, поэтому Валентина выбрала это направление.  Она занимается этим делом 11 лет. 

На рост бизнеса повлияли предприимчивость и умение правильно вести бизнес. Валентина всегда вежлива и доброжелательна с клиентами. Ее бизнес  цель - расширить «границы» бизнеса и при возможности открыть новую точку. 

Валентина просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 15,000 гривен на увеличение ассортимента кондитерских изделий. Увеличивши доход  Валентина сможет улучшить бытовые условия своей семьи.
texts.en: Valentina lives together with her family in the town of Melitopol.  She has her own business.  Valentina has a retail outlet at the train station market.  She sells food products and various sweets.  There is always demand for these products, and this is why Valentina chose to focus on this business.  She has been involved in this business for 11 years.  Her entrepreneurship and the ability to run the business right affected the business growth.  Valentina is always polite and kind to her customers.  Her business goal is to expand business "borders" and possibly open another retail outlet.  Valentina is requesting a loan in the sum of 15,000 hryvnia to expand the assortment of candy goods.  Having increased her income, Valentina would be able to improve her family's household conditions.

loans.use: to expand the assortment of candy goods

loans.name: Tinna

texts.en: Tinna  is 42 years old and livers in the Saint Paul area. She is  married and has four children between 10 and 19 years old. All of them live with her and are presently in school. For the past five years she been in the charcoal business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She hopes to build herself a house. Some of the problems she faces are during the rainy season.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.en:
Cornelio is 63 years old, widowed, and has four adult children. He is from the city of Pantaon Ozamis City. To make a living, Cornelio raises crops. His main source of income comes from planting and harvesting root crops and bananas to sell. Cornelio has been engaged in his business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

Cornelio joined GDMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Cornelio is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This will be Cornelio's third loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated with this loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase banana fertilizer

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. Juliet has a business of a retail shop. She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven days out of every week. Juliet sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. 

Juliet has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, and cooking oil. The main business challenges for Juliet include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to own a delivery van to ease her transportation. Juliet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, cartons of salt, and cooking oil

loans.name: Mwamunga

texts.en:
Mwamunga has operated a firewood-selling business for the past two years, selling his wares to members of the local community. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of selling firewood in wholesale.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, he wants to purchase more bundles of firewood to offer for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access funds in order to expand his business.

Mwamunga and his wife have two school-going children. His wife is a tailor who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood to offer for sale

loans.name: Amour

texts.en:
Amour is a married woman with no children. She's had a business of selling food stuff in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Amour requested this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase sugar and soda. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase soda and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a greengrocer who lives in Malindi. She began her business 15 years ago when she opened a stall where she sold tomatoes and oranges. Sidi learned of Milango from her friends and joined the organization to access funding.

Sidi is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase grocery stock such as tomatoes, onions, oranges, and other items. The extra income from her loan will help her to meet her family's needs. In the future, Sidi looks forward to opening her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, and oranges to sell

loans.name: Mabel Noemy

texts.es:
Mabel, tiene la necesidad de comprar más mercadería para el negocio, por eso está solicitando un nuevo préstamo e invertirlo en materia prima como maíz, chicharrón, aceite, bebidas, para la producción de pupusas, esperando tener buenas ventas en lo que va del año.
Mabel considera que el préstamo anterior fue una gran ayuda para fortalecer y mejorar el negocio, gracias a Dios esto también ha sido un beneficio para su familia.
texts.en: Mabel needs to purchase more merchandise for her business.  She is requesting a new loan to invest in raw materials such as rice, chicharrón [cooked pork ground to a paste consistency], oil, and soft drinks to make pupusas (a traditional Salvadorian corn tortilla filled with cheese, pork meat, and refried beans).  She has had good sales so far this year.  Mabel believes that the previous loan was a great help in strengthening and improving her business.  Thanks to God, it has also been a benefit to her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn, [cooked pork ground to a paste consistency], oil, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Aníbal

texts.en:
Anibal is a tailor who runs a shop out of his home. He makes men’s suits and formal clothing which he sells to the people in his community. He needs a loan in order to increase his production for the upcoming holiday season. He also wants to make investments to his shop that will allow him to sell to retailers. He wants to buy a couple more sewing machines so he can hire a staff. He is 50 years old but does not have a family.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy new sewing machines and fabric

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh's husband had cardiac problems 8 years ago, and the family spent much money to save him, so now they have no land left. Today he can hardly walk and watches the house while Anh sells at the market. Fortunately the neighbors are very helpful. The family has received a scholarship to keep their 2 children at school. Until recently the total family income was only $32 per month.

They have repaid a first loan of $50, so they freed themselves from usurious loans, for which they spent $10 per month for interest only. Progressively their family income has risen to $38 (+19%).

Today they want another loan of $50 to consolidate their position. Later, their long term wish is to rent 2 hectares of land to plant cassava.

loans.use: Vegetable retail stand in the local market, plus sale of lottery tickets.

loans.name: Susana Neh

texts.en:
Susana Neh, aged 71, is one of the wives of Nde N. and a mother of two boys and two daughters. Her source of motivation is from difficulties she has with her health and the inability of some of her children to take care of her in old age. She was trained in business management and was given a loan of $30 as start-off capital. Since then, she has received loans amounting to $1250 over a period of five years, in which she has proven her credit-worthiness. She constantly supplies the community with fresh vegetables from her garden.

Given a loan of $1200, she plans to maintain and let a business site on a piece of land that she inherited from her family, through which she will have a monthly allowance. Given the fact that the land is located at the centre of commercial activities, the community will benefit from a profitable business location.

She plans to pay the loan in 24 months. The first loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Maintenance of business accommodation to let

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en: Lubov’s small clothing sales business does more than just help provide for her and her husband Nicolai’s basic needs. It is helping Nicolai fight for his health in a battle with cancer. Much of the income that Lubov earns through her business is going to help pay for cancer treatment for Nicolai. Lubov is grateful for the success she has had in her business and for the money she is able to earn. She has been in the clothing business for ten years and currently maintains around US$1,600 worth of inventory. She makes about US$300 profit each month. Lubov has requested a loan of US$500 that will allow her to purchase additional inventory.

loans.use: Purchase of inventory

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.en:
I have some unfinished construction and I need to put on a concrete roof. It has been a bit difficult due to lack of money, but I am working a lot in order to get it and expand my house. I am asking for $900.00 dollars to put a concrete roof on my house.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo una construcción sin terminar y necesito poner techo de concreto, me ha sido un poco difícil por falta de dinero pero estoy trabajando mucho para lograrlo y ampliar más mi vivienda” Solicito $ 900.00 dlls para poner techo de concreto en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Construction with Slabrock

loans.name: Maria Gertrudys

texts.es:
Hi, my name is María A.. I have made and sold tortillas for 10 years. I have this business in my house. I make my sales by taking orders from various restaurants in my neighborhood. My daughter helps me deliver the orders in the afternoon after she comes home from school. Right now I need to buy firewood and corn. I don't have much left right now to make the tortillas, so I am losing sales. I would be very grateful if you could help me as soon as possible because I have a lot of expenses with my family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Hola mi nombre es Maria A., yo eleboro y vendo tortillas hace 10 años. Este negocio lo tengo en mi casa. Pero vendo por pedidos a varios restaurantes y mis neborhood. Mi jçhija me ayuda a repartir los pedidos por la tarde despues que regresa del colegio. En estos momentos necesito comprar: lecña, maiz. Ya que no tengo mucho para poder elaborar las tortillas y estoy perdiendo de vender. Les agradesco me ayuden lo mas pronto posible.,poque tengo variso gastos con mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, salt, lime, and corn.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mrs. Mercy O. is 40 years old and married with five children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells cooked food, drinks and provisions in her shop. She has learned this business from her mother since childhood and she has 10 years of experience in this business. She is seeking a loan of $525 to enable her to buy more foodstuffs, drinks and provisions to sell.

loans.use: Mercy would like to buy more rice, beans and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor H. H. is a married mother of two kids. She works with her husband in a micro-company dedicated to the fabrication of metal mesh used to cover damps to prevent rocks or other material from falling. They have been in business for 6 years.

Their main source of income comes from proposals they submit to the municipalities, which utilize their materials at constructions sites and others.

GAMABOL is the social reason of their company, which is one of the main suppliers of construction material in the El Alto City.

They work from their facilities at home and they purchase materials directly from the distributors who import them into the zone. They are always very careful with the quality of their products. Leonor need the capital to purchase large quantities of materials, so she can have enough to supply the new contracts that are coming their way. Their demand increases in the rainy season for obvious uses of their product to contain flooding and other rain damages.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

Leonor H. H., casada y madre de dos hijos, se dedica a trabajar con su esposo en una microempresa de su propiedad, dedicada a la fabricación de gaviones y mallas olímpicas y que administran hace ya 6 años.

Su principal actividad es la presentación a licitaciones municipales para la adjudicación de contratos de construcción y otros.

GAMABOL es la razón social de su empresa, que es una de las más importantes proveedoras de materiales de construcción en la ciudad de El Alto.

Actualmente el taller funciona dentro de su propio domicilio, y la compra de material se realiza de forma directa con empresas importadoras, cuidando siempre la calidad del acabado de los trabajos encargados. Por tal motivo, Leonor requiere de capital para poder invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de materiales, con el fin de preparar su taller para las licitaciones próximas a lanzarse, en vista de la llegada de la temporada de lluvias.

loans.use:
Leonor wants the loan to invest in the purchase of the materials she needs, she wants to get her work area ready for the upcoming rainy season.

Leonor requiere de capital para poder invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de materiales, con el fin de preparar su taller para las licitaciones próximas a lanzarse, en vista de la llegada de la temporada de lluvias.

loans.name: Lugoba A 2021(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah Nambasa. She is currently in the business of tailoring and selling clothes and is requesting a loan of UGX 900,000 to buy more cloth materials. Sarah is a 40 year old widow with 6 children ranging from age 8 to 24, all of whom go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 30,000 in profit and combined with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for the family's basic needs.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Joan A., Juliet M., Deborah N., and Farida N.. Joan A. is currently in the business of selling fresh foods and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to increase her stock.

Juliet M. is currently in the business of running a salon and is requesting a loan of UGX 700,000 to buy more hair oil.

Deborah N. is currently in the business of selling used clothing and is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to add to her stock.

Farida N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to buy a fridge and more shop items.

loans.use: To buy more cloth materials and fabrics

loans.name: Halima's Group

texts.en:
My name is Halima M.. I am from a small city, Arifwala, Pakistan. I have four kids: three boys and one girl.

Last year, I borrowed 15000 ($250) for my husband‘s crockery business from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. He sells crockery on his cart. This time, we need another loan for the same business.

I have four other women in my loan group. Raheela N. needs this loan for her hosiery business. Kaneez S. , who is borrowing for the second time, will again invest in her son’s auto repair workshop. Safia L. requires this loan for her husband to start a grocery store. Rafia S. will invest her share of the loan in her father’s grocery store. I have known these women for a long time and completely trust them.

loans.use: Expand crockery business

loans.name: Anselma Jesus

texts.es:
Mrs. Anselma Jesús García R. is 35 years old. She began studying for a career in nursing, but wasn't able to finish. She has three dependent children. She lives in the El Milagro sector in Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú.

Mrs. Anselma has set aside space in her home for a general store where she sells basic necessities, sodas, sweets, and beer. Seventeen years ago she opened her store with just a few products that she has increased over time. Three years ago she closed for a brief time due to poor health, but in spite of that she has continued ahead and reestablished the shop.

She belongs to the interim group "Amor y Paz" (Love and Peace) where she received her first loan for $100. With this money, she bought the basic goods she needs to stock her store.

With this loan for $200, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, a can of oil, toilet paper, a package of noodles, and other groceries.

Her greatest dream is to open a cevichería, a restaurant serving the typical Latin American seafood dish ceviche, a service demanded by many people.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Anselma Jesús García R. tiene 35 años de edad, estudio la carrera de enfermería pero no la pudo terminar . Tiene tres hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el sector El Milagro en el distrito de Trujillo provincia de la misma en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. La señora Anselma ha ambientado un lugar en su casa para colocar una bodega en la que vende productos de primera necesidad, gaseosas, golosinas y cerveza. Hace 17 años que abrió su bodega con pocos productos con el tiempo fue incrementando. Hace tres años cerro por un tiempo debido a que se había puesto mal de salud. A pesar de eso ella sigue adelante y se ha reestablecido. Ella pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Amor y Paz” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro varios productos de primera necesidad para surtir la tienda. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 el cual será cancelado en cuatro meses comprará un saco de arroz, un saco de azúcar, una lata de aceite, papel higiénico, un paquete de fideos y demás abarrotes. Su mayor sueño es poner una cebichería en su domicilio, ya que mucha gente le ha solicitado.

loans.use: Purchase additional necessities to stock her general store, particularly groceries.

loans.name: Myrian

texts.en:
Myrian B. de Fretes (47) is divorced and lives with her daughter who is 10 years old. Myrian works very hard to send her daughter to school. Both live in Nemby.

Myrian owns a sewing shop, where she makes clothes for women, such as cardigans, pants, T-shirts and others. Before her divorce, Myrian’s economic situation was much better. Her husband helped her buy the required machines. But after the divorce, her husband took all of them away from Myrian. As a result, she needed to start all over again.

Myrian sells her products to different customers from the neighborhood. In addition, she sells to various fashion shops.

She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of a sewing machine to improve the quality of her clothes.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Phany Pin Group

texts.en: Mrs. Phany P. is the leader of a group of five in Sala Lek Pram Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Phany P. is a silk weaver in the local village and she now faces an economic problem because she does not have enough money to buy silk to weave. Thus, Mrs. Phany P. is asking for a loan to buy more raw materials. Her husband, Mr. Lina Vann, owns a small restaurant where he sells Chinese noodles to the villagers. Mrs. Phany P. and her husband have one child who is too young to work or study. Mrs. Phany P. has obtained a loan from AMK previously, to buy silk to weave. One of the group's members, Mrs. Sokhim Y., is not in the picture but her husband is.

loans.use: Buy silk to weave in order to improve her living condition.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel U. is 31 years old and is married. He lives in Benin City, Nigeria. He sells stationery and men's underwear. He learned this business in 3 years and started his own business in 2005.

Daniel needs a loan of $875 USD to buy more stationery and men's underwear to sell. He has been a LAPO client for the past 2 years.

loans.use: To buy more stationery and men's underwear to sell

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Mr. Hun S. is a farmer in Sovong Leur Village in Kampong Speu Province. His wife, Mrs. Sokhon Bel, is a garment factory worker and she helps her husband in the field when she has free time. Mr. Hun S. is 24 years old without any children. On his farm, Mr. Hun S. has an obstacle because he does not have enough animals to plow so he decided to ask for a loan to buy cows to use as draft animals. His wife is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy cows to use as draft animals.
